Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

11 years from our humble beginnings as the founders of Fruitridge Health & Wellness in Sacramento, Connected now maintains a portfolio of proprietary top-shelf cannabis genetics cultivated in state-of-the-art grow facilities. We are proud to be the largest grower of premium flower in California.

With three retail doors in California, recent expansion into Arizona and national expansion plans in motion, we operate one of the fastest growing, vertically integrated cannabis companies in the country.

Our mission has remained the same since day one: To breed, grow and sell the best cannabis in the world. This commitment to deliver at the absolute pinnacle comes to life in the standards we hold our product, our people, and our partners to every day.

Proprietary genetics cultivated with cutting-edge technology and over 100 years of combined plant cultivation experience has earned our flower the highest wholesale price in any major legal market. Our continued curiosity can be traced back to an early obsession with R&D that poured resources into what is now one of the most advanced cannabis breeding programs in the world.

In 2017, we welcomed Alien Labs to the Connected family; a partnership built on the foundation of like-minded quality standards and the desire to raise those standards across the industry.

Today, a new emphasis on elevated experiences will ride in tandem with geographical and menu expansion on the fast paced and thrilling road ahead for the entire Connected family of brands.

About The Job

We are seeking a Data Analyst to be a key contributor in driving analytics as well as building and maintaining reporting across all departments at Connected, all the way from raw data to actionable and presentable reporting. This position will use BI tools and business acumen to build on our position as a leading data driven cannabis company. This is a remote position, but candidates must be based in Northern California, and be able to come to Sacramento as needed.

What You Will Do

Become a subject matter expert and go-to source on the company’s KPIs and metrics. Define, develop, and own reporting to help stakeholders drive better business decisions according to your insights.
Work with our analytics team to maintain and improve upon existing Tableau reporting
Develop, implement, and maintain strategies for accurate and consistent reporting
Communicate data driven solutions to business problems to stakeholders including senior leadership

What We Are Looking For

Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills and/or Abilities):

Must be 21+ years of age
4 year college degree required
0-3 years experience in an analytics or otherwise quantitative role required, preferably with a CPG company
Tableau or Power BI experience strongly preferred
SQL experience preferred
CRM experience preferred
Excellent quantitative skills
Comfort with a fast-paced environment and changing requirements.
Comfortable learning new technologies.
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal.

Compensation

Compensation Description (annually): The starting salary range for this position in the selected area is $80,000.00 to $90,000.00 annually.

Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the total compensation package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work.

Physical Requirements/Work Environment

Requires normal, corrective vision range, the ability to see color and the ability to distinguish letters, numbers and symbols
Requires manual dexterity to operate job related equipment
Requires normal hearing range

Why Connected?

Connected is an exciting and innovative workplace with a highly engaged workforce brought together by a shared passion to be the best in the business. We are on a mission to breed, grow and sell the best cannabis in the world! This is a super unique opportunity to be part of the start-up stage of the booming cannabis industry. We are looking for exceptional people to join our team as we transition into the next phase of our business ventures and become a leader in the cannabis space.

Competitive Pay and Stock Options
401(k), Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance
Paid Vacation Time (Flexible Vacation policy for exempt positions)
Career Growth and Internal Advancement Opportunities
Chance to work in an exciting new start-up industry with awesome people!

Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the total compensation package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work.

Physical Requirements/Work Environment
  • Requires normal, corrective vision range, the ability to see color and the ability to distinguish letters, numbers and symbols
  • Requires manual dexterity to operate job related equipment
  • Requires normal hearing range
Why Connected?

Connected is an exciting and innovative workplace with a highly engaged workforce brought together by a shared passion to be the best in the business. We are on a mission to breed, grow and sell the best cannabis in the world! This is a super unique opportunity to be part of the start-up stage of the booming cannabis industry. We are looking for exceptional people to join our team as we transition into the next phase of our business ventures and become a leader in the cannabis space.
  • Competitive Pay and Stock Options
  • 401(k), Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance
  • Paid Vacation Time (Flexible Vacation policy for exempt positions)
  • Career Growth and Internal Advancement Opportunities
  • Chance to work in an exciting new start-up industry with awesome people!

Title: Jr Data Analyst
Description:
ALOHA NEWLY GRADUATES!!

TEKsystems is searching for a Junior Data Analyst, must be comfortable to work onsite 3 days a week/ 2 days remotely.

Description

Responsible for working with customer data for upcoming program rollout. This individual is also responsible for performing the analytical data support needs on all assigned projects through the design and implementation of data analysis using a variety of methodologies and data sources. He or she should have basic knowledge of SQL, Python, or some form of coding language, some experience in a work setting.

This Individual Will Work On The Following

Process data for direct mail (email, letters and postcards) for customer communication and rollout of advanced meters
Manage all reporting related to customer communication
Develop and implement other customer related programs that leverage and/or is part of advanced meter implementation
Work closely with Information Technology and other departments as well as outside vendor to test and implement programs

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

Brooksource is seeking a Junior Data Analyst e to join our Fortune 90 financial services client within their Chief Data Organization in the Charlotte, NC area. This is a great opportunity for someone who is eager to join an award-winning team, passionate about data and system analytics with the interest in looking at types of data to reorganize and present dependent on what the need is. An ideal candidate is highly organized with good communication skills who can manage multiple tasks simultaneously and to be able to respond to and manage unplanned priorities in a fast-paced environment.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

Build frameworks and reusable components for data acquisition and integration going across structured and unstructured data sources
Use data to find new efficiencies and decrease data duplication across the company
Scan assets, pulling payment information, and inputting into corresponding applications
Create data standards and patterns for others to use across the company
Communicate with business and other technology teams onshore and offshore
Present data stories to business leaders
Monitor and analyze existing processes to identify enhancement opportunities
Assist with troubleshooting issues and providing end-to-end technical solutions quickly and accurately
Handle complex operational tasks and recommends processing and tech changes with minimal supervision
Maintain knowledge of emerging technologies




REQUIRED SKILLS:

B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science, Data Science, Management Information Systems (MIS) or similar field or equivalent experience and work record
1+ years working within a SQL database
1+ years working with Excel
1+ years of data mining or data comparison experience
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment
Ability to manage multiple projects without continuous direction
Ability to function effectively and proficiently in an environment of ongoing change
Proactive self-starter with the ability to work well under pressure, prioritize and multitask.
Experience working directly with technology, business stakeholders/leadership in formulating technical requirements




DESIRED SKILLS:

Experience in the financial services industry, particularly within a data environment and/or data governance group
Knowledge in designing and building SQL apps on Oracle, Teradata, HBase and Hive/Impala
Knowledge within data integration and ETL components
1+ years building Tableau dashboards and visuals to create data stories




VALUE ADD TO YOU:

Experience in a Fortune 90 Financial Services Firm
Director level exposure and mentorship
Close-knit junior-level team
Supplemental customized training

Title: Data Visualization Analyst
Description:
Arraya Solutions, a leading Mid-Atlantic technology consulting firm, is looking for Data Visualization Analyst to join our team!




We are a culture that embraces change, values family and are actively involved with the community. Our team consists of people with positive attitudes who are interested in growing their knowledge around technology and leaders that are heavily involved in day-to-day activities.




This is an excellent opportunity to help build out the expanding competencies for the practice including data visualization, data warehousing, and value-based data driven decision best practices. You will be leading large projects across Fortune 250 clients driving value through data centric solutions.




Responsibilities




Work closely with our clients as part of a development team to evaluate requirements and develop business intelligence and data warehousing solutions.
Work with consultants to design and develop various ETL, data ingestion, and data warehouse mappings, and architectures.
Coordinate activities with data source application owners to ensure integration and data integrity.
Design and develop reports, dashboards, KPIs, and data extracts
Be responsible for overall project lifecycle, scope, KPIs, SOW, and engagement with the client.




Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree required or other professional equivalent experience
Minimum 2+ years of hands on development of dashboards and reports
6+ years of project management/people leadership experience
Experience with data warehouse platforms including Snowflake, SQL, etc.
Experience with Data Visualization tools including Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Qlik, etc.
Good knowledge of standard concepts, best practices, and procedures within a data warehousing and business intelligence environment.
Excellent organizational and communication skills to work in a fast-paced environment and manage and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously
Ability to work well in a team of 2 to 5 consultants.
A commitment to inclusion and diversity, and openness to new ideas and perspectives.




Preferred Qualifications




Experience working within a retail organization or corporate strategic planning group
Experience extracting data and generating insights from large transactional data sets
Familiarity with data mining & statistical methods (regression, factor analysis, clustering, etc)
Experience with creative data visualization techniques
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy to promote data quality
Skill in communicating effectively and professionally, both verbally and in writing
Excellent critical thinking, data manipulation and analytical skills
Ability to maintain confidentiality, handle sensitive data and a commitment to data security
Demonstrated ability to work independently and also collaboratively as a team member (or lead) on projects
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and competing priorities
Strong Excel skills, including the ability to use spreadsheets, graphing, tables, calculations and automation efficiently to process large quantities of data relevant to the institution; specific skills include Power Query, pivot tables and reporting, macros and conditional formatting
Committed to continuous learning and applying new skills as technology evolves
Working SQL knowledge gained through prior work experience or coursework
Masters degree in Data Science/Analytics




Job Types: Full-time, Contract




Schedule




8 hour shift




Experience




Data visualization: 3 years (Preferred)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

"You've worked for the rest...now work for the best!"

Trinity Solar...recognized by NJ Biz as one of the top 250 private companies in 2022.

Trinity Solar...recognized as a top 2022 Solar Contractor by Solar world.

The Data Analyst will be responsible for writing SQL queries and procedures and developing Power BI dashboards. They will also obtain hands-on experience in being a part of the growing Data Analytical Team at Trinity Solar and should have experience working on complex technical or architectural design.

Job Category: Entry to senior level positions available.
Work locations: In office, remote, hybrid schedules available.
Salary Range: $60,000 - $200,000 commensurate with experience and education.

Roles & Responsibilities

Review and interpret ongoing business requirements.
Research required data.
Analyze existing SQL queries and write new queries.
Migrate data from Salesforce to SQL Server and from one SQL server environment to another for testing and development using ETL tools.
Help write and optimize Power BI SQL Statements and be familiar with DAX code.
Design and create interactive reports in Power BI and Excel.

Qualifications & Experience

BS/MS degree in Computer Science or related technical experience.
Experience in Power BI and SQL Server.
Experience in creation of complex dashboards.
Experience in writing SQL code used in Power BI.
Strong problem solving, T-SQL, SSIS packages, DAX formulas and debugging skills.
Experience with Agile development methodologies.
SaaS development experience.
Solid written and verbal communication skills.
Self-driven, pro-active.
Deliver end-to-end features on Power BI with focus on quality, reliability, and performance.
Good understanding of Data integration, Data Quality, and data architecture.
Experience creating calculated fields using DAX and Power Query transformations.
Hands-on development, with a willingness to troubleshoot and solve complex problems.
Strong verbal and written communications.

What We Offer

Not just a career... but a career path to success! Trinity Solar offers you a career in one of the fastest growing fields in the country. A career with Trinity Solar is a path to personal and professional growth with a company who truly values its employees. Our employees enjoy...

competitive compensation,
comprehensive benefits which include medical,
dental,
vision,
life insurance,
employee assistance program,
paid training,
a generous PTO program,
a 401k plan supported by a company match,
work-life balance
long term stability in a fast-growing industry
the satisfaction of knowing they are working for an organization leading the way in clean energy initiatives
and much MORE!

About Trinity Solar

Since 1994, Trinity Solar has proudly provided energy with integrity to families in our area. Trinity started in the solar industry with two core fundamental principles, to make renewable energy accessible and to make the solar journey seamless. These guiding beliefs have led Trinity Solar to become the United States largest privately-held residential solar installer, composed of more than 1,700 team members and boasting over 70,000 installations. Currently, Trinity offers solar installation in Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, New Jersey, New York, Massachusetts, Maryland, Pennsylvania, and Rhode Island.

Trinity Solar is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Consistent with that goal, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

"Veteran Friendly"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Skillz




Skillz is the leading mobile games platform dedicated to bringing out the best in everyone through competition.




The gaming industry is larger than movies, music, and books, with more than 2.7 billion gamers playing monthly and 10 million developers worldwide. Mobile is the fastest-growing segment of the gaming market, expected to increase from $86 billion last year to $161 billion in 2025.




As the first publicly-traded (NYSE: SKLZ) mobile esports platform, Skillz has pioneered the future of the gaming industry, by accelerating the convergence of sports, video games and media for an exploding mobile-first audience worldwide. The Skillz platform empowers developers to create multi-million dollar franchises by enabling social competition in their games. Leveraging its patented technology, Skillz hosts billions of casual esports tournaments for millions of mobile players worldwide, with the goal of building the home of competition for all. Skillz has earned recognition as one of Fast Company’s Best Workplaces for Innovators, CNBC’s Disruptor 50, Forbes’ Next Billion-Dollar Startups, Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, and the number-one fastest-growing company in America on the Inc. 5000. www.skillz.com




Analyst Program At Skillz




As a Product/Data Analyst you will be a part of the Analytics professionals at Skillz, and you will work in domains such as:




Designing, launching, and measuring new features on the Skillz ecosystem
Running impactful A/B experiments to optimize the user experience
Understanding trends in user satisfaction and feedback
Driving improvements in internal processes and systems to enable the company to scale
Assessing and improving game performance and player engagement of Skillz games




Overall you will function as a data-driven decision maker and executor, and deliver recommendations and events to drive Skillz forward. As a proven contributor at Skillz, you will ultimately have the ability to focus your path to domains that interest you and where there is a need for action-oriented strategic thinkers.




Your Responsibilities




Drive highly visible strategic projects, collaborating cross-functionally to structure problems, understand opportunities, and develop solutions
Flawlessly execute a roadmap of feature releases finding ways to learn from and engage our players to optimize their retention and lifetime value
Own key areas of the business front-to-end, including execution and follow-through on product development initiatives
Use storytelling skills to persuasively communicate your recommendations to senior executives and other stakeholders
Support our understanding of customer behaviors and life cycles, such as user engagement, conversion, and churn
Design, develop, and share reports and dashboards used by the entire company every day




Your Skillz




2+ years experience
Experience with SQL
Inquisitive mindset with a major in marketing, business, economics, statistics, engineering, or mathematics preferred but not required
Experience performing quantitative and strategic analysis (preferably in product development, consumer marketing, or consulting preferred but not required
Experience leading cross-functional initiatives that require significant collaboration between different departments, including both technical and business teams
Self-starter with a ‘don’t take no for an answer’ attitude and strong communication skills
Ability to solve unstructured problems independently by developing and applying appropriate frameworks or techniques
Honesty in developing and sharing insights gained from our user data
Experience using data visualization platforms and connecting data insights to strategy
Location: Work will be in office in San Francisco or Las Vegas




Compensation Range




$65,000 - $115,000




Skillz embraces diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to diversifying our workforce, we do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, sex, gender, gender identity, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, or disability status, and we operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary: As a member of the HRIS team, this role will be responsible for and focus on HRIS systems production support, access management, data quality, strategic HR technology vision and process/technology improvement initiatives to support the broader global Employee Success objectives and ultimately, the company's growth.




Employee Success (ES) is made up of human resources (HR) professionals who come together to continue to build the organization with a goal of helping our employees do the best work of their lives. In Employee Success, we attract and retain the top talent critical to building out our organization. Whether we are recruiting the next great candidate for our company, building out new programs, or refining our current operations, Employee Success is passionate about the design, development and delivery of a world-class employee experience, which allows us to deliver a world-class customer experience in the market.




Duties:

Production support for HRIS systems portfolio to include Workday, force.com, HackerRank and any new applications that are implemented within the organization
Manage and resolve Tier 3 case escalations within SLA, providing high quality and accurate solutions
Manage user access and system security using principle of least privilege and best practices to ensure strict data security and integrity for all HR systems
Complete regular audits to ensure maintenance of data privacy and security assignments
Support business User Acceptance Testing (UAT) with data staging and troubleshooting to ensure changes to HR systems or reliant on HR systems are functioning properly
Engage effectively with cross-functional and global teams (such as Enterprise Operations, Shared Services, Recruitment, Release Management and others) to identify, escalate and resolve key risks and issues as well as build strong working relationships as a trusted advisor.
Support SOX and compliance initiatives to ensure adherence to internal/external compliance standards
Support HR Technology strategy and request backlog to ensure alignment of HR IT projects to overall strategic vision
Proactively Identify and lead process improvement initiatives in relation to process documentation & process maturity to achieve operational excellence
Lead and participate in related projects such as Mergers and Acquisitions, system related projects, and other project rollouts
Maintain acceptable level of teamwork by incorporating a positive attitude, a sense of humor, being supportive in words and actions, embodying the culture of the company
Communicating at all levels both within the existing team & anyone outside the direct reporting structure
Other duties as required




Desired Skills/Experience:

3+ years previous experience in human resources shared services environment or equivalent with a strong understanding of HR processes and Technology
Systematic thinker with high degree of proficiency in Workday, Salesforce Service Cloud, applicant tracking systems and other HR applications
1+ year experience in one or more of the following areas: project management, HR Workforce applications support, customer support, reporting
Bachelor's degree in a related field
Ability to think critically, analyze, and interpret employee/employment data and root cause analysis
Ability to problem solve, triage and work through production issues to come to resolution and determine root cause analysis
Ability to support the employee and customer experience through several communication vehicles (Case management system, e-mail, phone and chat)
Ability to manage multiple responsibilities in a fast-moving, high-volume environment while effectively managing time, prioritizing assignments and working within deadlines
Possess an aptitude toward process improvement and a willingness to proactively recommend new ways of doing work more efficiently
Well-organized with keen attention to detail with demonstrated effective follow-up skills
High degree of motivation and initiative to seek out additional responsibilities volunteering for special projects, identifying oneself as a go-to individual, flexibility with change and a passion for the team, the employee experience and the company
Regular and predictable attendance is required
Microsoft Excel experience required
Workday Certification is preferred or willingness to complete certification after hire
Salesforce Administrator Certification is preferred or willingness to complete after hire




Benefits:

Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance Plans
401K offered

Title: Data Analyst/Operations Associate
Description:
Title: Portfolio Administration - Data Analyst/Operations Associate

Company: Hedge Fund - Long short equity with $40 billion AUM




Description

Utilize advanced Excel, Sql, and/or Python skills in order to analyze very large volumes of trading data across multiple asset classes
Analyze and resolve issues that have been systematically reconciled for trading capture, settlement, and positions with prime brokers, executing brokers, and fund administrators
Participate in projects that enhance business operations, efficiency, and profitability utilizing trade data
Develop analytics and reporting for senior management
Resolve issues and manage relationships with vendors




Minimum Requirements

0-2 years of full-time trading middle office, operations, or portfolio administration
Demonstrated high proficiency in Excel skills is required
Ability to learn Sql and Python if the skill is not already acquired
Excellent problem solving skills
Willingness to take on multiple tasks
Bachelors degree in Economics, Accounting or Finance from a competitive program
Minimum GPA 3.4 or higher
Excellent communication skills and ability to manage relationships

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst II

Duration: 10 Months on W2 Contract with opportunity to extend or Conversion.

Location: 175 Greenwich Street, 3 World Trade Center, New York, NY

Pay: $54-$59/Hour




Description:

The person in this role will be responsible for development of the Brand Marketing Data Platform, supporting data integrations, ETL, and visualizations. They should have a strong understanding of key principles of data engineering, have experience building data pipelines, and setting up data governance for the marketing teams




Duties and Responsibilities:

Develop data models and build ETL architecture to support Marketing Data Science work
Research marketing platforms’ documentation, write integration requirements for the engineering team
Hand-on build data pipelines, including writing code in Python and SQL
Set up data quality monitoring, including notification systems, monitoring dashboards and issue resolution protocols
Analyze onboarded dataset to identify inconsistencies and proactively fix data issues
Collaborate with Data Engineering team, Data Operations, BI team, as well as partners’ POCs to ensure timely and trouble-free execution of the project.

Required Qualifications:

Proficiency in SQL and Python for data analysis/manipulation
4+ years of experience building data integrations, ETL, and data visualizations
Excellent ability to identify data inconsistencies, detect origins of anomalies, and find the most efficient solutions
Experience working with marketing data, preferably knowledge of marketing platforms’ campaign manager tools
Experience with Google Sheets/Drive API, Google App Scripts/JavaScript is a plus
Experience working with data engineering teams, ability to clearly formulate requirements and anticipate challenges
Ability to clearly communicate with stakeholders, internal, and external partners

Title: Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Responsibilities




This role uses data analytics and predictive modeling techniques to provide insight into company’s operational and revenue performance. This role suggests areas of business improvement and measures the impact of recommendations. Assists in executing analytical approaches and methodologies and interpretation of results. Collects and analyzes external data to make recommendations presented to the company. Works as part of a team presenting reports to management used in decision-making and strategic planning.




Assist in the development of KPIs, automated reporting, statistical analyses, corporate and departmental performance goals.
Drive value by contributing to the development of predictive models that forecast the impact of operational metrics to the overall network and its stakeholders.
Provide detailed analyses and recommendations using advanced statistical techniques to support strategic and operational projects.
Collaborate with other departments as needed to identify real-world frontline problems and deliver actionable data-driven solutions.
Produce relevant visualizations and draft narratives for weekly and monthly reporting.
Ensure absolute integrity of DOT Submittals, reported KPIs, and consistency of reported data.
Assist in continuous improvement of existing data structures and resolving data integrity issues.
Perform ad-hoc analyses to address current business questions, as needed.
May perform other responsibilities as assigned. Responsibilities and duties may change when circumstances dictate (e.g., emergencies change in workload, rush jobs, or technical developments).




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience (Analytics, Statistics, Math, Data Science or a related field).
1-3 years of experience.
Proficient in data querying and modeling languages such as SQL, R and Python.
Experience with Data Visualization tools like PowerBI or Tableau.
Aptitude in highly technical and data-intensive problem-solving, including the ability to work with multiple large-scale data sources.
Advanced Microsoft Office skills, specifically MS Excel (pivot tables, macros etc.) and Power Point.
Possess strong verbal and written communication skills and be able to articulate views convincingly.
Ability to provide accurate analysis under pressure.
Attention to detail with a drive for perfection in design and execution.
Direct and open, builds and sustains relationships with all stakeholders.
No travel required.
Exerts up to 10 lbs. of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects, including the human body. involves sitting most of the time but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.
Hybrid.
Please be advised that you will be asked to complete a required assessment to be considered for this position. This assessment will be emailed to you after you apply. Please be sure to check your Spam folder and/or junk mail if you do not receive it. *




We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits to our team members including medical, dental, STD, LTD, life insurance, 401(k), paid time off, travel benefits, and much more. We strive to maintain a professional, yet friendly environment and promote professional and career development for our Team Members.




Overview




At Spirit, our mission is to deliver the best value in the sky and be the most successful airline on Earth! We are leaders in providing customizable travel options and make it possible for our Guests to venture further and discover more than ever before by serving destinations throughout the U.S., Latin America, and the Caribbean! Imagine making your mark on an organization introducing 100’s of new aircraft that will double our fleet!




Fly With A Winner: We are proud to be recognized by Forbes as one of America’s Best Employers for Diversity 2022 and by LinkedIn as a Top Company in the Travel & Hospitality industry. Our constant growth and improvement means boundless career opportunities. Team Members develop their careers rapidly while building key skills that drive long-term success.
The Giving Spirit: We are committed to inspiring positive change in the cities where we work and live. That starts with giving back through Corporate Social Responsibility and The Spirit Airlines Charitable Foundation.
Be Yourself: We want Team Members to feel empowered to bring their whole self to work and contribute to our success – that’s why we’re committed to building progress in the areas of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging. Our Spirit Family is strong, not despite our differences, but because of them.
Travel The World: We offer competitive base salaries with robust health & welfare benefits, including travel & flight benefits for you and your family.




EEOC Statement




Spirit Airlines is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.  All aspects of employment are governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
US Tech Solutions is seeking an “Data Analyst” for a 3 Months contract position with a client in (Beaverton, OR – Hybrid)




Title: Data Analyst

Client: NIKE, Inc.

Duration: 3+ Month’s Contract with possible of extension depends upon client need

Location: Beaverton, Oregon (Hybrid Role)




Duties and Responsibilities

· Identifies and communicate open Purchase Orders to internal customers

· Determine method for Purchase Order closure and cancellation

· Liaises with internal and external vendors as it relates to specific data cleanse elements.

· Document process and create SOPs

· Utilize Nike procurement, financial, and accounting software systems such as Coupa, Aravo, Akritiv, and SAP.

· Assist with special projects and reports as needed

Skills

· Excellent organizational, written and communication skills

· Demonstrated proficiency in using Microsoft Office tools, with high mastery of Excel a plus

· Proven ability and desire to solve problems and look for opportunities for improvement

· Demonstrated experience tracking, validating, and support of invoices and payments.

· Experience with business software and analysis tools (SAP system a plus)

· Strong interpersonal skills in order to deal effectively with varied internal clients and external vendors

· Self-directed and comfortable working in ambiguous environments

Title: Junior Data Analyst (Online/Ecommerce)
Description:
Jr. Online Merchandise Data Analyst

Excellent opportunity to launch your career with a global Fortune 50 Company. Our client is seeking a high-achieving candidate to join our creative and dynamic organization.

You will be working on multiple projects that support strategy for our eCommerce site. This role is highly visible to the business; you will partner with several Director level executives.




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Running data and recommending if it makes financial and business sense to run promotions for specific products
Pricing analysis of current product performance
Competitor analysis of products
Manipulating data dumps- ability to utilize vlookups and pivot tables
Retail math to determine if we should onboard new products
Project Coordination




This is a 10 month contract opportunity with the possibility of extension or conversion to direct hire in the Atlanta area for you to gain exposure to the retail world by joining this upbeat, collaborative group! Enjoy a dynamic and high-energy team members, and the ability to learn and execute business skills. The team is working in the office on Tuesday and Wednesday however you can work 100% remote at this time if you are near Atlanta or willing to relocate to Atlanta in the future.




REQUIRED SKILLS:

1+ years of professional work experience
Bachelor's Degree in a related field (Finance, Marketing, Analytics, Industrial Engineering, etc.)
Data Analysis experience - highly analytical, comfortable working with numbers, able to provide a data-driven rationale
MS Excel - Strong Excel skills are a must - proficient with VLOOKUP and Pivot Tables - in the interview, you will take a live Excel eval on a PC to test your proficiency.
Ability to learn Retail Math (Markup, Margin, Sell Through, Initial Markup, etc.)
Excellent communication and presentation skills




PREFERRED SKILLS:

Retail experience




Must be authorized to work in the U.S./ Sponsorships are not available

Title: Associate Data Analyst / Full time (Remote)
Description:
The opportunity will assist with identifying, planning and implementing key projects to improve quality, reduce costs, increase productivity and improve cycle time by reducing wasted time, rework, etc. resulting in significant business improvement and customer satisfaction.

Key Accountabilities

Responsibilities will include supporting the development of business cases, problem statements, mapping processes, analyzing / interpreting data, identifying root causes, developing / implementing solutions and creating key performance indicators (KPIs) and controls to help maintain and sustain process improvements and drive efficiency gains.
Assist in driving end to end (E2E) accountability within a process and the organization by helping define and refine roles, responsibilities, clarity around process steps, and measuring within the process and between functional areas.
Maintain process maps, measurements and project updates in the respective systems. This will include tracking and maintaining a list of ongoing process improvements projects.
Support team members on process initiatives, data mining, and analysis.
The role will have the opportunity to collaboratively work across commodities (Gas & Electric) and jurisdictions (NY and MA) to assist in achieving organizational goals (OKRs). The team member will Participate in projects/initiatives with upstream and downstream departments to maximize accuracy and efficiency of servicing operations
End to end (E2E) process improvement will be using proven performance methodologies (Lean Six Sigma = LSS) and tools to develop data – driven decision making for senior management.
Act as a change agent while supporting cross-functional programs to identify, recommend and implement improvements to existing processes across all cross-functional teams.


Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree from college or university, preferably in engineering, business, finance, mathematics, economics, computer science, or related discipline with 0 – 2 years’ experience.
Gas and Electric utility knowledge a plus.
Excellent organizational, time management, interpersonal, collaboration, oral and written communication skills.
Strong team player, results orientated, dedication to excellence, strong attention to detail, and sense of urgency to achieve business objectives
Demonstrated ability to work with cross – functional teams.
Driven: Pro-active and self-motivated, inspiring enthusiasm about the business and engaging others to create a positive culture with high morale and strong performance with a focus on excellence and continuous improvement.
Working knowledge of MS Office – Outlook, Excel, Word & PowerPoint. Visio is a plus.
Ability to understand and analyze data; familiarity with analytical software (e.g. Power BI, SAP, Salesforce, Tableau, Minitab) a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Duration: 3-month contract to hire

Location: Littleton, CO (On-Site)




Our client is looking for a Data Analyst to join their Network Data and Analytics team. This team’s focus is twofold. This team is tasked with the optimization and validation of data sets and also serves to interface with RF engineers to translate key performance indicators from formula, into query form. As a data analyst, you will convert mathematical formulas into queries and their subsequent validation. A successful Data Analyst will identify and implement innovative strategies and projects in an accurate and effective way.




QUALIFICATIONS

1+ years of experience with SQL, Python and Excel in a business environment
1+ years of experience manipulating large datasets in a business environment
Experience creating and maintaining documentation of business processes
Strong understanding of statistics and aggregate functions
Exposure to data warehousing and/or Druid SQL is preferred, not required
Demonstrated interested in professional growth




BENEFITS OF WORKING WITH BROOKSOURCE:

Previous experience working with this client and placing both permanent employees and contractors.
Direct communication with the hiring manager, which allows us to have a clear understanding of the timeline and move candidates through the interview process faster.
Dedication to keep an open line of communication and provide full transparency.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Responsibilities

  • Evaluate and analyze statistics and trends;
  • Extract data from Case Information Management System(CIMS) or other databases supported by OMI to produce reports;
  • Uses various query software tools to produce finished reports, statistics, and/or graphic information reflective of the subject matter;
  • Analyze and evaluate data extracted for the purposes of quality assurance, quality control, and data integrity;
  • Prepare procedures manuals, user guides, and technical documentation, to include but not limited to, report development documentation;
  • Prepare written analyses and recommendations for the COR;
  • Adhere to established procedures in the registration of reports in Business Objects Enterprise for testing and production;
  • Post PDF versions of selected reports to the OMI Intranet and becoming familiar with the structure and operation of the website;
  • Develop new reporting tools, views, and interfaces;
  • Train users in new applications, reporting tools or system features;
  • Maintain daily work reports; and
  • Manage frequent contact with the COR and other Civil Division personnel.

Qualifications

  • An undergraduate degree, preferably in computer science or management information or equivalent experience, i.e., 4 years of progressively more responsible experience in a professional analytical occupation working with relational databases for the purposes of data extraction;
  • Proficient in extracting data from relational databases using various query software tools, graphic displays for data presentation, database tools, and spreadsheet software;
  • proficient and experienced using SQL, T-SQL, Crystal Reports 2016, and Microsoft Access;
  • Experience using HTML, ASP, and Visual Basic;
  • Able to produce finished reports containing analyses, graphics, and recommendations;
  • Experience using computers, including email, Word and Excel;
  • Excellent data analysis skills;
  • Able to work independently;
  • Excellent written and effective oral communication skills; and
  • Experience in a legal environment.

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Data Analyst I – Metadata Integration




The mission of the Allen Institute is to unlock the complexities of bioscience and advance our knowledge to improve human health. Using an open science, multi-scale, team-oriented approach, the Allen Institute focuses on accelerating foundational research, developing standards and models, and cultivating new ideas to make a broad, transformational impact on science.




The mission of the Allen Institute for Neural Dynamics is to answer fundamental questions about brain function. Specifically, how does our brain build our understanding of the complex world around us to guide the flexible behaviors that address our biological needs? The answers will be in terms of defined neuron types interacting across the whole brain and body, requiring us to develop next-generation neurotechnologies and employ a team-based approach for discovery neuroscience. Knowledge, data, and tools will be widely shared, in part to support the development of therapies for brain disorders.




We are seeking a skilled data analyst to design and improve schemas for the data and metadata that are the critical foundation of our mission to support open, reproducible, and FAIR science. The candidate will work closely with internal and external scientific teams to standardize data and write software that facilitates this challenging task. The ideal candidate will be excited to engage deeply with scientists, familiar with modern Python software development practices, and have experience analyzing complex biological data.




The Allen Institute believes that team science significantly benefits from the participation of diverse voices, experiences and backgrounds. Progress in science benefits from multiple perspectives. We are committed to increasing diversity across every team and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for this role.




Essential Functions




Communicate with scientists, engineers, and project management to turn data requirements into schemas and code
Organize and model data to facilitate discovery and analysis
Analyze and transform data into reports and dashboards
Document and facilitate data best practices and communicate with internal and external teams




Note: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions; it does not proscribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned.




Required Education And Experience




Bachelor's degree, certificate, or extensive on the job training in computer science, computer engineering, computational neuroscience, or relevant field
Experience with scientific computing in Python (numpy, scipy, pandas)
Experience working with biological data




Preferred Education And Experience




0 – 2+ years of experience in a similar role
Experience with data standards in neuroscience (NWB, OME, bioformats)
Experience with software best practices (version control, collaboration, testing)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills




Physical Demands




Fine motor movements in fingers/hands to operate computers, and other office equipment




Position Type/Expected Hours of Work




This role is currently able to work both remotely and onsite in a hybrid work environment. We are a Washington State employer, and the primary work location for all Allen Institute employees is 615 Westlake Ave N; any remote work must be performed in Washington State.




Additional Eligibility Qualifications




In keeping with our focus on employee safety, all employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment unless a medical or religious exemption is approved. All employees will be required to keep their vaccination status up to date according to CDC guidance and our policy.




Additional Comments




**Please note, this opportunity offersrelocation assistance**




Annualized Salary Range




$57,219 - $80,107 *
Final salary depends on required education for the role, experience, and level of skills relevant to the role, along with work location, where applicable.




Benefits




Employees (and their families) are eligible to enroll in benefits per eligibility rules outlined in the Allen Institute’s Benefits Guide. These benefits include medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Employees are also eligible to enroll in the Allen Institute’s 401k plan. Paid time off is also available as outlined in the Allen Institute's Benefits Guide. Details on the Allen Institute’s benefits offering are located at the following link to the Benefits Guide: https://alleninstitute.org/careers/benefits .




It is the policy of the Allen Institute to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, the Allen Institute will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Sr Data Analyst will be responsible to develop reports with a specialty in SAP BW (Business Warehouse) development and support using Microsoft SQL. SQL programming skill is a must. Database management skill is also essential for success. You will perform all development tasks for reports, including gathering reports requirements; design table structure, using SQL to create reports and final trial run. You will also work with IT team on any alignment projects related to SAP BW implementation and configuration.




ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work directly with business stakeholders (mainly sales and marketing groups) and other IT members, to create/gather business reports requirements and identify solutions
Create and modify BW reporting by utilizing SQL Skill
Manage BW database and tables in an effective, logical, and systematic way. Design, Create and Change database and tables to meet business needs from a dynamic and long-term perspective
Support live BW reports, including: a) creating/changing BW process schedules, and b) monitoring and troubleshooting BW processes, such as data loads, transformations, rollups, and reorganizations.
Work with IT members for reporting and configure requirement at back end
Perform monthly business tasks (such as sales commission calculation, dealer special discount, 3rd party dealer data loads) by utilizing BW and SQL; Clean up/ load and check business data; Load and maintain database
Coordinate with functional leaders on forecast and budget activities to ensure accomplishment before deadlines
Ability to effectively manage BW reports assorted with multiple projects going on in parallel, including working with many individuals in both varying technical and business roles; strong ability to work productively in a global company setting




MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Education Degree in accounting, finance, computer science or management information system or related fields

Experience and/or Training

Minimum 5 years industry experience in BW reporting
3 years reporting experiences by using SQL programing
Highly motivated, self-directed, innovative and able to work independently or among teams with keen judgement, common sense and resourcefulness
Adapts and thrives in a demanding, start-up, fast-paced environment
Superior communication and interpersonal skills (verbal, non-verbal, written), with the ability to build relationships at all levels, both internally and externally
Possesses a high level of critical thinking; Operates with a high level of professionalism and integrity, including dealing with confidential information
Professional experience in adopting a systematic, automatic and modeling way into business solutions




PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience and/or Training

High energetic; a can-do attitude when challenges occur; Naturally takes on challenging assignments
An Organized, Systematic and Self learning Individual, can pick up things quickly and working independently
Close attention to detail, ability to audit work to identify issues and provide practical solutions for business issues.
Sound judgment is required to plan, prioritize, organize and accomplish a diversified work load;
Strong working ethics and accountable personality; Must have the ability to interact with individuals at all levels within the organization and be able to work independently as well as within a variety of teams.
Continuous improvement mentality to achieve excellence in working performance; Demonstrate quality driven business skill by delivering accurate and effective business solutions in a timely manner.




BENEFITS & PERKS:

Hybrid remote work position
401(k) through Fidelity and company matching 10%
Dental insurance with Delta Dental PPO
Health insurance BCBS Illinois PPO
Employee Assistance Program
Health Savings Account
Company Paid Life Insurance (two times annual salary)
Paid time off including an extra paid week off the week between Christmas and New Year.
Tuition Reimbursement
Vision insurance through EyeMed
10 paid holidays
Free lunch

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description




Job Description For – Data Analyst Company DescriptionARCXIS (Houston, Texas), is the largest provider of inspection, design, engineering, and quality assurance services for the U.S. residential construction industry. Formerly known as DPIS Builder Services, Ei Companies, Post-Tension Solutions, Ensign Building Solutions Home Energy Division, and Building Energy, ARCXIS brings together hundreds of years of expertise and experience under a single brand serving builders in over half of the states spanning the continental United States.The ARCXIS group of companies also includes ABCO Construction Services, LLC (Centennial, Colorado) and structural engineering firm United Structural Consultants (Houston, Texas). Both ABCO and USC service the multi-family, multi-use, and commercial sectors of the construction industry.ARCXIS is majority owned by Saw Mill Capital, LLC (Briarcliff Manor, New York). Visit us online at www.arcxis.com.




General Overview of Position: A Data Analyst is a professional who bears the responsibility of examining and deconstructing complex company data sets based on a set criterion with the sole purpose of presenting their findings in a simplified format to the business' interested parties.




Desired Competencies




Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate Excel formula and Pivot Tables to datasets to find solutions
Problem-solving skills
Accuracy and attention to detail
Team-working skills
Verbal and Written communication skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Ability for critical thinking
Creativity
Having a systematic and logical approach to problem-solving
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and clean data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities




Requirements




Essential Functions of the Job:




Knowledge of Microsoft Excel including wide range of formulas and understanding of Pivot Tables.




Reports to: Sr. Business Analyst




Education, Experience And Desired Qualifications




High School Diploma or Better
Ability to handle multiple projects at one time
Critical thinking
Attention to detail and ability to stay organized
Must be authorized to work in the US
Strong desire to learn – Minimal professional experience required.
A natural problem solver




Supervisory Responsibility - This position has no supervisory responsibilities




Work Environment - This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines




Physical Demands




Limited, but ability to lift 15lbs is desired. Position Type/Expected Hours of Work: This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand. Classification: Non-Exempt
ARCXIS rates are contingent on skill set, experience, and geographical location of the position.

HTML:
Description


Job Description For – Data Analyst Company DescriptionARCXIS (Houston, Texas), is the largest provider of inspection, design, engineering, and quality assurance services for the U.S. residential construction industry. Formerly known as DPIS Builder Services, Ei Companies, Post-Tension Solutions, Ensign Building Solutions Home Energy Division, and Building Energy, ARCXIS brings together hundreds of years of expertise and experience under a single brand serving builders in over half of the states spanning the continental United States.The ARCXIS group of companies also includes ABCO Construction Services, LLC (Centennial, Colorado) and structural engineering firm United Structural Consultants (Houston, Texas). Both ABCO and USC service the multi-family, multi-use, and commercial sectors of the construction industry.ARCXIS is majority owned by Saw Mill Capital, LLC (Briarcliff Manor, New York). Visit us online at www.arcxis.com.


General Overview of Position: A Data Analyst is a professional who bears the responsibility of examining and deconstructing complex company data sets based on a set criterion with the sole purpose of presenting their findings in a simplified format to the business' interested parties.


Desired Competencies


  • Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate Excel formula and Pivot Tables to datasets to find solutions
  • Problem-solving skills
  • Accuracy and attention to detail
  • Team-working skills
  • Verbal and Written communication skills
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Ability for critical thinking
  • Creativity
  • Having a systematic and logical approach to problem-solving
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and clean data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities


Requirements


Essential Functions of the Job:


  • Knowledge of Microsoft Excel including wide range of formulas and understanding of Pivot Tables.


Reports to: Sr. Business Analyst


Education, Experience And Desired Qualifications


  • High School Diploma or Better
  • Ability to handle multiple projects at one time
  • Critical thinking
  • Attention to detail and ability to stay organized
  • Must be authorized to work in the US
  • Strong desire to learn – Minimal professional experience required.
  • A natural problem solver


Supervisory Responsibility - This position has no supervisory responsibilities


Work Environment - This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines


Physical Demands


  • Limited, but ability to lift 15lbs is desired. Position Type/Expected Hours of Work: This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand. Classification: Non-Exempt
  • ARCXIS rates are contingent on skill set, experience, and geographical location of the position.


PI202957388

Title: Full time | Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
The Data Analyst will directly support the established data request infrastructure and will be responsible for ensuring alignment and consistency with data reporting (tools and methodology), alignment to policies and practices with internal and external reporting, and support for department-wide reporting and/or projects as appropriate.

Responsibilities of the Data Analyst Specialist:

Prepare reports and presentations for use by partners and department decision-makers using appropriate visual graphs, charts, and tables to communicate research findings
Assist in tracking of metrics and key performance indicators to ensure that strategic goals are met
Assist with analyzing data and crafting visuals for analytics support to uncover trends and develop recommendations to key decision-makers
Establish timeline and processes to ensure data quality and timely provide data, analysis, and reports to the department leadership
Build, validate and send daily weekly, and monthly management reports to reporting manager
Assist with requests for non-standard reports and analysis for Enrollment & Licensing team
Transform department needs into functional requirements
Together with managers and/or senior analysts, participate in multi-functional meetings where departments express their concerns and identify problems and solutions
Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
Fix the reporting database environment and reports
Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
Training users on new reports and dashboards.


Basic Qualifications of the Data Analyst Specialist:

1 or more years experience as a data analyst or in a related field.
Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, v-lookups, charts)
Demonstrated experience with Tableau and Salesforce reporting
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets
Attention to detail and ability to follow instructions and written processes to deliver requirements.

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Overview

At Cotiviti, we are custodians of data for our clients, which requires efficient processes to manage data

implementations, data production, data quality and data security. The Data Analysis function provides

insight into different aspects of the data operations function right from raw data files to the quality of

data in the deliverables.

The Data Analyst I is an individual contributor role that provides program analysis for the Eliza Suite of

products as well as providing cross-functional data analysis across solutions within our business unit.

In this role, the candidate will manage various sources of information and large data sets, including

member, pharmacy, claims, encounter and solution specific transactional data to support Reporting

and Business-related projects. This person will perform data analysis, conduct impact assessments,

and recommend solutions while staying current with industry regulations and trends. In addition, this

person may be responsible for developing custom reporting using various ETL methods for both

internal and external clients.

Responsibilities

Responsible for data management and data quality
Apply critical thinking, business logic and/or data mining techniques to support analytical solutions.
Assist in completing deliverables and ensuring all requirements are accurately met.
Analyze existing procedures to identify system/process changes needed to meet such requirements, including but not limited to streamlining processes and quality assurance.
Perform complex queries and data mining methodologies to identify patterns and trends that are indicative of potential data issues.
Perform data quality checks verifying that data provided is consistent with the requirements that support claims database file ingestion and various reporting deliverables.
Write data transformation specifications to load source data into target data warehouse tables.
Work with the other analysts to perform quality checks on the reformatted coding; ensure data is complete while and making modifications as necessary to transform the raw data into table layouts or for reporting purposes.
Create downstream tables for reporting and monitoring.
Perform data analysis, data mining and identify root cause of issues using SQL.
Assist in the conversion of internal processes from manual to automated through SQL coding and ETL development using Talend.
Complete all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan.
Complete all special projects and other duties as assigned.
Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in relevant field such as Health Science, Computer Science, Business, or equivalent experience.
2-4 years’ experience with healthcare data analysis. Strong data manipulation skills using database and spreadsheet applications. Knowledge of database applications, including extraction and querying skills.
Strong SQL skills required for querying and data manipulation.
Working knowledge of AWS, Redshift, Vertica, Talend, Alteryx or other ETL tool.
2+ years’ experience within the Healthcare or Insurance space in a Data Warehouse operations organization.
Strong knowledge of healthcare enrollment, medical claims, and drug claims data preferred but not required.
Ability to use SQL (I.e. Db Visualizer) and other data tools to analyze diverse data sets.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize projects to meet scheduled deadlines.
Ability to analyze raw data and disseminate results, with ability to think logically and process sequentially with a high level of detailed accuracy.
Ability to work well independently or in a team environment.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Outlook and Project.

Title: Data Analyst (Remote Eligible)
Description:
Additional Duties:



Work with lines of business to identify and solve data integrity and quality issues, recommend data quality improvement opportunities, and to establish new metrics for tracking performance of critical data elements
Assist lines of business with interpreting data and creating reports
Analyze large datasets to pinpoint trends and patterns in order to extract meaningful insight Provide technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing Analyzing and interpreting results using statistical tools and techniques
Establish and maintain automated data quality monitoring systems and report on their performance.
Research and recommend machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques for delivering actionable insights and to create accurate prediction.
Provide metadata reports for management, such as data quality scorecards and exception reports
Work with IT to establish, monitor and maintain data ETL processes and provide support for enterprise data warehouse and reporting platforms
Leverage third party data analysis solutions and vendors to enhance data reporting, validation and quality processes Analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations
Monitor and maintain the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.

Knowledge of:



Excellent knowledge of data mining and statistical analysis
Familiar with databases and data management process
Familiar with machine learning and artificial intelligence concepts
Familiar with programming and database languages like Python, R and SQL

Ability to:



Problem solving skills and ability to think logically
Ability to work with technical and non-technical business owners to achive results in alignment with strategic priorities
Self-starter with great communication skills (verbal and written)

EDUCATION AND TRAINING



Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics or related field or equivalent education/work.
Previous experience in data management (metadata, data architecture, data governance, data quality, data modeling).
Requires knowledge of Microsoft Office.

STANDARDS OF PERFORMANCE



Customer Service - Adheres to The Busey Promise service standards and executed through Busey’s vision of Service Excellence in order to anticipate and exceed the needs of our customers, both internal and external.
Functional Knowledge and Technical Skills - Skilled in job-specific knowledge that is necessary to provide the appropriate quantity and quality of work in a timely and efficient manner.
Accountability - Work behaviors demonstrate responsible personal and professional conduct, which contributes to the overall goals and objectives of Busey.
Interpersonal Relations (Teamwork) - Interacts effectively with others to establish and maintain smooth working relations.
Forward Thinking - Anticipating the implications and consequences of situations and taking appropriate action to be prepared for possible contingencies.
Attention to Detail - Working in a conscientious, consistent, and thorough manner.
Written Communication - Communicating ideas and information in writing to ensure that information and messages are understood and have the desired impact.
Oral Communication - Communicating ideas and information verbally to ensure that information and messages are understood and have the desired impact.
Problem Solving - Identifies standard problems, accurately assesses impact of problem, researches for root causes, and implements an effective solution
Flexibility - Open to different and new ways of doing things. Recognizes the need to adapt, expresses willingness to do things differently, manages transtions from task to task effectively, and displays a positive attitude in the face of ambiguity and change.

 



Remote Eligible in: Illinois, Indiana, Missouri, Florida, South Dakota, Iowa, Kentucky, Michigan, Ohio, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, Georgia, Wisconsin, Maine



 



Busey believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.



Equal Opportunity Employment is a priority for Busey and all qualified applicants will receive consideration regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy), age, sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity and expression), marital status, military status, veterans status, citizenship status, work authorization status, work disability, order of protection or any other characteristic protected by applicable law or other non-merit based factors.

Title: JR Data Analyst
Description:
TITLE:  JR Data Analyst
TYPE:  Contract
LOCATION:  Southampton, PA 
ONSITE/REMOTE/HYBRID:  Hybrid
START DATE:  February 2023
SHIFT:  Day
VACCINATION REQUIREMENT:  None


We are looking for a JR Data Analyst to join our growing company focused on commercial pharmaceuticals.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Ability to follow directions and handle daily tasks.
Work with Office Suite and use pivot tables and V lookups.
Extract data, track data, and match the data to the appropriate columns.
Use Power BI to upload data and refresh it regularly.
Must be attentive to detail. 100% accuracy is needed.
 
QUALIFICATIONS
Four-year college degree, ideally in an Analytics/IT-related field of study.
At least 1 year of data analytics experience using Power BI and Office at an intermediate to expert level.
Well-versed in analytics, data metrics, and reporting systems/tools (ex., Tableau, Python, SQL, R, etc.).
Strong quantitative and analytical abilities and problem-solving skills.
Outstanding collaboration, delegation, and communication skills.
 
EOE STATEMENT
We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
To Power Smart Mobility for Every Driver and Vehicle, Everywhere

Who You are:

This Data Analyst role will increase our speed to insight around key business questions from our various stakeholders and expand the data team capabilities in many critical areas of Easypark.

This person will work with our existing team of Data Scientists and across Easypark partnering with Operations, Marketing, Sales, Finance, Product and Support functions. You will be responsible for providing data insights, reporting as well as providing accurate and timely data for ad hoc/one-off requests to support and enable data driven decision-making for various stakeholders.

Successful candidates will work cross-functionally with key business partners and will come prepared with new ideas and a unique point of view. You have the ability to execute and can manage multiple projects, fulfill priorities and meet deadlines. You are a data junkie that knows what quality data means and what will help to improve it.

Responsibilities:

Partner with leadership on the best approach for what data is needed and the methodology required to solve complex root cause analysis on business problems to identify insights that inform and drive key business decisions.
Standup reports/dashboards that deliver a high degree of quality, timeliness, and accuracy in reporting as well as clearly showcasing any discovered insights to help drive better decisioning.
Ability to extract data (from a variety of sources like Snowflake, Postgres, Salesforce and Mixpanel) and perform detailed data analysis on internal processes and productivity.
Lead goal setting, tracking and defining reports, and supporting company-wide metrics (Board reviews, QBRs, and OKRs (Objectives and Key Results)) through a regular cadence for daily, weekly, monthly reporting and analytics.
Support financial month end close processes, providing research on out of balances in invoices and settlement reports
Engage in ad-hoc projects, reconciliations as needed.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Work cross-functionally with our Product team to reconcile, identify/define problems to implement processes and standards that inspire trust with data and provide consistent metrics across the organization.
Create presentations that capture key operational metrics, articulate results, and convey actionable business insight for both sales management and executive audiences.
Provide and support ad-hoc reporting services for non-standard issues and analysis.


Qualifications:

3+ years of relevant sales/business/finance operations experience with solid understanding of SaaS business models.
3+ years of Python or other language with demonstrable evidence of data analytic processing
Experience building complex financial and forecast models.
Advanced experience working with various BI tools (Tableau, Looker etc.) **required**
Advanced experience with SQL **required**.
Demonstrated ability to partner with various stakeholders in building intuitive and actionable dashboards and data visualizations that drive business decisions.
Ability to breakdown down fuzzy business questions into actionable and useful data insights
Attention to detail, accuracy, resourcefulness, and ability to follow-through
Ability to thrive in a changing environment and to manage and prioritize multiple initiatives
Intermediate ability in statistical analysis preferred.
Strong technical and critical problem solving skills are preferred to better understand the Parkmobile product.
Experience with DBT is also a bonus.


Talent Attributes - what we look for in all hires at Parkmobile

Self-awareness: you seek to understand your own behaviors, actions, emotions, and traits in an effort to continually improve and develop.
Collaboration: you work together towards a shared goal, not in service of individual needs.
Stage Appropriateness: you have experienced growth and scale and understand the impact it has on individual roles, decision making, prioritization and our vision.
Intrinsic Motivation: you are driven by an internal desire to achieve, succeed and contribute
Intellectual Curiosity & Agility: you have a perpetual need to learn new information, and with exposure to it you're able to adopt and modify your thoughts, solutions, and outcomes.


We know there's no such thing as a "perfect" candidate. We're all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. ParkMobile welcomes those who are passionate about learning and evolving. If this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you'll apply.

What You'll Enjoy About Joining Our Team

We believe in work/life balance. Seriously. Our team members' well-being is just as important to us as their work. We are humans first, employees second. We offer a ton of competitive perks, including:

Unlimited PTO
Medical, dental and vision coverage
401K Matching
Casual Dress
Paid Parental Leave
Flexible Work Hours
Learning and Development Opportunities
Company Social Events - happy hours, outings, and more
Pet Insurance
Company Community Service Events


About ParkMobile

At ParkMobile, we aim to build an inclusive culture where differences are used to inform better creative, strategic, and business decisions. We actively seek diversity of backgrounds, education, beliefs, and ways of thinking. We look to create a culture where everyone can belong because we believe that people do their best work when they can show up every day as their authentic selves. ParkMobile is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
