Primary Responsibilities

Assist program or project managers along with Records Access Officers (RAOs) and legal counsels on phases of eDiscovery projects.

Work with clients on activities of low to high complexity; consults with participants and senior IT personnel to develop data collection and data processing solutions as required.

Responsible for and execute eDiscovery requests, including data collection, processing, and setting up review and productions.

Use eDiscovery software and Microsoft Purview Compliance Portal to identify, search, collect, and process data for legal teams to review.

Provide technical expertise and guidance to legal and IT teams.

Collaborate with other eDiscovery team members to ensure projects are completed on time.

Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualification

Minimum one (1) to two (2) years of verifiable IT Security, Operations, or Technical Support experience is required. Two (2) plus years of verifiable hands-on eDiscovery experience is strongly preferred.

Excellent problem-solving skills, independent thinking, teamwork and collaboration skills with the ability to work with legal and IT teams.

Strong verbal and written communication skills, particularly to translate legal requirements to technical requirements.

Technically proficient and hands-on experience with eDiscovery industry standard technologies (e.g., Exterro, Relativity, Brainspace, OpenText, etc.)

Proven ability to work to deadlines and prioritize multiple projects.

A thorough understanding of the eDiscovery process and lifecycle; must have demonstrated experience leading all aspects of each step in the Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM)

Working knowledge of the Microsoft Keyword Query Language Structure is preferred.

Sound judgment, discretion, and ability to properly handle confidential and sensitive information.

Education And Certifications

Bachelor's Degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration or other related field, or equivalent work experience.

The Association of Certified E-Discovery Specialists (ACEDS) certification is a plus, but not required.

Title: DATA ANALYST, Strategic Planning, Initiatives & Systems
Description:
Job Description




The University’s central Budget and Planning office is responsible for compiling university data relating to overall projections of enrollments, tuition, fees, & student financial assistance. The analyst will use both commercially available software as well as proprietary enrollment and tuition modeling software. Position requires strong analytical skills as well as the ability to effectively communicate results, and the implications of those results, to management.




Essential Functions:




Responsible for maintaining the enrollment and tuition models in the university’s STAT+ system, including updating entering student targets, tuition rates and reviewing continuation rates. (30%)
Provide support within the office and to external operational areas for activities related to the Tuition & Fee Advisory Committee. The Data Analyst will be involved with the annual rate development process and ongoing rate development activities. The annual process includes issuance of requests for recommendations, review of the materials submitted, follow-up to resolve issues, preparation of materials that will be reviewed by senior management, and notification of approvals to operational areas. The University uses an internally developed web-based system (TAFS) to collect and maintain the submitted and approved rates. (20%)
Using data from the University’s MicroStrategy Academic Data Warehouse and SAP Business Warehouse, create visualizations and analyze the results from various reports to support the Academic Planning processes. This will include data required for the University’s Graduate Revenue Sharing initiative and any ad hoc data requests. (15%)
Responsible for producing data to support the development and monitoring of the university’s financial aid budgeting. (10%)
Assist with production of various weekly reports used in forecasting enrollment and tuition. (10%)
Responsible for researching and compiling comparative data from peer institutions relating to tuition, fees, and housing and dining rates. (10%)
Participate in user testing of new and existing systems including the Enrollment and Tuition projection models (STAT+); Tuition & Fee System (TAFS); and the upcoming Student Information System (SIS). (5%)
Required Skills




Bachelor's Degree and 5-8 years of experience, or Master's Degree and 3-5 years of experience.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office products (Excel, Word, PowerBI).
Experience with MicroStrategy, SAP, SQL, or SPSS preferred.
Strong analytical and communication skills.




Please note all newly hired staff and faculty will need to be in compliance with Boston University’s COVID-19 Vaccination and Booster Requirement within 30 days of date of hire. You must upload your vaccine documentation or request a medical or religious exemption (instructions). For further information on the University’s response to COVID-19, please visit the COVID-19 Resources site.




We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military service, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, or because of marital, parental, or veteran status. We are a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

Title: BI Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
About Us

edTech Consulting specializes in placing consultants within the Higher Education environment. Most of our team has a Higher Education background and we understand student data and the importance of leveraging it for student success.

This position is a 6-month contract in a Higher education institute with an initial assignment thru 6/30/2023 with opportunity for extension in 6-month increments

Our client is undertaking a strategic Digital Transformation to innovate and scale our mission of educating leaders who make a difference in the world. In support of this effort, they are seeking a Data Analyst / Data Visualization Specialist to assist their team in analyzing data and developing presentations of findings. The Data Analyst will collect/aggregate, clean, organize, and make sense of data from various sources from across our academic and administrative programs (for instance, student survey tools and course data), creating visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, be an excellent communicator, have the ability to work independently on analytic projects, yet works well with others on a project team. Strong proficiency and an ability to communicate results effectively through Excel and PowerPoint is essential. Familiarity with business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Oracle BI, or PowerBI. Proficient in writing queries using SQL and understanding of the features and capabilities of one or more database management systems (DBMS) commonly used in data warehousing is preferred.

Skills Desired

Multi-reporting tool proficiencies
Significant experience querying and analyzing data relationships
Proficiencies extracting and loading datasets/records

Compensation: From $70.00 to $90.00 per hour

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
FirstPRO is now accepting resumes for a Data Modeler on behalf of our client in the higher education space. This role is a hybrid role and could be a full-time permanent hire role but they would be open to making the role a contract/consultant role.




This is a key member of the Business Intelligence team responsible for the design of data model solutions that reduce data redundancy, streamline the movement of data, and ensure data security and privacy standards of the data query. Data analytical ability with strong academic and college business knowledge is essential.




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Develop plan for business intelligence initiatives, recommend innovative technologies, methods, and industry-leading data modeling tools and best practices, and design and maintenance of a system to warehouse data and information, including structured and unstructured data sets. Organize and transform data into comprehensible data models.
Map data from new sources to the central data model to support the creation of new or extension of existing reports/dashboards and perform data validation. Provide requirements and execute data extraction, transformation, and load procedures.
Support Argos and Tableau platforms by building data pipelines to facilitate the growth of dashboards and incorporate new and diversified data sources.
Manages all technical aspects of our business intelligence environment, including data transformation and governance, performance monitoring, and identification and support of analytics tools. Conduct regular architecture, security, data management, and permissions reviews to enable proper data access/management to sources.
Use complex data analysis and query, data science, and data modeling techniques to develop reports and data analytics solutions. This includes engineering solutions in the form of business dashboards, reports, and data visualizations integrating with internal and external public data sources like College Board or IPEDS. Provide statistical analysis of data, predict trends in business and academic performance, use data mining to extract information from data sets, and identify correlations and patterns.
Actively organize data literacy, report, and dashboard training for key business users. Focus on storytelling to solve practical business issues and evolve data analytics for department engagement.
Partner with academic units and business departments such as Institutional Research, Enrollment Management, Registrar, Finance, HR, Financial Aid, and Institutional Advancement to define and analyze data needs, gather reports or data requirements and perform data mapping to create BI solutions to solve business issues. This often involves conducting complex root cause analyses to troubleshoot data discrepancies, working with end users to correct business processes, and systematically cleansing inaccurate data sets.
Identify, collect and maintain data sets to effectively support the publishing and performance of relevant business area metrics and KPIs including Enrollment Management, IR, IA, Academic Affairs, Finance, HR, IT, and MTP.
Effectively work and collaborate with PMO on BI projects, ensure deliverables are completed on time, and objectives are met.
Manage tables and data views within Oracle database, SQL Server, and PostgreSQL and synchronize with data models using appropriate ETL tools.
Keep current on the latest technologies, and develop proof-of-concept data model prototypes to advance the BI program.
Enforce data quality, knowledge retention, and process consistency through the curation and expansion of the institutional data dictionary/catalog.
Develop detailed technical specifications, data mapping, and data flow documentation for major data analytics projects.




QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business or a similar degree, combined work experience and education as equivalent
10 years combined experience as a data modeler, business intelligence analyst, or advanced report writer
6 years experience in database systems management. Hands-on experience in data model/data warehouse design. Solid understanding of dimension/fact table structure and data aggregation.
5 years of experience in ETL tools and procedures
Programming language(s) for ETL and data pipelining
3 years of Tableau or other dashboard development experience
Higher Education experience preferred.
Experience working with Ellucian Banner, Slate, Canvas, or Workday preferred.
Experience with HelioCampus preferred.
Experience ingesting, organizing, and representing data within a data model in formats that are easy to use, understand and meet business objectives.
Expertise in defining and managing relational data, dimensional data, unstructured data, and master data to effectively translate and communicate data to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Can develop end-to-end solutions from constructing the data set to visualizing information in a tool like Tableau or Argos reports and dashboards.
Excellent knowledge of data modeling, data extraction, and data transformation using SQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, or ETL tools.
Experienced with data mapping, business process analysis, criteria, and data flow documentation in a written or visual format.
Capable of working on problems of diverse scope and complexity, is resourceful in developing solutions encompassing challenges to deliver solutions before deadlines.
Following standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data to obtain trustworthy results.
Is a fast learner and able to apply new and emerging technologies to the existing BI product portfolio to achieve meaningful business outcomes through applying complex data analysis, data science, and data modeling techniques, from descriptive and diagnostic analytics to more advanced predictive modeling.
Python or other scripting or data integration technologies preferred

Show more Show less

Title: Data/Reporting Analyst - Excel (C)
Description:
As the Data/Reporting Analyst, you will be responsible for providing project support to IT staff in the implementation of time entry coding, time entry reporting, financial project analysis, as well as supporting the IT department with coordination and support, and providing general administrative duties as needed.




Skills/Experience




5+ years of relevant data analysis/report analysis experience.
Possess basic level of Project Management skills.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Written and verbal communication skills.
Must have a strong command of the English language written and oral.
Interpersonal skills to be able to interface effectively with a broad range of contacts from technical staff to senior management.
Organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple concurrent activities and to work successfully under pressure.
Analytical thinker, with ability to solve problems.
Can deal with ambiguity and requests for change.
Associate's degree or equivalent experience/education - preferred.




Major Job Duties And Responsibilities




Provides financial analysis on projects on a regular basis, by entering data into the appropriate system(s) and generating the reports using proper entry codes.
Provides project coordination and support on assigned projects.
Assists the project manager with managing the project workflow/lifecycle to ensure deliverables are met on time and on budget.
Monitors and documents team activities.
Participates in meetings with clients and task members and identifies additional follow up needs.
Develops analytic reports for clients and team members that assess or quantify the status of the project.
Provide general support to IT staff and its project managers in creating project sites, storing project documentation in appropriate sites, identifying projects with deficient documentation, following up with project managers to ensure all appropriate documentation is in place.
Provide general administrative support including monitoring calendar, setting up meetings, making travel and/or meeting arrangements, entering time and filing expense reports. Perform other duties as assigned.




About Harvard Partners, LLP, Trusted Advisors To IT




Harvard Partners is a management consulting firm focused on helping companies more effectively leverage their IT investment. We engage with the C-Suite and Technology Team to help them better understand their IT infrastructure and process in order to align the technology strategy and organization to reach the firm’s strategic business goals.Some of our practices include:




Program/Project Management and "PMO as a Service"
IT Assessments
Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery
Optimized Infrastructure
Concierge Managed Services
Data Center Strategy, Transformation, and Migration
Cloud Management Programs
Security Assessments and Remediation
Staffing, technical & tacticalWorking with the client’s staff, vendors, and consultants, we deliver supportive and collaborative engagements where direct dialog, simplified reporting, productive meetings, and clear responsibility and accountability encourage active participation resulting in consensus-based business outcomes.

Title: HIM Data Analyst (40hr)
Description:
When you join the growing BILH team, you're not just taking a job, you’re making a difference in people’s lives.




Job Type:




Regular




Scheduled Hours:




40




Work Shift:




Day (United States of America)




The Health Information Department is a service department supporting complete and accurate medical record documentation that supports quality patient care. Accurate assignment of ICD-10 and CPT coding supports a complete patient record, statistical reporting and hospital reimbursement.




Job Description:




Job Summary: Duties include chart assembly, discharge analysis, incomplete records and chart completion/location. Performs record retrieval/delivery, filing, chart creation and answering phone requests. Provides back-up for chart mergers and resolution of the transcription error report. Assists with requests for medical record information (ROI).




Essential Responsibilities:




Assembles all medical record types according to standard chart order.




Utilizes Meditech discharge lists to monitor completion of all daily discharges.




Reviews assembled record for required contents and accurately completes the medical record completion form for any missing items (includes reviewing Meditech PCI for dictated reports that may need e-signature).




Records accurately any physician incomplete record item into the Meditech Incomplete Record program.




Records and reprints any missing record documentation such as the Laboratory Discharge Summary, Radiology reports and Nursing Documentation.




Required Qualifications:




High School Diploma Or GED Required. Associate's Degree Preferred.




0-1 years related work experience required in Knowledge of anatomy/physiology and medical terminology preferred. TD-4 filing and knowledge of Federal/State medical record completion requirements preferred..




Experience with computer systems required, including web based applications and some Microsoft Office applications which may include Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint or Access.




Competencies:




Written Communications: Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in written English with internal and external customers.




Oral Communications: Ability to comprehend and converse in English to communicate effectively with medical center staff, patients, families and external customers.




Knowledge: Ability to demonstrate full working knowledge of standard concepts, practices, procedures and policies with the ability to use them in varied situations.




Team Work: Ability to work collaboratively in small teams to improve the operations of immediate work group by offering ideas, identifying issues, and respecting team members.




Customer Service: Ability to provide a high level of customer service to patients, visitors, staff and external customers in a professional, service-oriented, respectful manner using skills in active listening and problem solving. Ability to remain calm in stressful situations.




Age based Competencies:




Employees in this job must be competent to provide patient care to the following age groups: Neonatal:Birth to 6 months, Youth: 6 months to 16 years, Young adult: 16-30 years, Middle Age: 30 - 60 years, Elderly: 60 -.




Physical Nature of the Job:




Light work: Exerting up to 20 pounds of force frequently to move objects. Some elements of the job are sedentary, but the employee will be required to stand for periods of time or move through out the hospital campus




FLSA Status:




Non-Exempt




As a health care organization, we have a responsibility to do everything in our power to care for and protect our patients, our colleagues and our communities. Beth Israel Lahey Health requires that all staff be vaccinated against influenza (flu) and COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Learn more about this requirement.




More than 35,000 people working together. Nurses, doctors, technicians, therapists, researchers, teachers and more, making a difference in patients' lives. Your skill and compassion can make us even stronger.




Equal Opportunity Employer: MALE/FEMALE/VETRANS/DISABILITY/GENDER IDENTITY/SEXUAL ORIENTATION.

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
At Brooks, new ideas, new technologies and new ways of thinking are driving our future. Our customer focused culture encourages employees to embrace innovation and challenge the status quo with novel thinking and collaborative work relationships.




All we accomplish is grounded in our core values of World Class, Empowered, Accountable, Respectful, Engaged.




Data & Reporting Analyst




Job Description




What you will do:
This position within Enterprise FP&A will be responsible for enabling financial reporting, forecasting, and planning capabilities within the organization through effective use of technology.
Must be capable of turning large, complex data sets into actionable financial insights.
Must possess the ability to build and maintain financial models.
Partnering with internal customers to identify key business issues and design systematic approach to resolution
Effectively communicate with business partners/internal customers to capture requirements and execute to them.
Evaluate and distill analyses conducted by other departments
Developing quantitative and qualitative analysis on a broad range of projects and functional areas
Design and develop standard reporting packages utilizing various FP&A applications
Partner with the business analytics team to implement new KPI’s
Assist with:
Preparation of executive presentations, including monthly operating reviews and analysis used for Board updates and investor presentations.
Ad-hoc modeling exercises
Participating in process improvement initiatives and new system implementations




What you will bring:




Bachelors degree in Business, Mathematics, or Economics.
Requires a minimum of two to four years experience in a similar role.
Willingness to take on responsibility and strong attention to detail.
Requires ability to prioritize multiple assignments.
Demonstrates excellent communications skills.
Self-starter mindset with strong desire to drive process optimization.
Candidate should possess strong capability in MS Excel and MS PowerPoint.
Requires ability to use Hyperion Essbase, Tableau, Oracle ERP, and Sales Force, or similar applications
Experience with Alteryx is a plus.

Title: Morgan Health - Healthcare Innovation Data Analyst, Associate
Description:
Position Overview And Responsibilities




As a Data Science Associate, you will be responsible for querying, compiling, manipulating and synthesizing large quantities of health-related data to assist Morgan Health and its business partners make data-driven decisions. You will utilize experience with health care claims, electronic health records, and survey data. You will also leverage familiarity with health care quality measurement to perform statistical analyses, visualize data, and extract a story to provide insights to support Morgan Health's Innovation, Ventures, and Community Engagement teams. You will join a growing team of healthcare experts solving critical problems in employer-sponsored healthcare.




Candidate Profile




You will be passionate about healthcare transformation and creating data-driven insights. You will demonstrate skill in each phase of the analytics project life-cycle, including data extraction and transformation, analytics solution design, data visualization and description, statistical analysis, and data-driven storytelling. You should have proven success creating practical, actionable analysis plans and communicating their findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Beyond strong analytics and communication skills, you will be a self-motivated problem-solver who enjoys working in teams and creates value by aligning data-driven insights with business objectives.




Key Responsibilities




Work across Morgan Health to review business needs and translate them into data-driven project plans
Proactively identify relevant data sources (including insurance claims, biometric results, survey results, public or licensed data) and understand their limitations
Implement creative and efficient solutions to clean, join, and analyze the data while adhering to HIPAA and firm-wide data use guidelines
Contribute to a positive and creative collaborative work environment
Carefully review and validate analysis findings to ensure data quality and integrity
Leverage appropriate statistical techniques to answer complex business questions and bring actionable insights to Morgan Health and business partners
Manage relationships with key stakeholders to balance multiple projects
Clearly communicate analytics concepts and insights with non-technical teammates and stakeholders




Requirements




Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in a quantitative field or with a technical focus (including, but not limited to, computer science, statistics, engineering, math)
2+ years of professional experience with hands-on analytics and data visualization
Healthcare experience, ideally in a payer, provider, or research setting; background working with medical and pharmaceutical claims data strongly preferred
Understanding of applied statistics, including familiarity with interpreting statistical significance, controlled regressions, and propensity-score matching
Fluency with analytics tools and relational database structures, e.g. SQL, ArcGIS, Python, R, Excel and/or Tableau
Proven ability to successfully multitask effectively and deliver results with limited supervision
Experience creating analytical presentations with strong attention to detail
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and a team-oriented attitude




JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.




We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.




The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.




As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.




We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.




Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans




Base Pay/Salary




New York,NY $90,250.00 - $120,000.00 / year
Show more Show less

Title: Entry Level Data Analyst/Management Consultant - Nationwide (US Based Candidates Only)
Description:
At Arcadis we focus on attracting, retaining and developing people who share our passion and commitment to improve quality of life. In return we offer you the opportunity to transform your world and the world around you, that could be through client work, upskilling yourself, championing equality and inclusion or getting involved in charity work, to name just a few. Our people value different perspectives, they care about the sustainability of our planet and dare to shape the future.

One of our core values is ‘people first’, and supported by our Lovinklaan foundation, we invest in you for the long term, to ensure you reach your full potential. You’ll have the opportunity to own your career and work on industry-defining projects, finding solutions to real challenges that make a difference to people’s lives. You’re encouraged to have a growth mindset and are given the space to develop personally and professionally, building a flexible career that works for you.

Role description:

Note: See below regarding the nature of this position being a prospecting position.

Arcadis is currently seeking Analysts and Junior Management Consultants to join our world-class Business Advisory practice in Atlanta, GA.

We are looking for candidates who want to apply technical know-how, combined with business principles, to the water, wastewater, and stormwater industry. We want dedicated, creative, and energetic candidates interested in tackling challenges and developing sustainable solutions to address water issues like renewal and replacement of aging infrastructure, funding of capital improvements, water supply, workforce retention and development, and emergency preparedness. Collaborating with our experienced consulting professionals, you will support and contribute to project outcomes; interact, and work with clients, and develop your technical capabilities.

We are a People First company, industry thought leaders, and drivers and allies of utility innovation.

Our passion: to Improve Quality of Life.

Our approach: to delight our clients by developing successful long-term partnerships and supporting them to address existing and emerging challenges.

Arcadis provides multiple onboarding and development programs created for young professionals that support professional growth and help drive creativeness, innovation, and greater integration within our local, National and global teams.

Role accountabilities:

What will you do?

Assess, develop, and support a variety of management consultant projects including performing data analytics, financial analysis, operational and organizational assessments, condition assessments, vulnerability, and mitigation assessments, as well as planning and development for utilities, municipalities, and cities’ (primarily water/wastewater/stormwater utilities).
Utilize strong analytical skills and ability to apply logic to solve problems.
Support teams in tasks ranging from general fieldwork to technical office-based analysis.
Assist in technical writing which may include preparation of technical reports, business development support, presentations, and other audiovisual materials.
Work independently and as part of a team, with the flexibility to accommodate collaboration with team members across the U.S. and internationally.
Manage multiple concurrent projects with multiple deadlines, ensuring completion per project budgets and timelines.


What skills will you need?

Reliable, client-focused, and capable of working independently under the supervision of project managers.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, strong attention to detail, organization skills, and work ethic.
Self-motivated and team-oriented, with the ability to work successfully both independently and within a team.
Ability to balance and address new challenges as they arise and an eagerness to take ownership of tasks.
Knowledge of engineering concepts, theories, and practices related to water/wastewater/stormwater.
Drive to succeed and grow a career in the utility industry


Qualifications & Experience:

Required Qualifications:

Masters of Science degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering, or closely related STEM discipline; or business analytics/MBA, MS in data science or related business discipline.
For those with engineering degrees, ability to obtain the EIT within six months of start date


Preferred Qualifications:

Previous relevant consulting or utility experience, either internship or full-time.
Experience applying programming languages and analytics to problem-solving is a plus
SharePoint, Building Information Modeling (BIM), Power BI, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Change Management skills, and/or Augmented Reality experience


This is a general job posting and not tied to a specific current open position. Please make sure you create a search agent to be alerted of specific opportunities of interest. Candidates who submit their resume to this posting may be considered for all future openings as they arise.

#ANACollege

Why Become an Arcadian?

Our work with clients has a direct impact on people’s lives and on the planet. We make moving, living and belonging in cities safer, more resilient and more sustainable. By partnering with our clients as responsible custodians of our earth's resources, we can create a sustainable planet.

We continue to think of new ways to make positive impacts and create better experiences for people; data driven and digital solutions have become part of the Arcadis DNA. Working together with clients and using techniques like design thinking, we can get to the heart of our clients’ most pressing challenges and work together to solve them.

As a global business, we have committed to support five of the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals to ensure that our projects contribute to a better and more sustainable future for all. But it’s not just the work that we do on client projects that benefits communities and our planet. As a global business, we are committed to making a positive impact to society by supporting local communities where we operate.

To help protect our planet, we monitor and measure non-financial information to inform business decisions and reduce our own environmental impact as part of our commitment to be net zero carbon as a global company by 2030.

Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging:

We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day which is why we take equality and inclusion seriously and hold ourselves to account for our actions. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people. We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Women, minorities, people with disabilities and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. We are dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis including race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Transform Your World

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
CDM Smith has an exciting opportunity for a talented Data Governance Analyst on our Digital Capital team who will leverage their passion for data to ensure we are enabled to make informed business decisions with well governed, quality data assets. You will have the opportunity to put your footprint on the growth of this team and accelerate delivery for our firm in this domain. You will support the Data Governance Lead and overall organization of data trustees and stewards to actively govern data, build consensus on data policies and rules. We’re looking for a hands-on person who is self-driven and capable of driving the importance of data governance as well as introducing and educating new governance methods to the firm with limited supervision.




The Data Governance Analyst role will bring the capability of defining and maintaining new processes inclusive of end-to-end requirements. This will include but is not limited to process mapping, data mapping, strategy to manage data, risk and assumption identification, value case development, data change management and governance of data to ensure the reliability and safety of our data assets.




Other responsibilities include:




Facilitating the process of reviewing and approving changes to metadata including data dictionaries and business glossary updates as well as leads data analysis and profiling pre-work to achieve.
Providing support for cataloguing and management of key artifacts within our shared drive. Coordinating, tracking, and overseeing tasks that are being executed by Data Governance Working Teams.
Providing support to Data Governance Board Lead with technical aspects and acting as custodian for the processes and artifacts used by the framework behind the scenes.
Supporting change management, communication, training, and education initiatives that advance the Firm's data governance abilities and maturity.
Partnering with business and technicalteams to introduce changes to the data governance framework and processing including changes to roles and responsibilities and updates to processes. Managing lists of tickets coming into Data Governance and intaking review cycles. Gathering and representing data governance change approvals for the Change Control Board (CCB).
Providing recommendations on how to improve data governance policies and procedures as well as the ability to implement those solutions.
Assisting clients with light data governance framework assessments and recommendations to establish data governance within their own organizations.
Performing other duties as required.




Minimum Qualifications:




Bachelor’s Degree.
2 years of related experience.




Equivalent additional directly related experience will be considered in lieu of a degree.




Domestic and/or international travel may be required. The frequency of travel is contingent on specific duties, responsibilities, and the essential functions of the position, which may vary depending on workload and project demands.




Skills and Abilities:




Experience with Data Governance best practices and capabilities such as issue management resolution, metrics, data glossary, lineage, metadata management, policies, procedures, and controls.
Exposure to Data Governance and Data Quality concepts.
Data analysis experience, including the ability to write and edit SQL queries.
Ability to work independently, gathering appropriate knowledge, resources and escalating when necessary.
Ability to explain concepts to non-technical and technical clients and colleagues.
Strong organizational, verbal, and written communication skills with proven ability to establish and cultivate relationships with key partners.
Strong relationship management, interpersonal, collaboration and negotiation skills. Ability to drive change and lead/influence others without formal authority.
Critical thinking skills and ability to navigate ambiguous situations.




Preferred Qualifications:




Experience with Agile/Scrum, Strong project management skills.
Familiarity or experience with AWS and Redshift.
Experience in other scripting languages such as Python, R, SAS and BI tool such are Power BI, Tableau etc.




EEO Statement:

We attract the best people in the industry, supporting their efforts to learn and grow. We strive to create a challenging and progressive work environment. We provide career opportunities that span a variety of disciplines and geographic locations, with projects that our employees plan, design, build and operate as diverse as the needs of our clients. CDM Smith is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.




Background Check and Drug Testing Information:

CDM Smith reserves the right to require background checks including criminal, employment, education, licensure, etc. as well as credit and motor vehicle when applicable for certain positions. In addition, CDM Smith may conduct drug testing for designated positions.




Background checks are conducted after an offer of employment has been made in the United States. The timing of when background checks will be conducted on candidates for positions outside the United States will vary based on country statutory law but in no case, will the background check precede an interview.




CDM Smith will conduct interviews of qualified individuals prior to requesting a criminal background check, and no job application submitted prior to such interview shall inquire into an applicant's criminal history. If this position is subject to a background check for any convictions related to its responsibilities and requirements, employment will be contingent upon successful completion of a background investigation including criminal history. Criminal history will not automatically disqualify a candidate.




In addition, during employment individuals may be required by CDM Smith or a CDM Smith client to successfully complete additional background checks, including motor vehicle record as well as drug testing.




Agency Disclaimer:

All vendors must have a signed CDM Smith Placement Agreement from the CDM Smith Recruitment Center Manager to receive payment for your placement. Verbal or written commitments from any other member of the CDM Smith staff will not be considered binding terms. All unsolicited resumes sent to CDM Smith and any resume submitted to any employee outside of CDM Smith Recruiting Center Team (RCT) will be considered property of CDM Smith. CDM Smith will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

Show more Show less
HTML:
CDM Smith has an exciting opportunity for a talented Data Governance Analyst on our Digital Capital team who will leverage their passion for data to ensure we are enabled to make informed business decisions with well governed, quality data assets. You will have the opportunity to put your footprint on the growth of this team and accelerate delivery for our firm in this domain. You will support the Data Governance Lead and overall organization of data trustees and stewards to actively govern data, build consensus on data policies and rules. We’re looking for a hands-on person who is self-driven and capable of driving the importance of data governance as well as introducing and educating new governance methods to the firm with limited supervision.


The Data Governance Analyst role will bring the capability of defining and maintaining new processes inclusive of end-to-end requirements. This will include but is not limited to process mapping, data mapping, strategy to manage data, risk and assumption identification, value case development, data change management and governance of data to ensure the reliability and safety of our data assets.


Other responsibilities include:


  • Facilitating the process of reviewing and approving changes to metadata including data dictionaries and business glossary updates as well as leads data analysis and profiling pre-work to achieve.
  • Providing support for cataloguing and management of key artifacts within our shared drive. Coordinating, tracking, and overseeing tasks that are being executed by Data Governance Working Teams.
  • Providing support to Data Governance Board Lead with technical aspects and acting as custodian for the processes and artifacts used by the framework behind the scenes.
  • Supporting change management, communication, training, and education initiatives that advance the Firm's data governance abilities and maturity.
  • Partnering with business and technicalteams to introduce changes to the data governance framework and processing including changes to roles and responsibilities and updates to processes. Managing lists of tickets coming into Data Governance and intaking review cycles. Gathering and representing data governance change approvals for the Change Control Board (CCB).
  • Providing recommendations on how to improve data governance policies and procedures as well as the ability to implement those solutions.
  • Assisting clients with light data governance framework assessments and recommendations to establish data governance within their own organizations.
  • Performing other duties as required.


Minimum Qualifications:


  • Bachelor’s Degree.
  • 2 years of related experience.


Equivalent additional directly related experience will be considered in lieu of a degree.


Domestic and/or international travel may be required. The frequency of travel is contingent on specific duties, responsibilities, and the essential functions of the position, which may vary depending on workload and project demands.


Skills and Abilities:


  • Experience with Data Governance best practices and capabilities such as issue management resolution, metrics, data glossary, lineage, metadata management, policies, procedures, and controls.
  • Exposure to Data Governance and Data Quality concepts.
  • Data analysis experience, including the ability to write and edit SQL queries.
  • Ability to work independently, gathering appropriate knowledge, resources and escalating when necessary.
  • Ability to explain concepts to non-technical and technical clients and colleagues.
  • Strong organizational, verbal, and written communication skills with proven ability to establish and cultivate relationships with key partners.
  • Strong relationship management, interpersonal, collaboration and negotiation skills. Ability to drive change and lead/influence others without formal authority.
  • Critical thinking skills and ability to navigate ambiguous situations.


Preferred Qualifications:


  • Experience with Agile/Scrum, Strong project management skills.
  • Familiarity or experience with AWS and Redshift.
  • Experience in other scripting languages such as Python, R, SAS and BI tool such are Power BI, Tableau etc.


EEO Statement:

We attract the best people in the industry, supporting their efforts to learn and grow. We strive to create a challenging and progressive work environment. We provide career opportunities that span a variety of disciplines and geographic locations, with projects that our employees plan, design, build and operate as diverse as the needs of our clients. CDM Smith is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Background checks are conducted after an offer of employment has been made in the United States. CDM Smith will conduct interviews of qualified individuals prior to requesting a criminal background check, and no job application submitted prior to such interview shall inquire into an applicant's criminal history. If this position is subject to a background check for any convictions related to its responsibilities and requirements, employment will be contingent upon successful completion of a background investigation including criminal history. Criminal history will not automatically disqualify a candidate.


In addition, during employment individuals may be required by CDM Smith or a CDM Smith client to successfully complete additional background checks, including motor vehicle record as well as drug testing.

Title: Data Analytics Engineer
Description:
Job Description




Bose is about better sound, but better sound is just the beginning. We’re about inventing new technologies that truly benefit people and creating a culture where innovation and teamwork are highly valued. Working at Bose, you’re encouraged to question conventional thinking in the relentless quest to create products and experiences that change people's lives. Data analytics and data science are a crucial part of our mission, fueling the creation of new and innovative products, helping us to bring the right products to the right customers, and allowing us to astonish customers with carefully crafted and personalized experiences.




We are looking for a Data Analytics Engineer within our Data and Analytics Center of Excellence. The mission of this team is to develop world-class data science, machine learning, and statistical solutions to extract insights and enable data driven decisions that improve our business and enhance customer experiences.




This Data Analytics Engineer role will be critical to help drive analysis, data science, and reporting across many diverse data sets to make sure we deliver impact from our data products and services. This includes working with raw data sets that leads to development of logical and physical data models, data wrangling and design / building of semantic layer that helps to create dashboards and models that drive insights and actions. This work will directly inform and influence multiple division’s strategies. This is a unique opportunity to shape the experiences, technologies, and products that millions of people will use.




The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of data modeling, SQL, data warehouses / data lake and data engineering skills. You will often serve as an internal expert about the data, what it means and how it can be used to solve business problems. You can demonstrate that you have experience deeply understanding the data structure and transformations required to develop a semantic layer for data analysts and scientists. We are seeking a highly motivated, detail-oriented engineer who is passionate about data and enabling data-driven decisions.




Primary Responsibilities




Leverage DBT to mine , analyze, and transform large structured and unstructured datasets, collaborating with analysts, data scientists, and business users to create actionable metrics and datasets that solve business questions.
Provide expertise in query building and data modeling to ensure data is made available in a timely, efficient, and comprehendible means.
Help define the strategy and standards for analytical engineering.
Help define testing and data quality programs leveraging dbt Cloud
Partner with our other teams to ensure documentation, privacy, and best in class coding practices are implemented within Analytical engineering.
Act as SME for specific data domains by enabling analytical data sets for ad-hoc analysis
Engage with key stakeholders in the business, product and software teams to clearly understand and scope analytical requests.




Qualifications




Extensive background and demonstrated track record in building analytical models in SQL.
Strong technical skills, including experience with analytics, query and data visualization tools.
Experience with Snowflake, dbt, and Python is preferred.
Excellent communication skills, and the ability to explain deep technical results to diverse groups of stakeholders.
A life-long learner who is curious, has a passion for solving hard, ill-defined problems, has comfort taking initiative and who continuously seeks to improve their skills and understanding.
Enjoys working in a team environment as well as independently.




Education




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in math, physics, computer science, engineering, business, finance, marketing, economics or related quantitative or computational field




Work Experience




3+ years of related data analytics experience in relevant consulting, finance, data science or market intelligence functions
Previous experience in a consumer electronics environment, particularly in a technical field, is a definite plus
Previous experience with mobile app data is a plus




What's In It For You




Be a part of and work with a top notch, multidisciplinary, transparent, and agile team.
Collaborate with people like you who want to solve problems and have fun together.
Work on developing innovative Wellness products that improve people's lives.
Excellent work life balance and a continuous learning environment.
Highly competitive package as well as a comprehensive benefits program.
We strive to help our employees and customers reach their fullest potential.




Compensation for this role for a candidate based in Colorado is expected to be between $101,800 and $130,300 and for a candidate based in NYC to be between $101,800 and $130,300 . Actual pay may be higher or lower depending on geographic locations, skills, experience, and other factors permitted by law. This role is also eligible to receive a bonus, which is not guaranteed and may be based on individual and company performance.




Bose is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics. For additional information, please review: (1) the EEO is the Law Poster (http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf); and (2) its Supplements (http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm). Please note, the company's pay transparency is available at http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. Bose is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the application or employment process, please send an e-mail to Wellbeing@bose.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Title: Data Analyst/Integration Spec
Description:
When you join the growing BILH team, you're not just taking a job, you’re making a difference in people’s lives.




Job Type:




Regular




Scheduled Hours:




40




Work Shift:




Day (United States of America)




Data Analyst/Integration Spec




Job Description:




Job Summary: The Data Analyst and Integration Specialist is the primary liaison for all data feeds related to research data sharing (NIH Data Sharing, Research Data Shares, etc.). This role helps to understand and initiate data integration, normalizes data into the central share tracking database via data loads, troubleshoots interruptions in data feeds, suggests and/or creates reporting around research shared data, and proposes creative solutions when establishing new data feeds or identifying new data inputs. Under the direction of the Director, the individual helps to support key technology initiatives that strengthen and promote the goals of the research data sharing at BIDMC and Beth Israel Lahey Health System.




Essential Responsibilities:




Liaise with BILH IS resources to set up secure, system-consistent, and reliable data transfer protocols with all resources involved in research data sharing.
Work with the Research Data Share team to translate business needs into data specifications.
Independently identify data needs and ensure data integrity. Synthesize data from multiple sources. Create data tracking models to evaluate the potential impact of proposed initiatives and make recommendations based on data findings.
Support reporting efforts related to the state's regulatory bodies, including but not limited to the NIH/DHHS.
Present the data sharing program in written, visual, and oral presentations to various audiences throughout the system.
Effectively prioritize projects to complete work within established guidelines and timeframe.
Build and maintain strong working relationships with Information Systems, Research Operations, Research Faculty, and other key partners.
Familiar with importing/exporting large volumes of data and can create and execute imports using tools such as Microsoft SSIS and DTS.
Create simple web forms to capture Data Sharing requests, updates, and help tickets.
Design, develop, optimize enterprise-level reporting, and use data analytic tools.




Required Qualifications:




Bachelor's Degree Required. Master's Degree Preferred.




5-8 years related work experience required.




Advanced skills with Microsoft applications which may include Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint or Access and other web-based applications. May produce complex documents, perform analysis and maintain databases.




Competencies:




Decision Making: Ability to make decisions that are guided by general instructions and practices requiring some interpretation. May make recommendations for solving problems of moderate complexity and importance.




Problem Solving: Ability to address problems that are varied, requiring analysis or interpretation of the situation using direct observation, knowledge and skills based on general precedents.




Independence of Action: Ability to set goals and determines how to accomplish defined results with some guidelines. Manager/Director provides broad guidance and overall direction.




Written Communications: Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in written English with internal and external customers.




Oral Communications: Ability to comprehend and converse in English to communicate effectively with medical center staff, patients, families and external customers.




Knowledge: Ability to demonstrate full working knowledge of standard concepts, practices, procedures and policies with the ability to use them in varied situations.




Team Work: Ability to work collaboratively in small teams to improve the operations of immediate work group by offering ideas, identifying issues, and respecting team members.




Customer Service: Ability to provide a high level of customer service to patients, visitors, staff and external customers in a professional, service-oriented, respectful manner using skills in active listening and problem solving. Ability to remain calm in stressful situations.




Physical Nature of the Job:




Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally in carrying, lifting, pushing, pulling objects. Sitting most of the time, with walking and standing required only occasionally




FLSA Status:




Non-Exempt




As a health care organization, we have a responsibility to do everything in our power to care for and protect our patients, our colleagues and our communities. Beth Israel Lahey Health requires that all staff be vaccinated against influenza (flu) and COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Learn more about this requirement.




More than 35,000 people working together. Nurses, doctors, technicians, therapists, researchers, teachers and more, making a difference in patients' lives. Your skill and compassion can make us even stronger.




Equal Opportunity Employer: MALE/FEMALE/VETRANS/DISABILITY/GENDER IDENTITY/SEXUAL ORIENTATION.

Title: Lead Data Analyst- Customer and Financial Analytics
Description:
The Opportunity

We are looking for an analytical, detail oriented and collaborative individual to join our Financial and Customer analytics team. As lead data analyst, you will act as a trusted advisor working cross-functionally across Finance, Customer Health, Business Ops, as well as senior leadership. In this role you will be responsible for deep financial and business analysis on our business performance, providing visibility into revenue and expense drivers, customer health and behavior, current pricing and packaging strategies in an effort to best support our customers.

About The Team

The business intelligence team enables all groups across the organization to harness the power of data to make our customers more secure and drive growth for Rapid7. The team works as collaborative partners who provide actionable, accessible, and relevant data, insights, and predictive analytics.

About the Role

The ideal candidate will be an inquisitive learner with a passion for data and analytics who can collaborate with stakeholders across functional areas to review and optimize reporting, analytics, and data structure/data capture all while aligning to corporate objectives. This role requires a mixture of business acumen and technical expertise in SQL, and Tableau, along with an ability to build strong partnerships with business partners.

Collaborate with Finance, Customer Health, Business Ops, Product, and Senior Leadership teams to conduct deep financial and business analysis on our business performance, providing visibility into revenue and expense drivers, customer health and behavior, current pricing and packaging strategies in an effort to best support our customers
Understand existing customer economics, margins and utilization to support proposed changes to pricing models
Provide clear visualizations and present analyses to management and executive-level stakeholders, using Business Intelligence tools and predictive analytics to drive key decisions
Drive consistency in reporting and analysis across the company, reinforcing process, increasing visibility, and acting as a key point of communication between stakeholder teams
Develop in-depth understanding of underlying data, data structures, and business uses of data
Coach and mentor junior team members to become savvy with Tableau and visualization.
Advance BI team & corporate goals, promoting a data-oriented culture, insight generation and enablement of end-users

In this role you will bring

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Business, Economics, or related discipline required, Masters preferred.
At least 8 years work experience in a role that required regular business analytics; high tech, software, or mgmt. consulting company preferred.
At least 5 years of hands-on experience in Tableau with strong data visualization skills.
8 years of hands-on proficiency with SQL.
Strong business acumen, possessing the ability to understand cross-functional trends, and how those trends impact corporate KPIs; prior experience in an operational role a plus
Fast learner with high attention to detail and possess a passion for data, data quality & business analytics

​

We know that the best ideas and solutions come from multi-dimensional teams. Teams reflecting a variety of backgrounds and professional experiences. If you are excited about this role and feel your experience can make an impact, please don’t be shy - apply today.




About Rapid7

Rapid7 (NASDAQ: RPD) helps organizations across the globe protect what matters most so innovation can thrive in an increasingly connected world. Our comprehensive technology, services, and community-focused research simplify the complex for security teams, helping them reduce vulnerabilities, monitor for malicious behavior, be in 10 places at once, and shut down attacks. We’re on a mission to make security solutions easier to use and access so we can bring safety and resilience to more people. With more than 10,000 customers across 140+ countries, Rapid7 is a leader in cybersecurity that has earned numerous industry accolades and recognition for our technology and culture.

#linkedInHybrid

Hybrid- Boston ( 3x days in office)







All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst -Center For Applied Brain and Cognitive Sciences
Description:
Overview

The mission of the Center for Applied Brain and Cognitive sciences (CABCS) is to bring together a unique interdisciplinary community of scientists and engineers to advance the state of the art in applied brain and cognitive sciences. The center provides an innovative environment for conducting collaborative applied research focusing on measuring, predicting, and enhancing cognitive capabilities and human system interactions for individuals and teams working in naturalistic high-stakes environments.

This position is a limited term role, renewable annually, based on performance and budget availability

What You'll Do

Job Summary

Collects and cleans data and performs data analysis. Applies statistical and machine learning methods to describe, summarize, and interpret data, and communicates results to inform decision making. Prepares statistical summaries and reports to interpret data, communicate results and inform decision-making

Essential Functions:

Assists Principal Investigators, Managers and/or research team in determining sources to collect appropriate data and ensure maintenance, accuracy and integrity of data
Organizes data from a range of sources and conducts data cleaning in preparation for analysis
Performs data processing and analysis using statistical and machine learning approaches
Prepares reports and summaries to interpret data, communicate results and inform decision-making
May initiate new reporting and analytical tools to improve results and decision-making
Assists in analysis and implementation of current processes and makes recommendations for improvement
Contributes to the conceptual development of qualitative/quantitative research questions and evaluation plans
May oversee user training


What We're Looking For

Basic Requirements

Master’s degree in related field, or Bachelor’s degree with several years related experience
Experience with data processing, analysis, and visualization software
Ability to manage databases, construct data files, conduct and supervise data entry, and perform data edits/cleaning
Experience in data quality control
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with team
Strong writing skills and ability to prepare clear documentation
Strong analytical skills
Related software such as Python, MATLAB, Microsoft Excel, SQL, Tableau, SAS, and/or R


Preferred Requirements

Expertise in applying machine learning packages to process and interpret complex, multivariate and time-series data.
Expertise in applying multivariate statistical models, including generalized estimating equations (GEE), linear mixed effects models (LMM), and LASSO regression.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing & Communications
Description:
When you join the growing BILH team, you're not just taking a job, you’re making a difference in people’s lives.




Job Type:




Regular




Scheduled Hours:




40




Work Shift:




Day (United States of America)




The Data Analyst, Marketing & Communications role will be focused on analyzing, verifying, tracking and reporting on marketing and communication activities and exploring channel and activity trends and opportunities via data. In addition, they will conduct multichannel evaluation including reporting, analytics and multivariate testing. Delivers analytical expertise and marketing experience, concepts, knowledge, and skills to support initiatives and improve channel performance. Coordinates efforts across various functional groups.




Job Description:




Essential Duties & Responsibilities including but not limited to:




Analyzes, implements, and maintains marketing activities across sites and ensures goal setting and tracking.
Analyzes marketing and communications business insights to deliver on improved customer site experiences and business growth.
Designs, creates, and distributes regular analytics dashboards and reports, as well as meaningful KPIs at all levels, including executive summaries and detailed channel performance reports.
Incorporates offline data points as it relates, enhances or contributes to the reports, KPI’s and analyses.
Supports, coordinates, and collaborates to design custom reports to measure and analyze campaign effectiveness to support cross-channel marketing efforts.
Evaluates campaign activity strategy, create ads and keyword list and execute, set up tracking, perform A/B testing and explore new technology to ensure optimized campaign performance.
Operates under general guidance and work assignments are varied and require interpretation and independent decisions on course of action.
Supports the organization’s migration to an enterprise-wide CRM platform.
Day-to-day management, configuration and optimization of database for marketing and communication campaigns.
Leverage the value of the CRM database application and look for opportunities to realize a return on investment (ROI) by creating automated, multi-touch, targeted customer lifecycle digital marketing and communication programs.
Design A/B and multivariate test strategies to understand consumer insights and better identify guest behaviors and brand engagement.
Responsible for formulating, gathering, evaluating and aggregating results and building / designing actionable dashboards for stakeholders.
Perform other duties as assigned.




Minimum Qualifications:




Education: Bachelor's Degree required, or equivalent combination of education and related experience.




Licensure, Certification & Registration:




Experience:




1-3 Years Of Relevant Experience, Required.




Skills, Knowledge & Abilities:




Undertanding of methods of data storage, data cleaning and preparation for reports
Experience with analysis, exploration and determining data patterns to identify business improvements
Knowledge in statistical methods
The ability to create dashboards, reports and data visualizations
Requires excellent writing, editing and proofreading skills.
Must be able to handle sensitive and confidential information, be creative and be an overall team player.
Ability to organize time and manage diverse activities, to work successfully under pressure, and to handle competing priorities with minimal supervision.




FLSA Status:




Exempt




As a health care organization, we have a responsibility to do everything in our power to care for and protect our patients, our colleagues and our communities. Beth Israel Lahey Health requires that all staff be vaccinated against influenza (flu) and COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Learn more about this requirement.




More than 35,000 people working together. Nurses, doctors, technicians, therapists, researchers, teachers and more, making a difference in patients' lives. Your skill and compassion can make us even stronger.




Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Do you geek out over data? Are you curious about trends and consumer behaviors? Do you find yourself building THE perfect spreadsheet over and over? WE WANT TO TALK TO YOU!

We are looking for a Marketing Data Scientist to play an intricate role in lead attribution and budget allocation to support our goal of acquiring new customers in the New England area. This rockstar will help ensure we spend our marketing budget efficiently as we target our audience through successful campaigns...because WE LOVE DATA TOO!

Your Responsibilities:

Analyze sales funnels and customer intent
Measure ROI of digital and traditional advertising campaigns
Report on marketing KPIs like leads, conversion rates, and digital traffic
Monitor budget distribution and performance of paid ad campaigns
Conduct competitive research and analyze benchmarking data
Research and implement marketing tools and platforms to benefit marketing and call center campaigns
Work closely with your marketing team to identify opportunities for new client acquisition


Role Requirements:

Strong Proficiency in salesforce or comparable CRM platform
3-5 years Work experience as a Marketing Analyst or similar role in a B2C environment
Strong Proficiency in PowerBI or Tableau visualizations experience
Experience with PPC campaigns
Strong Excel Proficiency


Kudos if you have:

Expertise in Google Analytics
Understanding of SEM campaign strategies and SEO practice


Best-In-Industry Compensation Package:

$70,000-$75,000 annually
Continuing education, including attending conferences and company-provided resources to help with individual growth and development.
Mac laptop, multiple screen-support, standing desk.
Paid Time Off and Holiday Pay.
Health, Dental, and Life Insurance.
401K with Company Match.
Short- and Long-Term Disability.
Pet Insurance
Vision, Critical Illness, and Accident Insurance Available.
Flex Savings and Health Reimbursement Accounts.
Flex Summer Hours.


If you feel you meet the qualifications, please submit your resume and someone will get back to you as soon as possible.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work® Institute and recognized as a ‘Cool Vendor’ and a ‘Vendor to Watch’ by Gartner.




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.

Primary Responsibility

Ensure compliance, security, and quality of data assets and products, making sure these are fit for purpose.
Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) with your specific data domain(s) working closely with data engineers, data product owners and data consumers.
Monitor data usage and provide insight into how, when and where teams can best utilize data for decision making.
Manage definition and implementation of policies and procedures around intake, storage, processing, and transmission of data.
Maintain and update all data management and administration related documents and processes (i.e., business processes & workflows, data definitions, business rules, data requirements, data conversion and cleansing plans).
Provide operational oversight throughout the lifecycle of data assets/products.
Develop and promote Data Lineage products and data governance best practices.
Lead efforts to achieve established data quality/governance objectives, conduct data investigations and drive resolution of data-related issues.
Regularly partner with IT teams in implementing practices and leveraging existing governance tools.
Facilitate development and implementation of data quality standards, data protection standards and adoption requirements across the organization; report on and escalate data quality/governance/compliance issues as needed.
Define performance indicators and quality metrics to ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities.
Promote adoption of data governance processes by establishing clear understanding and improving the data management process based on ever changing needs of the organization.




Required Experience

The ideal candidate:

Needs to have a good understanding of the data domain.
Should have exposure or experience with the data governance framework.
Should be able to create and manage policies and procedures around data access, management, and security.
Should be able to do exploratory data analytics. Good hands on with Excel / SQL. (Some Python Good to have)
Pharma experience is required.
Good understanding of databases, data warehousing, cloud environment (AWS), data architecture, and ETL.
3-6 years of relevant experience.




Pay:




The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Fractal, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is: $110,000-$125,000. In addition, for the current performance period, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus.




Benefits:




As a full-time employee of the company or as an hourly employee working more than 30 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the health, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability plans in accordance with the plan documents, which may be amended from time to time. You will be eligible for benefits on the first day of employment with the Company. In addition, you are eligible to participate in the Company 401(k) Plan after 30 days of employment, in accordance with the applicable plan terms. The Company provides for 11 paid holidays and 12 weeks of Parental Leave. We also follow a “free time” PTO policy, allowing you the flexibility to take time needed for either sick time or vacation.




Fractal provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws
