Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Location: Remote (Pacific Time)

Status: 3-6 month contract




Responsible for working on downtime procedures and documentation in the healthcare industry. Well versed in Excel formulas and Pivot tables along with being able to understand and analyze data and suggest solutions.










What Gets You The Job:




Active listening skills: ability to follow directions.
Ability to document processes.
Ability to organize work and meet deadlines.
Highly motivated, self-starter and able to work with minimal supervision.
Excellent communications skills, relates well with others.
Expert forms designer
Expert documenter
Strong MS Excel and Word skills
Good listener and translator of what they’ve heard or see in rough form to a finished product.
Preferred to have clinical knowledge and/or background.
Any previous experience with working on downtime procedures preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Houston Local News Initiative

The Houston Landing is growing our team of passionate people on a mission to advance democracy in our communities and strengthen the lives of all Houstonians one story at a time. Houston Landing is an independent, nonprofit digital news operation that will cover a broad range of topics serving the Greater Houston community. Houston Landing is initially supported by a coalition of three of Houston’s leading philanthropies including Arnold Ventures, The Houston Endowment, and the Kinder Foundation.

At Houston Landing, we are expanding our operations team to include a Data Analyst. The Data Analyst will report directly to the Director of Product and will be responsible for interpreting and presenting all product analytics. You will be a strategic thought partner and your work will directly impact achieving the Houston Landing mission.

We will consider applications on an ongoing basis, but we encourage those who are interested to apply ASAP.

Requirements

What you’ll do

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work closely with the COO to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities


Who You Are

You are passionate about using data driven insights to produce the best possible impact on product development and ultimately reader engagement. You are mission driven. You seek out challenges. You are passionate about improving your skill and growing your career.

Experience - You have 5+ years of experience in data analytics or technology product management
Mission-oriented - You’re committed to our mission to advance democracy and improve the lives of all Houstonians
Self-starter - You’re ready to experience the chaos of an early stage startup, and have a proven ability to roll up your sleeves to get things done
Communicator - You have excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate with and report on product feedback to the COO to produce impact.
Multi-tasker - You’re able to set priorities while remaining flexible in an ever-changing environment
Technical skills – You are an expert in Google Analytics. You have experience with Redshift, SQL, and setting up dashboards in Data Studio.


Benefits

Our Values

EXCELLENCE: We wake up every day with the intent to be the best at what we do. We hustle. We have grit. When we make mistakes, we’ll learn from them.

INCLUSION: We aren’t all the same, and those differences are what make us better. We’ll respect each person’s uniqueness. Perspective, context and life experiences help us to tell the story.

AMBITION: We will be bold and creative, open to all ideas big or small. We really mean it.

FUN: We are not making widgets, although there is nothing wrong with widgets. We tell stories - and stories are often fun, so we believe in having lots of fun.

‍COLLABORATION: We are all in this together. We may not always agree, but we will listen to each other and communicate candidly and respectfully.

Benefits

Compensation commensurate with experience.
401(k)
Healthcare 100% premium paid for employee and 50% for dependents
20 vacation days
Ten sick days
Generous paid parental leave
Hybrid work policy (initially we all work together to build culture)
Stipend for development / learning


We’re committed to building an inclusive organization that represents the people and communities we serve. We encourage members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, including women, people of color, veterans, LGBTQ+ people and people with disabilities.
Show more Show less

You are passionate about using data driven insights to produce the best possible impact on product development and ultimately reader engagement. You are mission driven. You seek out challenges. You are passionate about improving your skill and growing your career.
  • Experience - You have 5+ years of experience in data analytics or technology product management
  • Mission-oriented - You’re committed to our mission to advance democracy and improve the lives of all Houstonians
  • Self-starter - You’re ready to experience the chaos of an early stage startup, and have a proven ability to roll up your sleeves to get things done
  • Communicator - You have excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate with and report on product feedback to the COO to produce impact.
  • Multi-tasker - You’re able to set priorities while remaining flexible in an ever-changing environment
  • Technical skills – You are an expert in Google Analytics. You have experience with Redshift, SQL, and setting up dashboards in Data Studio.

Benefits

Our Values

EXCELLENCE: We wake up every day with the intent to be the best at what we do. We hustle. We have grit. When we make mistakes, we’ll learn from them.

INCLUSION: We aren’t all the same, and those differences are what make us better. We’ll respect each person’s uniqueness. Perspective, context and life experiences help us to tell the story.

AMBITION: We will be bold and creative, open to all ideas big or small. We really mean it.

FUN: We are not making widgets, although there is nothing wrong with widgets. We tell stories - and stories are often fun, so we believe in having lots of fun.

‍COLLABORATION: We are all in this together. We may not always agree, but we will listen to each other and communicate candidly and respectfully.

Benefits
  • Compensation commensurate with experience.
  • 401(k)
  • Healthcare 100% premium paid for employee and 50% for dependents
  • 20 vacation days
  • Ten sick days
  • Generous paid parental leave
  • Hybrid work policy (initially we all work together to build culture)
  • Stipend for development / learning

We’re committed to building an inclusive organization that represents the people and communities we serve. We encourage members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, including women, people of color, veterans, LGBTQ+ people and people with disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Overview: (No C2C)




Our Fortune 100 Client is in need of a sharp Data Analyst who is proficient with SAS and SQL to extract data and perform analytics. The candidate will then present based off analytical findings.




Responsibilities

• Provides timely, relevant, robust analyses to support business decisions related to credit risk

• Have experience cleansing, manipulating and analyzing large datasets using statistical software

• Solid understanding of business needs to develop business requirements, rules and test cases

• Gain in-depth understanding of source data and related controls to ensure integrity of reporting and analysis




Requirements

• Degree in Statistics, Economics, Business, Mathematics, Computer Science or related field with 4-6 years related experience

• 4+ years of data analysis experience, with a combination of business and technical skills

• Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills

• 4+ years of SAS/SQL experience

• Experience working with large datasets

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
About the company:


Avenue Code is the leading software consultancy focused on delivering end-to-end development solutions for digital transformation across every vertical. We’re privately held, profitable, and have been on a solid growth trajectory since day one. We care deeply about our clients, our partners, and our people. We prefer the word ‘partner’ over ‘vendor’, and our investment in professional relationships is a reflection of that philosophy. We pride ourselves on our technical acumen, our collaborative problem-solving ability, and the warm professionalism of our teams.


More than 3 years of working on diversity and inclusion strategies, Avenue Code still believes that recognizing the difference and promoting a safe place, job opportunities, representativeness, and support is the best way to make the social transformation happen. All job openings aim to promote employment and recognition of diversity pillars.


About the opportunity:


We are looking for a passionate, hard-working, and talented Data Analyst to join our team. You will be working with one of our biggest clients on products with a high impact on their revenue.


Responsibilities:


  • Work with product partners to find practical solutions to our business problems based on data. This will require an ability to translate problems stated in business terms into quantitative approaches leading to projects starting small and aspiring to grow big if preliminary results are promising;
  • Set up testing (A/B test or pre-post) to measure performance in the best possible way;
  • Analyze large sets of data to understand the impact of product changes on the customer journey and to traffic/revenue goals;
  • Drive cohort studies and drive analyses to understand customer behavior and find opportunities for improving our product(s);
  • Transform scientific/data analysis and communicate business performance in a clear and insightful way to the product teams to facilitate timely and informed decision.


Required Qualifications:


We know that each person has gone through different career paths that have provided further knowledge. If you don’t check all the points: go ahead! Apply anyways! Your experience is much more than a technology checklist.


  • Understanding of statistics, experimental design, and causal inference;
  • Excellent SQL skills as well as experience with common data and statistical toolkits such as R, Python, PySpark, etc;
  • Expertise with business intelligence and/or data visualization tools such as Tableau, MicroStrategy, etc.;
  • Prior experience in performance measurement, creatively applying regression techniques / modeling, optimization techniques, A/B testing, etc. for business applications.


Nice to Have:


Avenue Code discloses salary range information in compliance with state and local pay transparency obligations. It considers a wide range of factors such as internal equity, geographic location, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, business or organizational needs and others. At Avenue Code it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range for US Based Data Analyst is 110K to 200K per year.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst: The candidate will work on converting data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design. They will monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.




Responsibilities:

Collect data, interpret, analyze, and summarize the results using statistical techniques and provide recommendations for action.
Develop and implement data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Use tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources and automate repetitive tasks.
Identify and address errors and inconsistencies in data collected.
Identify and collect logs to measure the process effectiveness, analyze logs and make recommendations to either address the gaps or make enhancements.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.




Skills:

5+ years of working experience as a data analyst or information security analyst.
Knowledge of AWS Cloud.
Effective oral, presentation, and written communication skills; Prepare and deliver training to users on operational or security procedures.
Self-motivated, team player with the ability to work under minimal guidance and provide transparency and continuous progress on the work.
Knowledge of databases, working experience of SQL, advanced Excel, Power BI or other data analysis or reporting tools is desirable.
Knowledge of Information Security or Data Security concepts is an advantage.




JustinBradley is an EO employer - Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Market Research)

Fully Remote

6-Month Contract

$60-80/hr




It's time to inspire greatness. If you are interested in storytelling using data and research, using an analytical mind to extract deep insights to leverage data, then this Marketing Research Analyst role is perfect for you. In this role, you will identify key market stats, help strategists and managers understand the data you found, and be a part of an industry that is changing how the world views healthcare systems.




THE COMPANY

A leading healthcare advertising agency is focusing its branding/advertising within an industry that matters. This agency focuses its resources on healthcare/hospital services to bring better health to more people nationwide. As a research data analyst, you will be collaborating with multiple teams and VPs to enhance analysis and quality within their data practice.




THE ROLE

Track, report, and analyze the performance of marketing activities, ad-hoc analytic requests, and development/automation of regular analytics reports by the client
Analyze external and internal customer data using internal business intelligence platform, database spreadsheet (Excel) models, web analytics tools, statistical analysis tools, and campaign management software tools
Analyze A/B and multi-variate tests and communicate results
Provide actionable overall market and customer insights to address key strategic questions




YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

A successful Research Data Analyst within this role will likely have the following skills and experience:




2-4 years of work experience in marketing research, statistical or data analysis (or academic equivalent)
2-4 years of experience in statistical analysis (SAS or R)
Experience with Sisense or similar data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Deep understanding of SQL and writing queries to extract, transform and load data
Excellent analytical skills and a high degree of business acumen
Proven ability in handling concurrent projects with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills




NICE TO HAVE

Background working within the Snowflake platform




HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your resume to Fareeda Elsayed via the Apply link on this page.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Gentis Solutions is seeking a Data Analyst to join our team. This contract position is with one of our Fortune 50 clients interested in full-time flex/remote consultants. The ideal candidates will have the required skills listed below and will be eligible and open to being hired by our client at the end of the project's duration. This position works alongside an existing team and leverages enterprise-level technologies and processes. If you would like to work at a company that has been recognized for its diversity and inclusion, its work to drive positive social change, and as an environmental leader, make sure you apply below.







Requirements




Knowledge of process improvement tools & techniques such as Six Sigma
Proficient in and advanced knowledge in Hyperion Essbase, R, Oracle Business Objects, Excel, Tableau, and Power BI
Financial, data, and statistical analysis experience
3+ years of analytical experience
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office
Creative and alert to new ways of approaching tasks
Strong analytical skills
Ability to collaborate with groups and teams to get desired results
Proven verbal and written communication skills required
Ability to lead change and innovation
Significant level of multi-tasking required
Ability to preserve the confidentiality of information
Accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to work on own initiative
Commitment to providing customer service







Typical Duties




Assist with the maintenance of daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly business reporting functions
Gather Retail Operations data from multiple databases, platforms, stakeholders, and 3rd party vendors to complete analyze
Transform large data sets through data wrangling, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling
Leverage Power BI (and other data visualization tools) to build and maintain custom reports and dashboards to reveal trends and correlations in large data sets
Implement row-level security in the Power BI (and other data visualization tools) to enable secured viewing of the reports for designated job levels and locations
Identify opportunities to enhance reporting capabilities and improve processes
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand the data needs to execute department and enterprise-wide strategic objectives and initiatives
Identify and communicate any data-related issues and recommendations to the business owner, manager, and the team
Provide data insights and solutions to leaders to drive decision-making
Travel less than 25% to General Office in Cincinnati, OH and local stores







Remote candidates are accepted, but some travel will be required. First week is onsite to get equipment, then the remainder is remote.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

A large, reputable CRG client who is globally recognized as a leader within the food services industry is seeking a Data Analyst to join their team. This company provides employees with an excellent work-life balance and prioritizes a healthy environment for their employees.







The Data Analyst is responsible for performing data extraction, analysis, and reporting related to purchasing. They will respond to specific and/or data and reporting requests and work to create additional reporting. This opportunity offers candidates a hybrid work schedule and the ability to make an immediate impact once settling into the role.




Opportunity: Contract-to-Hire

Location: South Charlotte

Schedule: HYBRID (Tuesday-Thursday in office to start; Only Wednesday in office once settled)

Compensation: $25-$26 / hour ($55,000 after conversion)




Responsibilities:

Organize and process IT spend on credit cards
Perform data mining and assist in the organization of research data
Work closely with all levels of the IT department to discuss credit card charges
Coordinate with the Treasury department for reporting
Analyze data sources such as internal databases, applications, and 3rd party portals
Respond to specific and/or ad-hoc data & reporting requests
Produce scheduled data reporting within the immediate department




Qualifications:

1-3 years of data analysis experience
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Excel
Familiarity with SAP & Outlook
Professional written and oral communication skills
Analytical mindset with the ability to work autonomously




Benefits:

All W2 Employees who work an average of 30+ hours per week at CRG are offered the following benefits options!

Medical, Vision, Dental, Life Insurance, and Long- & Short-Term Disability insurance is offered after 90 days of employment with CRG!
We also offer a Flexible Spending Account (FSA) along with a Health Savings Account (HSA) with our medical plan. CRG matches the first $500 of the HSA contributions.
CRG offers a 401K plan, with open enrollment quarterly (January, April, July, and October) after working at CRG for 90 days.
CRG matches 100% of the first 3% of employee contributions to the 401K plan, plus 50% for the next 2% of contributions!

Category Code: JN008

Title: Data Analyst Junior / Full time (Remote)
Description:
As a member of the Data Team at our company, you will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of applying data and analytics to solve interesting and complex problems. You will independently deliver insightful analytics to all business domains and partner with the Data Analytics and Data Services teams to ensure that data is accurate and accessible. You'll have the opportunity to work on varied tasks, such as improving data utility and ensuring data maturity. This is a high-visibility role where you'll gain invaluable experience collaborating with a diverse set of stakeholders across various departments that rely on our data insights.

In the short term, you will:

Learn the data ecosystem, data model structure, and core systems used and maintained by the Data Team, and understand the critical needs of the business.
Field, scope, and prioritize data and reporting requests from stakeholders.
Achieve expertise in Preset (data visualization and reporting tool).
Semi-independently manage reports and project requests from start to finish.


In the long term, you will:

Own Preset as a system, including data validation, semantic layer management, report and project archiving, integrity and recency validation, and maintaining all core reporting dashboards.
Independently manage reports and project requests from start to finish.
Provide analytics and systems training for new and existing employees.
Identify opportunities and implement solutions to move us forward in the data maturity model.


Why you might love working here:

Open vacation policy, with a 3 week minimum!
Comprehensive health, vision, dental, and life insurance
401(k) with a 5% match
Up to 12-weeks of paid family leave
No Meeting/Flex Fridays
Meetup stipend when you cross paths with a co-worker
Continuing education & development reimbursement
Challenging problems to solve and an awesome team to collaborate with every single day

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our UK/US partner is seeking a Data Analyst with experience in financial/banking. They work with the top 25 banks globally and are looking to continue its expansion in the US. They work on a variety of projects such as business transformation, data strategy, IT transformation, audit remediation, and data-driven change efforts.




Key Details

Data projects include Data Remediation, Data implementation, Data Migration, etc.
Must have experience in the Banking or Financial Services Industry
Full-Time Position...Salary: $130,000 - $150,000
Hybrid in Charlotte, NC




Desired Background (Min. 5+ years)

Implement and maintain systems/processes for data analysis and data management.
Identify trends and develop assumptions to model various strategic initiatives.
Responsible for gathering data from a variety of data sources, performing meaningful analysis, and presenting the analysis to management and the Board.
Regularly performs ad hoc analysis and reporting as needed.
Maintain proper documentation as required for record retention purposes.
Creating and presenting dashboards and reports (BI Tools - PowerBI, Tableau, QlikSense, etc.) for stakeholders
Fraud Detection and Prevention, Customer Data Analysis, Risk Analysis Management
Tools/Systems: SQL, ETL/ELT, Agile, Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS)
Projects: Data Analysis, Data Integrity, Data Cleansing, Data Lineage, Data Remediation, Data Scrubbing/Cleaning, Data Visualization

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Remote

DURATION: 6 month contract + extensions

Rate: $50-$55/hr depending on experience

MUST BE ABLE TO WORK ON W2




MUST HAVE: SQL, Tableau, Snowflake, Azure Data Factory




Primary Responsibilities:

• Collaborate with stakeholders to build dashboards to improve business performance

• Interact with internal customers to effectively design, implement, operationalize and document reporting that accurately captures business requirements

• Work collaboratively with business partners, SMEs, BAs and Testers to ensure a shared understanding of business requirements

• Manage implementation of reporting enhancements and changes

• Develop and maintain documentation that chronicles processes related to previous analytic activities and associated results

• Communicate with various functional areas and translate technical concepts in ways that can be understood by a variety of audiences, both verbally and in writing




Qualifications

• Very Strong experience with Data Visualization (Tableau)

• Experience performing data analysis and report development

• Strong SQL experience, including experience with various database technologies (Snowflake & SQL Server)

• Strong knowledge of relational databases, database structures and design, systems design, and data management

• Experience with data blending tools (e.g. Azure Data Factory)

• Demonstrated effective interpersonal, influence, collaboration and listening skills

• Demonstrated ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely in writing and orally to individuals and groups

• Undergraduate degree or equivalent qualification

Title: Jr. Data Analyst
Description:
Our Company:

Enchanté Living is a leading provider of home products in Lighting, Kitchen, and Bath through a portfolio of brands. We deliver stylish and practical products with value-driven prices to our customers. Our values:




Respect: Conduct our business with integrity. Recognize and celebrate each other's contributions.
Learning: Recognize and adapt to new opportunities. Leadership at every level.
Excellence: A relentless pursuit. Independence to decide, make mistakes, and improve.




Overview:

The Product Sourcing Coordinator will play an active role in each stage of the product cycle from market research, factory research and sourcing, to product conception, design, sample production, testing, forecast, costs, mass production, quality assurance, and sales promotion/support.




Responsibilities:

Creating PO’s & SKUs/barcodes in our ERP system
Prepare and maintain accurate and current supply planning data sets on ERP system and other platforms  
Collect, validate, and analyze data from multiple data source such as Excel, SQL, ERP to investigate and present trends, issues, and opportunities to key stakeholders 
Perform data quality functions for quality control, quality, and integrity 
Identify gaps in data collection and collaborate with teams to troubleshoot issues 
Build scripts and other tools to extract concise and complete operational data 
Provide various reports ad hoc, daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and quarterly 
Develop forecasting models to improve operational efficiency 

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math) 
3+ years’ experience in data analytics, business intelligence 
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (especially in Excel) 
Knowledge of data analysis techniques, languages, software, and systems (e.g., Python, SPSS, Tableau, SQL) 




Benefits:

Health/Vision/Dental Insurance
401K
Paid Time Off

Description:
In this position as a Data Analyst, you will join the Finance & Global Procurement team to work on cloud-native (AWS) data platforms. You will analyze data pipelines coded in Python or SQL, and help on enhancements or proof of concepts for end users to create dashboards.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
Demonstrated experience with Python, SQL, and Spark or R
Experience using Databricks
Experience or exposure to data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Analytical and data science rigor and strategic thinking ability

Extract data and put into temporary data sets to demonstrate how data may be represented in dashboards
Assist with enhancements or proof of concepts for end users to create dashboards
Test use cases for data validations
Transform and validate Python and SQL data

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Seeking a Full Time Data Analyst:




POSITION SUMMARY:

The Data Analyst plays a critical role in ensuring the success of the organization's data initiatives by providing the foundation for analytics. This IT role requires a strong set of technical skills in SQL, SQL database design, and programming languages, as well as exceptional communication skills to understand the data needs of healthcare analysts. The Data Analyst is responsible for the maintenance, improvement, and manipulation of data in the organization's operational and analytics databases. They work closely with the data architect and other team members to define and build data pipelines that ensure the accurate and timely flow of data from source to destination.




ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Expanding and optimizing data and data pipeline architecture
Supporting software developers, database architects, and data analysts on data initiatives
Ensuring data accuracy, availability, and accessibility for key stakeholders and business processes
Developing scalable data pipelines and API integrations
Improving data models that feed business intelligence tools
Monitoring data quality and performing root cause analysis to troubleshoot issues
Collaborating with a cross-functional team of frontend and backend engineers, product managers, and analysts
Contributing to the definition of company data assets and data quality framework
Evaluating open source and vendor tools for data lineage
Developing the long-term data platform architecture
Contributing to the growth of the integrated data warehouse that provides a complete vision of the healthcare landscape.




QUALIFICATIONS:

5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst
Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or related field
IBM Certified Data Engineer or Google Certified Professional a plus
Experience with healthcare data (HL7, CCDAs, Intersystems HealthShare and Cache databases)
Advanced SQL knowledge and experience with relational databases
Experience with database design, big data pipelines, and data transformation
Strong analytical and process development skills
Experience with big data tools (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.) and AWS Services
Strong object-oriented/object function scripting skills (Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.)
Experience with BI tools (Tableau)
Excellent documentation and verbal communication skills

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Our premiere Technology Client is seeking an experienced Junior Data Analyst to join their team. In this role you will review and analyze contractual data and report findings to management.




Job Duties:

Maintain customer pricing programs. Calculate customer-pricing using formulas in MS Excel and MS Access, and upload into systems
Track various contracting activities and opportunities. Summarize data for various purposes, as directed, such as internal/external presentations, issue resolutions, and other inquiries
Prepare detailed reporting, and analyze for discrepancy, using MS Excel, MS Access, Microsoft BI, and other tools
Address internal and external customer requests in accordance with departmental service levels, and generally support the sales effort associated with assigned contracts
Contribute to contract launch and marketing process for new programs, based on established launch plan
Maintain contracts repository, with pertinent contract information for internal and external customers
Complete general contracts administrative tasks such as filing contract notices, submitting routine correspondence, etc.
Take necessary steps to protect confidential information and materials, in accordance with policy.
Identify and escalate any contract related concerns to appropriate contract management stakeholders







Other Required Qualifications

Effective communication skills, both oral and written using a variety of styles and techniques appropriate to the audience
Ability to balance multiple priorities simultaneously and adapt to the changing needs of the business while meeting deadlines
Applicant should demonstrate strong attention to detail with a penchant for accuracy
Knowledge of how to extract and analyze contract data
Proficient in Word
Ability to multi-task, organize and prioritize
Strong work ethic




Education and/or Experience Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent general business experience
Two (2) years of data analysis experience
Proficient to Advanced in Microsoft Excel (will be tested)







Preferred Qualifications

Four (4) years data analysis experience
Familiar with computer reseller contractual requirements




Education and/or Experience Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent general business experience
Two (2) years of data analysis experience
Proficient to Advanced in Microsoft Excel (will be tested)
Contract Management experience

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview:

Huntington Bank is looking for a Segment Data Office Analyst reporting to the Segment Data Office Manager/Leader.

Our Segment Data Office works in partnership with our Chief Data & Architecture Office and acts as the execution arm of data governance and management within a business segment. If you have a passion for data quality, management, governance, and literacy, this role is for you.

This role is an individual contributor responsible for supporting the identification and management of critical data elements, including the associated data quality, metadata, lineage, and reference data, ensuring the data produced by the segment is fit for purpose for both regulatory and management reporting, supporting the prioritization of data and analytics-related issues and needs, and supporting the data literacy within a business segment.

Responsibilities:

Assists in supporting effective data management and governance practices and ensure adherence to the Data Policy and standards; participates in change management practices
Works closely with the Segment Data Manager and team, Data Trustees & Curators, and technology partners across the data lifecycle
Dedicated to the ongoing improvement of data quality within the business segment
Participates in the fit for purpose analysis of data for regulatory and management reporting
Assists in identifying Critical Data Elements (CDEs) and data profiling of CDEs
Assists in the management segment-specific reference data
Supports metadata, business definitions and lineage are mapped into the enterprise-wide tool
Helps manage the inventory of data-related controls on systems that support segment processes and customers
Has basic knowledge of the legal, compliance, and regulatory issues impacting data
Partners with the CDAO (Chief Data & Architecture Office) Data Literacy team to support literacy efforts within the segment

Skills:

Knowledgeable of data management and governance policies, standards, metrics, controls, and processes
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Business outcome focused
Problem-solving mindset

Experience:

Experience working in a data environment including 1 – 3 years of hands-on data experience including data management, data quality, and/or data governance
Experience participating in data-related projects or programs

Education:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a relevant field

Title: Data Analyst (Fraud)*
Description:
At Digital Turbine, we make mobile advertising experiences more meaningful and rewarding for users, app publishers, and advertisers — intelligently connecting people in more ways, across more devices. We provide app publishers and advertisers with powerful ads and experiences that captivate consumers, fuel performance, and help telecoms and OEMs supercharge awareness, acquisition, and monetization. In a rapidly evolving industry, we are constantly innovating and creating better paths of discovery to connect consumers, publishers, and advertisers across the mobile ecosystem.




Digital Turbine is looking for a Data Analyst (Fraud) to join our Offerwall Tech Operations team. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying suspicious behavior in our traffic and taking appropriate action.




Responsibilities of Fraud Analyst:




Extracting and analyzing data from various data sources
Automatize recurrent operations
Executes routine tasks according to department service level agreement
Thoroughly investigating fraud cases to identify the source of suspicious behavior and to research ways of reducing it
Supporting the team in global fraud and risk projects, identifying pain points and tackling them to drive performance and ensure best practices
Build high-level working relationships with Account Managers, and communicate with internal stakeholders on fraudulent activities
Helping to implement, optimize and follow fraud processes across our organization
Working with the product team on fraud-related investigations and implementation of anti-fraud solutions.
Introduce routine practices for looking for suspicious indicators/ transactions/ behaviors and trends.




Requirements of Fraud Analyst:




3+ years working in a role that involves querying, analyzing, and getting insights from very large amounts of data
3+ years in a position that requires communication with stakeholders
Proficient with SQL and comfortable working with different data tools (MySQL, Athena)
Proficient with Google Sheet (or equivalent spreadsheet technology) for analyzing data
Practical knowledge of at least a programming language for automatizing recurrent work (Python etc.)
Curiosity to find anomalies in the data that reveal fraudulent behavior
Ability in problem-solving
Previous experience in managing fraud and claims disputes; customer support or client services - an advantage
Familiarity with implementing reporting dashboards - an advantage
Excellent English, both written and spoken




About Digital Turbine:




Digital Turbine (NASDAQ: APPS) powers superior mobile consumer experiences and results for the world’s leading telcos, advertisers and publishers. Our end-to-end platform uniquely simplifies the ability to supercharge awareness, acquisition and monetization — connecting our partners to more consumers, in more ways, across more devices.




The company is headquartered in Austin, Texas, with global offices in New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, London, Berlin, Singapore, Tel Aviv, and other cities serving top agency, app developer, and advertising markets. Listed on Deloitte Technology Fast 500 for six consecutive years since 2015 and winner of Austin Chamber of Commerce’s Company Culture in 2020.




Digital Turbine is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We embed diversity in our mindset, products, and teams to empower an inclusive, equitable, and culturally fluent environment. Building this culture within our teams makes us better collaborators and partners, driving better outcomes.




To view our Global Recruitment Privacy Notice, please click here .

Title: Data Analyst*in the toll environment (d/m/w)
Description:
Your tasks




You will create and visualize statistical analyses based on multidimensional data
You maintain & optimize reporting tools and scripts including user support and consulting, which are used in the field
You monitor data interfaces and operate problem analysis and troubleshooting in case of malfunction
You collaborate significantly in the development of departmental key figures and prepare them for management purposes
You co-develop a monitoring for the control process and work on the conception of the configurations and parameters necessary for it
You perform application tests and implement them after release approval
You actively collaborate on future topics and projects & contribute your ideas and knowledge in the field of artificial intelligence and digitization of processes
You will contribute ideas for optimizing reporting for the Federal Office for Logistics and Mobility
Your profile




You have already gained initial experience as a Data Scientist or Business Intelligence Analyst and are now looking for a new challenge
You preferably have a degree in computer science or a comparable field of study
You have very good knowledge in statistics and experience with reporting and data warehouse systems
You bring routine in dealing with databases
You have experience in analysis and modeling and a keen interest in automating processes
You have a strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills as well as an independent and structured working style




What we offer




Broad range of qualifications for professional and personal development
Hybrid work
Interdisciplinary, motivated and dynamic team that shapes progress
Attractive remuneration as well as extensive social benefits from the job ticket to a subsidy for lunch to the company pension scheme.




Interested?




We look forward to receiving your meaningful application documents, including the earliest possible start date and the expected end of studies. Please send us your documents exclusively as a PDF file with a maximum total size of 3 MB. Your personal data will be processed in accordance with our privacy policy for applications.




Applicants* with a severe disability (d/m/w) will be given preference in case of equal suitability.




Your contact person




Jule Heldt - 030/74077-3653 - karriere@toll-collect.de




Toll Collect GmbH - Human Resources Management - Linkstraße 4, 10785 Berlin

Please send us your documents exclusively as a PDF file with a maximum total size of 3 MB. Your personal data will be processed in accordance with our privacy policy for applications.


Applicants* with a severe disability (d/m/w) will be given preference in case of equal suitability.


Your contact person


Jule Heldt - 030/74077-3653 - karriere@toll-collect.de


Toll Collect GmbH - Human Resources Management - Linkstraße 4, 10785 Berlin

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) | Vollzeit
Description:
Mit den Daten der spannendesten Direct to Consumer Brands aus der DACH Region zu arbeiten ist, was du als Data Analyst bei Drip Agency direkt machen kannst

Aufgaben

Du analysierst die Ergebnisse der verschiedenen AB-Tests und gehst tiefer in die analyse
Du baust Dashboards in Datastudio und anderen Tools
Du pflegst unsere Datenbank, die alle Tests die wir jemals gefahren haben beinhaltet und kümmerst dich darum, dass wir durch Learnings noch bessere Tests fahren
Du kategorisierst Tests in verschiedene Dimensionen und bist für unser Projekt Big Data verantwortlich
Du wertest quantitative Daten aus und hilfst dadurch unseren Conversion Optimizern Hypothesen zum Nutzerverhalte aufzustellen


Qualifikation

Du hast mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Web Analytics und besitzt ein technisches Verständnis von Websites
Du hast fundierte Kenntnisse in einem beliebigen Tag Management System
Tiefe Kenntnise in Google Analytics, BigQuery & Bi Software
Erfahrung in der Web- und Datenanalyse
"dataLayer", "Measurement Protocol" & "Payload" sind keine Vokablen für dich
Statistikkenntnisse, hohe Zahlenaffinität, ausgeprägtes analytisches und strategisches Denkvermögen
Bestenfalls hast du Grundkenntnisse in einer oder mehreren Programmiersprache/n (Python, SQL, JavasScript)
Selbständiges und eigenverantwortliches Denken und Handeln


Benefits

🗺 Remote Arbeiten möglich

Du kannst bei uns von überall aus arbeiten - egal ob In Deutschland oder auch im Ausland.

Zudem haben wir immer einen Platz für Dich in unserem Mannheimer Office.

📚 Budget für Kurse & Weiterbildung

Neue Dinge zu lernen liegt in unserer DNA - deshalb wollen wir deine Weiterbilldung fördern.

Du bekommst von uns ein jährliches Budget von bis zu 1000€, das du z.B. für Kurse, Bücher, Seminare o.ä. nutzen kannst.

🤗 Unsere Kunden

Wir arbeiten v.a. mit jungen und schnell wachsenden Unternehmen zusammen. Wir haben ein vielfältiges Kundenportfolio, das deinen Arbeitsalltag bereichert: Spannende Projekte in den Bereichen Fashion, Sports, Lifestyle oder Beauty warten auf Dich!

🏝 30 Tage Urlaub

Um kreativ zu bleiben ist eine Auszeit wichtig. Deine Erhohlung liegt uns am Herzen, deshalb geben wir dir 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr.

🔖 CRO Knowhow

Wir bilden dich nicht nur intern weiter aus, sondern stehen auch regelmäßig im Austausch mit CRO Experten aus dem deutschen und englischsprachigen Raum, denen du deine Fragen stellen kannst und dein Wissen im CRO Bereich erweitern kannst.

🎮 Falls du bei uns in Mannheim arbeitest…

Erwartet dich ein komplett neues Büro mit jederzeit gefülltem Kühlschrank (Snacks, Getränke, Kaffee), chillige Get-Togethers auf der Dachterasse und tägliche Mario Kart Turniere.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d) Data Analytics Platform
Company: WISAG Facility Management Hessen GmbH & Co. KG
Description:
Zurück zu den Stellenanzeigen

Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d) Data Analytics Platform

Unternehmen: Bundesdruckerei GmbH
Standort: Berlin
Vertragsart: Unbefristeter Vertrag

Jetzt bewerben

Gestalten Sie mit uns die digitale Zukunft! Wir suchen Persönlichkeiten mit Teamgeist, die unsere Leidenschaft für den Schutz von Identitäten und Daten teilen, vorausschauend denken und gemeinsam mit uns an sicheren Digitalisierungslösungen arbeiten wollen. Wir sind überzeugt, dass Veränderungen neue Chancen für Entwicklung und Innovation mit sich bringen. Wir bieten Ihnen ein attraktives Arbeitsumfeld mit vielfältigen Karrieremöglichkeiten und eine sichere berufliche Zukunft.

Ihr Aufgabenbereich

Unterstützung bei der fachlichen Konzeption und Umsetzung von Datenanalyse-, Visualisierungs- und Dashboard-Projekten
Ableitung und Generierung von Erkenntnissen und Entscheidungsvorlagen aus den Daten
Unterstützung bei der Erarbeitung und Vorstellung von klaren Handlungsempfehlungen in verständlicher und eindeutiger Form
Zusammenarbeit in einem crossfunktionalen Scrum Team bei der Entwicklung neuer Datenprodukte
Begleitung bei der Durchführung von Anforderungsanalysen für komplexe Datenprodukte
Abstimmung, Beratung und Unterstützung der Stakeholder (Product Owner, Entwickler, Kunde)

Ihr Profil

abgeschlossenes Studium in einem MINT-Studiengang oder ein vergleichbarer Hochschulabschluss mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung
erste Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse
Kenntnisse von Analysemethoden, intuitive Datenvisualisierungen, Prognosemethoden und statistischen Methoden
ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeit, um Erkenntnisse in einer klaren und sachverständlichen Sprache zu vermitteln
SQL-Kenntnisse und Erfahrung im Umgang mit Daten in einer relationalen Datenbankumgebung.
Kenntnisse von einer der gängigen BI-Tools (z.B. Tableau oder PowerBI) und erste praktische Erfahrung mit einer Skriptsprache (Python oder R)
ausgeprägte analytische und problemlösende Fähigkeiten

Ihre Vorteile

Gemeinsam mehr erreichen: toller Teamspirit in einem kompetenten und zukunftssicheren Arbeitsumfeld mit einzigartigen Projekten
Attraktive Arbeitsbedingungen: ausgewogene Balance zwischen Beruf und Privatleben dank flexibler Arbeitsmodelle und -zeiten, 30 Tagen Urlaub im Jahr und mobilem Arbeiten
Moderne Arbeitsausstattung: top Equipment, agile Entwicklungsmethoden mit modernem Tech Stack und innovativen Kollaborationstools
Persönliche Entwicklung: individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie Fach- und Führungskräfteprogramme
Optimale Verkehrsanbindung: attraktiver Standort mit sehr guter Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr
Angebote zum Gesundbleiben: kostenlose Präventionskurse und Laufevents
Weitere Extras: betriebliche Altersvorsorge, vermögenswirksame Leistungen, unterstützende Maßnahmen bei der Kinderbetreuung und der Pflege von Angehörigen

Jetzt bewerben

Die

Bundesdruckerei-Gruppe

Die Bundesdruckerei-Gruppe ist das IT-Sicherheitsunternehmen des Bundes. In den Tochtergesellschaften Bundesdruckerei GmbH, D-Trust GmbH, genua GmbH, iNCO Spółka z o.o und Xecuro GmbH, gestalten hochspezialisierte Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter Deutschlands digitale Zukunft.

Hier erfahren Sie mehr

Bundesdruckerei GmbH

„Made in Germany“ braucht Macherinnen und Macher: Ein Job bei der Bundesdruckerei GmbH verbindet Hightech-Innovation mit gesellschaftlicher Verantwortung. Im Herzen Berlins entstehen Lösungen, die Identitäten und Daten schützen – für einen Wandel, in dem Deutschland, seine Unternehmen und seine Menschen jederzeit selbstbestimmt bleiben.

Hier erfahren Sie mehr

Impressum Datenschutz

Title: Data Analyst - Digital Products
Description:
Working Hours: Monday to Friday (37.5 hours per week)

Location: Hybrid (working from our Bath/Berlin office 3 times per week)

We are expanding our Digital Product Team with an Analyst, to assist with the end-to-end execution of experiment and CRO initiatives across our portfolio of websites.

The purpose of this role is to ensure our storefront and experimentation teams are provided with proactive and regular analysis and reporting to measure performance and act where appropriate.

You will help shape and influence the design and flow through the Lovehoney websites to support the optimisation of user experiences that are intuitive, engaging and provide value to the business. You will be assisting the team in the discovery, design, and development of a wide variety of products, features and journeys, including optimising page layouts, promotional devices, campaign pages, user self-service tools, loyalty engagement journeys and more.

You’ll be responsible for undertaking exploratory analysis to uncover new opportunities for optimisation, pre-launch analysis to support the prioritisation framework and reporting on the impact new code releases have on key metrics and user journeys for each website.

You’ll be a true advocate for the customer, putting your understanding of ecommerce, evidence gathering, statistical analysis and reporting to full use to help form best-in-class website features and functions that will improve the user experience and deliver on business objectives. You’ll thrive on seeing the value added by your work and will develop and hone your technical skills to have maximum commercial impact and relevance to the business.

To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be exceptional at providing clear actionable insight. You’ll love ecommerce, statistical analysis and customer behaviour and have a drive to continuously improve our performance to exceed targets.

If you love working with data, strive to improve business performance and have hands-on experience of experimentation within an ecommerce context then we’d love to meet you.

Key Responsibilities

Regularly review and interrogate the Lovehoney analytical packages to identify emerging user struggles and to measure & report on the performance of newly deployed features and products

Gather and evaluate user feedback, transaction and clickstream data using tools such as GA, ContentSquare and Tableau in collaboration with UX, product managers and developers

Use familiar web analytics tools such as GA360, GA4, GTM and Contentsquare as well as develop bespoke analytics tools and data pipelines using SQL, Python and R

Help develop experiment plans and help shape the experiment roadmap

Deliver insights to Product Managers to inform their decisions and help them prioritise their backlog

Design effective experiments (A/B tests) with data driven hypotheses, calculating appropriate sample sizes & run times and ensure they are run in a scientifically valid way

Analyse experiment data when ready using techniques such as Bayesian inference and Null-hypothesis t-testing

Report on results and test outcomes & keep stakeholders informed, producing clearly articulated summaries of research & testing activities for relevant business stakeholders and the wider business.

Collaborate with our Digital Analytics Implementation Team and Data Teams to help define what we need to measure on our sites to quantify the successes & failures of product features & initiatives

Ad-hoc exploratory analysis of user journeys

Create dashboards in R, Tableau and Google Data Studio to present data drawn from multiple sources in a meaningful

Set up and run data pipelines alongside our BI team, connecting data sources as required for analysis and monitoring

Assist in improving our processes and tooling to enhance our testing & analytics capabilities.

Advise teams on the right metrics to use when setting up experiments and the right way to retrieve those metrics from our data sets during the evaluation phase.

Seek to challenge stakeholders to drive accountability and ownership.

Work closely with our Data/BI and Commercial Insights teams

Deliver ongoing support to product teams to assist them at every stage of the experiment lifecycle, from helping them to decide on the right type of experiment to use, all the way through to making sure they reach the right conclusions when analysing the results.

__Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

A Statistics or Science degree (or similar qualification)

Curious and proactive with a strong attention to detail

1 - 2 years' experience working in a commercially driven team

Advanced in the use of Google Sheets or Excel

Experience in online retail analytics

Strong working knowledge of Google Analytics

SQL, Python, ETL Systems and R for data analysis

Experience with BigQuery and Tableau or similar visualisation tools.

Technical experience of analytical tracking, website tagging and creating intricate funnels.

Experience of A/B/n and Multivariate Testing including a solid understanding of Bayesian & Frequentist statistical approaches

Knowledge & experience with R (ideally including the Tidyverse), SQL and Excel in an experiment analysis context

Be an expert at data storytelling with the ability to distil complex quantitative and qualitative data down to key insights and present actionable recommendations in an accessible and coherent way

Work with the wider analytics teams to ensure we have the correct instrumentation in place to answer business questions. For example, working with the GTM team to support the definition and briefing of site analytics tracking improvements

Strong interest in Digital and/or Agile Product Development

Comfortable working in a fast-paced, changing environment

Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.__

Title: Data Visualization Analyst
Description:
Company: POLITICO

POLITICO is seeking a full-time Data Visualization Analyst to work with a new and fast expanding team of political intelligence and data analysts.

The position is envisaged to begin in January 2023 with hybrid working, located in Berlin.

POLITICO is a pioneering and growing media company that covers the politics, policy, and personalities of the European Union.




Role & Responsibilities

Come work on the most exciting political database in Europe. We are looking for a data visualization analyst to analyze a unique dataset of voting behavior of members of parliament, policy proposals, political speeches, news articles, legislative texts, opinion polls and information on politicians – in short, the most fascinating treasure trove of European political data is waiting for you to be analyzed.

As a pivotal member of our team, you will partner with our data analysts and work hand-in-hand with our analysis team to create the most influential data analyses of EU politics and policies.

You are passionate about telling stories and facts with data visualizations and have a good understanding of political and economic data to produce convincing charts.

You have a strong sense of visual design to make sure text and charts make a compelling composition and the produced content is presented in a way that makes readers want to read more.




Responsibilities include…

Create static data visualizations for written reports
Understand, analyze, summarize, and contextualize political developments in data and charts with relevant external and internal data sources.
Develop the visual building blocks and the visual identity for new data visualization products
Develop interactive charts to be embedded in online articles




The Ideal Candidate Will...

Have an eye for design and be creative
Work independently and take full ownership of the data visualization processes.
Manage the delivery of projects on time.
Enjoy working with complex issues and explaining them in clear charts and figures.
Be like a fish in water when working with datasets of text and political as well as socio-economic data to produce insightful data visualizations, maps and charts.




Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree with master’s degree desirable
>=3 years experience in data related role
Very good knowledge in R and/or Python
Very experienced with packages such as ggplot2
Experience in mapping software such as ArcGIS
Knowledge of JavaScript libraries such as D3 is a plus




About POLITICO

POLITICO is a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy. It is the essential online, mobile and print destination for the most influential people in the world. With publications based in Washington, D.C., New York, London, and Brussels, POLITICO boasts an enormous roster of the most talented reporters and editors in the world.




Equal Opportunity

It is POLITICO's policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals without regard to race, colour, religion, national origin, gender, age or any other characteristic protected by local laws and regulations.

Show more Show less
HTML:
Company: POLITICO

POLITICO is seeking a full-time Data Visualization Analyst to work with a new and fast expanding team of political intelligence and data analysts.

The position is envisaged to begin in January 2023 with hybrid working, located in Berlin.

POLITICO is a pioneering and growing media company that covers the politics, policy, and personalities of the European Union.


Role & Responsibilities

Come work on the most exciting political database in Europe. We are looking for a data visualization analyst to analyze a unique dataset of voting behavior of members of parliament, policy proposals, political speeches, news articles, legislative texts, opinion polls and information on politicians – in short, the most fascinating treasure trove of European political data is waiting for you to be analyzed.

As a pivotal member of our team, you will partner with our data analysts and work hand-in-hand with our analysis team to create the most influential data analyses of EU politics and policies.

You are passionate about telling stories and facts with data visualizations and have a good understanding of political and economic data to produce convincing charts.

You have a strong sense of visual design to make sure text and charts make a compelling composition and the produced content is presented in a way that makes readers want to read more.


Responsibilities include…

  • Create static data visualizations for written reports
  • Understand, analyze, summarize, and contextualize political developments in data and charts with relevant external and internal data sources.
  • Develop the visual building blocks and the visual identity for new data visualization products
  • Develop interactive charts to be embedded in online articles


The Ideal Candidate Will...

  • Have an eye for design and be creative
  • Work independently and take full ownership of the data visualization processes.
  • Manage the delivery of projects on time.
  • Enjoy working with complex issues and explaining them in clear charts and figures.
  • Be like a fish in water when working with datasets of text and political as well as socio-economic data to produce insightful data visualizations, maps and charts.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree with master’s degree desirable
  • >=3 years experience in data related role
  • Very good knowledge in R and/or Python
  • Very experienced with packages such as ggplot2
  • Experience in mapping software such as ArcGIS
  • Knowledge of JavaScript libraries such as D3 is a plus


About POLITICO

POLITICO is a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy. It is the essential online, mobile and print destination for the most influential people in the world. With publications based in Washington, D.C., New York, London, and Brussels, POLITICO boasts an enormous roster of the most talented reporters and editors in the world.


Equal Opportunity

It is POLITICO's policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals without regard to race, colour, religion, national origin, gender, age or any other characteristic protected by local laws and regulations.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d) Data Analytics Platform
Description:
Ihr Aufgabenbereich


Unterstützung bei der fachlichen Konzeption und Umsetzung von Datenanalyse-, Visualisierungs- und Dashboard-Projekten
Ableitung und Generierung von Erkenntnissen und Entscheidungsvorlagen aus den Daten
Mitwirkung bei der Erarbeitung und Vorstellung von Handlungsempfehlungen in anschaulicher Form
Zusammenarbeit in einem crossfunktionalen Scrum-Team bei der Entwicklung neuer Datenprodukte
Begleitung bei der Durchführung von Anforderungsanalysen für komplexe Datenprodukte
Abstimmung mit den Stakeholdern (Product Owner, Entwickler, Kunde) sowie deren Beratung und Support


Ihr Profil


abgeschlossenes Studium in einem MINT-Studiengang oder ein vergleichbarer Hochschulabschluss mit entsprechender Berufspraxis im Bereich der Datenanalyse
Kenntnisse von Analysemethoden, intuitiven Datenvisualisierungen, Prognosemethoden und statistischen Auswertungen
Kommunikationsvermögen, um Erkenntnisse sach- und adressatengerecht zu vermitteln
Erfahrung mit SQL und mit Daten in einer relationalen Datenbankumgebung
praktisches Wissen in einem der gängigen BI-Tools (z. B. Tableau oder PowerBI) sowie in einer Skriptsprache (Python oder R)


Ihre Vorteile


Gemeinsam mehr erreichen: toller Teamspirit in einem kompetenten und zukunftssicheren Arbeitsumfeld mit einzigartigen Projekten
Attraktive Arbeitsbedingungen: ausgewogene Balance zwischen Beruf und Privatleben dank flexibler Arbeitsmodelle und -zeiten, 30 Tagen Urlaub im Jahr und mobilem Arbeiten
Moderne Arbeitsausstattung: top Equipment, agile Entwicklungsmethoden mit modernem Tech Stack und innovativen Kollaborationstools
Persönliche Entwicklung: individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie Fach- und Führungskräfteprogramme
Optimale Verkehrsanbindung: attraktiver Standort mit sehr guter Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr
Angebote zum Gesundbleiben: kostenlose Präventionskurse und Laufevents
Weitere Extras: betriebliche Altersvorsorge, vermögenswirksame Leistungen, unterstützende Maßnahmen bei der Kinderbetreuung und der Pflege von Angehörigen

Title: Mid-Level Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
" We are looking for 2 Mid-Level Data Analyst to join our Product/ Platform team. "




We have two data analysis positions open. One for the "Product Team" with focus on marketing and product development topics and the other is for the "Platform Team" with internal processes topics.




Job Description




As a data analyst in Bonial, you will join a diverse cast of different, great people! One of your main roles will be to act as a mediator between our data universe & our stakeholders. Our main mission is to transform existing data into knowledge that can be employed in an operational sense and empower our stakeholders (operations, finance, people & culture team, etc.). When it comes to achieving this goal, you are often (not always 😉) free to apply different methodological approaches - from creating highly complex dashboards, to classical in-depth analyses, to automating processes - there are almost no boundaries to your creativity! Additionally, we are constantly striving to innovate and improve our technical and business processes.




In short, you will work on end-to-end aspects of data analysis: from gathering, cleaning, and crunching data to creating analysis, visualizing insights, and automating reports. Therefore, it is also important that you are able and willing to freely communicate your ideas, results and work to your peers and stakeholders. All of this is enhanced by your drive to always wanting to learn more, growing personally as well as professionally and a fiery passion for what you do!




You will have a chance to:




Perform deep-dive analysis to support decision-making, such as to give meaning to data, identify opportunities and issues, and present analysis and findings to stakeholders
Work closely with a variety of different departments on a range of interesting initiatives, but also tracking implementation strategies for new products and data quality in general
Develop relevant metrics/KPIs and create reports, visualizations, dashboards (using Power BI, Redash, etc.) to enable business-critical decision-making process
Proactively identify opportunities where data can influence our product & marketing strategy
Improve data practices (tools and best practices) in Bonial





Qualifications




A strong ability to understand and incorporate the big picture into the details of an analysis
At least 3 years of experience working with Data Tools (Such as Power BI, Excel, SQL, Airflow; etc.)
Capable of writing and optimizing advanced SQL queries; and "preferably" a programming language, e.g., Python, R, etc
You have a ‘can-do’ attitude with a passion for analytics and data
Well structured, analytical thinking and ability to explain and visualize complex analysis in a clear understandable manner to a non-technical audience;
Fluency in English [German is not required!]





Nice to Haves:




A degree with an analytical focus (Statistics, Mathematics, Business Informatics, Economics, Finance, Controlling, Business Analysis, etc.);
Knowledge of / experience with our Tools and Focus areas: Salesforce, Finance, Jira
Having experience with big data tools


What we can offer you:




Diversity - proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we aim to enable everyone to show up as their full selves. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and to be a safe space regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender, gender identity or gender expression.




Development - strong support for your professional development with an internal Learning Hub and a feedback culture to help you identify your strengths and opportunities.




Wellbeing - we believe mental health is as important as being fit. That's why we're giving you free access to Nilo, a mental health app. And we can also offer you a corporate pension scheme so you don't have to worry about your retirement.




Sustainability - together with our Green team, we offer you the opportunity to engage in projects that promote sustainability, environmental development and the impact that we make on our planet.




Flexibility - we offer flexible hours, a hybrid setup where you need to be in the office 3 days per month (if you want more, you’re always welcome!), and have the option of working from abroad 30 working days per year (6 weeks). We offer 28 days of holiday, additionally, you get an extra day for each calendar year (up to 30 days) and other occasions (moving, working on a social project, etc).




Modern Office Zen Rooms where employees can pray, relax or simply have some quiet time; fully equipped gym in the office; and a roof terrace for amazing social events.




Free lunch – whenever you’re at the office, we offer you different lunch options – and it’s all on us! Hot and cold drinks, fruit, and other snacks at the office are, of course, also free for our employees.




Social Culture that encourages people to start conversations, build relationships and participate together in the community through regular team events.




Visa Sponsorship: We provide visa sponsorship for those of you who are eager to join us from outside of Germany.




Talent, potential and motivation are crucial for us, more than fitting 100% the technical qualifications. If you feel your profile might be a right match but are not sure about it, please get in touch so we can talk about it!




You can check out our Bonial_people Instagram or read more about Bonial culture and tech on Medium.




ABOUT THE COMPANY:




Bonial is part of Axel Springer SE and is the leading "Drive to Store" platform in Germany and France. Every day we inspire millions of users by connecting them to their favourite shops and brands via our platforms "kaufDA" and "MeinProspekt" in Germany, and “Bonial” in France.




More than 1500 retailers and brands across all sectors rely on our tailor-made, data driven marketing solutions to promote their offers and reach measurable business results with maximised return on investment.




Our more than 300 employees come from all over the world joining together to strengthen their skills and work towards creating innovative digital marketing products for clients and users. We believe in the power of each individual to own their impact and drive meaningful results every day. Our diverse and open culture is the secret sauce to our success and ensures we truly put people at the centre of everything we do. Our data-driven decision making empowers our mission and how we work.

Title: Data Analyst (M/W/D)
Description:
Wir sind die Positive Thinking Company. Wir suchen dein Talent und deine Leidenschaft zur Verstärkung unserer Data & Analytics Experten. Schließ dich uns an, entfalte Deine Fähigkeiten und Talente und stecke unsere Community mit Deiner Begeisterung und deinen Ideen an.

Was uns wichtig ist? Die 3 W’s: Wissensaustausch, Weiterbildungen und Weiterentwicklung. Interessiert? Dann wird’s jetzt spannend:

Aufgaben

Deine Leidenschaft

Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für Kunden
Zusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisieren
Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung
Konsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen


Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kunden echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.

Qualifikation

Dein Talent

Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung
Ca. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics
Technologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder Yellowfin
Erfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von Vorteil
Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region


Benefits

Deine Community

Bei uns schließt Du dich einem dynamischen, erfahrenen Team von anderen engagierten und leidenschaftlichen Data und Analytics Specialists an. Wir wollen immer an unsere Grenzen gehen, um gemeinsam, als Positive Thinking Company, die besten Lösungen zu entwickeln.

Täglich arbeitest du mit inspirierenden Kollegen aus unseren vielfältigen Domains zusammen. Dabei arbeitest du mit Persönlichkeiten wie Bereichsleitern, Projektmanagern, Product Ownern, Entwicklern, Business Analysten und dem Vertrieb zusammen. Unsere Community ist divers: Wir bringen unterschiedliche Backgrounds mit und bündeln unsere kreativen Ideen und Fähigkeiten, um voneinander zu lernen.

Von Anfang an wirst Du in eine Kultur eintauchen, die geprägt ist von Kreativität, Spaß und Zusammenarbeit. Wir lernen aus Fehlern, um unsere Innovationskraft zu beflügeln.

Unser Versprechen

Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.

Das erwartet Dich bei uns:

Onboarding: Du bist ab dem ersten Tag intern vernetzt: Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentorenprogramm
Entwicklung: Entwicklung ist bei uns individuell auf Deine Stärken ausgerichtet: Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online Trainingskatalog, Internationales Arbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Kulturen
Work-Life Balance: Raum für Deine persönliche Lebensplanung (Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, hochflexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg)
Events: Fachlich und mit Spaßfaktor (Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern)
Netzwerken: Connecte Dich mit Deinen Kollegen: innen: Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions
Fehlerkultur: Mache Fehler und teste Dich aus: Wir geben Dir den Freiraum neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten
Prämien: Eine Vielzahl an Prämien für Dein zusätzliches Engagement
Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement


Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du dran.

Du hast noch Fragen? Kontaktier uns gerne.

  • Events: Fachlich und mit Spaßfaktor (Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern)

  • Fehlerkultur: Mache Fehler und teste Dich aus: Wir geben Dir den Freiraum neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten
  • Prämien: Eine Vielzahl an Prämien für Dein zusätzliches Engagement

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d) in Vollzeit
Description:
Die EL PATO Medien GmbH ist ein führendes Medienunternehmen mit Sitz in Berlin und mehr als 60 Mitarbeiter:innen, die verschiedene Medienformate für den deutschsprachigen Gesundheitsmarkt, mit einem besonderen Fokus auf Apotheke und Pharma, gestalten. Unsere Mission ist es, mit digitaler Kommunikation Maßstäbe zu setzen.




Als First Mover sind wir mutig, innovativ und immer am Puls der Zeit. Wir glauben an die Kraft des ersten Schritts und haben seit mehr als 15 Jahren bewiesen, dass wir auf höchstem Qualitätsniveau führen.




Um unseren Vorsprung aufrechtzuerhalten, suchen wir eine:n talentierten Data Analyst (w/m/d) in Vollzeit (40 h / Woche), der/die bereit ist, unser Team mit seinem/ihren Können zu verstärken und unsere Visionen gemeinsam voranzutreiben.




Als Data Analyst (w/m/d) wirst du folgende Aufgaben übernehmen:




Die Integration von Datenquellen aus verschiedenen Bereichen, einschließlich Social Media, CRM-Systemen und Web-Analyse
Aufbereitung und Analyse riesiger Datenmengen
Schaffung von interaktiven Visualisierungen und Dashboards, um die Daten präsentierbar zu machen
Unterstützung des Teams bei der Erkennung von Trends und Mustern in den Daten
Entwicklung von Vorhersagen und Prognosen für zukünftige Entwicklungen
Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Abteilungen, um die Datennutzung im Unternehmen zu maximieren




Wir suchen jemanden mit folgendem Profil:




Abschluss in Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit Datenanalyse-Tools wie R oder Python
Kenntnisse in Datenaufbereitung und -analyse
Bonus: Erfahrung im Machine Learning-Bereich
Bonus: Erfahrung in der Datenvisualisierung mit Tools wie Tableau oder Power BI
Starkes Kommunikationsvermögen und Fähigkeit, komplexe Analysen verständlich zu präsentieren.




Darauf darfst du dich bei uns freuen:




eine anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem erfolgreichen Unternehmen
eine attraktive Vergütung, einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag und flexiblen Urlaub
flexible Arbeitszeiten, mobiles und hybrides Arbeiten, Möglichkeiten für gemeinsames oder einzelnes Arbeiten in unserem Office am Medienstandort Berlin-Adlershof
modernste technische Ausstattung der Office-Räume und eine exzellente Verkehrsanbindung
regelmäßige Mitarbeiter:innen-Events, Fort- und Weiterbildung, effizientes Onboarding, Workation innerhalb der EU, Talent Management und sehr viel Raum für deine Ideen 
Apple Notebooks (auch zur privaten Nutzung), Keyboard, Maus, Bildschirm, Diensthandy




Bist du bereit, deine Fähigkeiten einzubringen und Teil eines First Mover-Teams zu werden, das Bock hat, sich und seine Produkte stetig weiterzuentwickeln? Dann bewirb dich jetzt bei EL PATO!




Kontaktiere Linda Hämmerlein unter +49 30 802080-501 für alle deine Fragen. Bringe deine Bewerbung auf den Punkt und schicke sie an jobs@el-pato.de. Bitte vergiss nicht, dein frühestmögliches Startdatum und deine Gehaltsvorstellungen zu erwähnen.




Wir achten selbstverständlich auf die Vertraulichkeit deiner Bewerbung und respektieren jegliche Sperrvermerke.
