HTML:
Die EL PATO Medien GmbH ist ein führendes Medienunternehmen mit Sitz in Berlin und mehr als 60 Mitarbeiter:innen, die verschiedene Medienformate für den deutschsprachigen Gesundheitsmarkt, mit einem besonderen Fokus auf Apotheke und Pharma, gestalten. Unsere Mission ist es, mit digitaler Kommunikation Maßstäbe zu setzen.


Als First Mover sind wir mutig, innovativ und immer am Puls der Zeit. Wir glauben an die Kraft des ersten Schritts und haben seit mehr als 15 Jahren bewiesen, dass wir auf höchstem Qualitätsniveau führen.


Um unseren Vorsprung aufrechtzuerhalten, suchen wir eine:n talentierten Data Analyst (w/m/d) in Vollzeit (40 h / Woche), der/die bereit ist, unser Team mit seinem/ihren Können zu verstärken und unsere Visionen gemeinsam voranzutreiben.


Als Data Analyst (w/m/d) wirst du folgende Aufgaben übernehmen:


  • Die Integration von Datenquellen aus verschiedenen Bereichen, einschließlich Social Media, CRM-Systemen und Web-Analyse
  • Aufbereitung und Analyse riesiger Datenmengen
  • Schaffung von interaktiven Visualisierungen und Dashboards, um die Daten präsentierbar zu machen
  • Unterstützung des Teams bei der Erkennung von Trends und Mustern in den Daten
  • Entwicklung von Vorhersagen und Prognosen für zukünftige Entwicklungen
  • Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Abteilungen, um die Datennutzung im Unternehmen zu maximieren


Wir suchen jemanden mit folgendem Profil:


  • Abschluss in Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
  • Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit Datenanalyse-Tools wie R oder Python
  • Kenntnisse in Datenaufbereitung und -analyse
  • Bonus: Erfahrung im Machine Learning-Bereich
  • Bonus: Erfahrung in der Datenvisualisierung mit Tools wie Tableau oder Power BI
  • Starkes Kommunikationsvermögen und Fähigkeit, komplexe Analysen verständlich zu präsentieren.


Darauf darfst du dich bei uns freuen:


  • eine anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem erfolgreichen Unternehmen
  • eine attraktive Vergütung, einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag und flexiblen Urlaub
  • flexible Arbeitszeiten, mobiles und hybrides Arbeiten, Möglichkeiten für gemeinsames oder einzelnes Arbeiten in unserem Office am Medienstandort Berlin-Adlershof
  • modernste technische Ausstattung der Office-Räume und eine exzellente Verkehrsanbindung
  • regelmäßige Mitarbeiter:innen-Events, Fort- und Weiterbildung, effizientes Onboarding, Workation innerhalb der EU, Talent Management und sehr viel Raum für deine Ideen 
  • Apple Notebooks (auch zur privaten Nutzung), Keyboard, Maus, Bildschirm, Diensthandy


Bist du bereit, deine Fähigkeiten einzubringen und Teil eines First Mover-Teams zu werden, das Bock hat, sich und seine Produkte stetig weiterzuentwickeln? Dann bewirb dich jetzt bei EL PATO!


Kontaktiere Linda Hämmerlein unter +49 30 802080-501 für alle deine Fragen. Bringe deine Bewerbung auf den Punkt und schicke sie an jobs@el-pato.de. Bitte vergiss nicht, dein frühestmögliches Startdatum und deine Gehaltsvorstellungen zu erwähnen.


Wir achten selbstverständlich auf die Vertraulichkeit deiner Bewerbung und respektieren jegliche Sperrvermerke.

Title: Data Analyst (New Games) - M/F/X
Description:
Popcore is proud to be part of the Take2/Zynga/Rollic group and creates oddly satisfying entertainment for everyone, everywhere, like our number 1 game Parking Jam! We have been listed in the Top 10 hottest Berlin startups & Top 100 European startups by wired.com. Based from our Berlin HQ, our teams have developed and released chart-topping ad-driven free-to-play mobile games that have been downloaded far more than 500 million times across iOS and Android, including 5+ Top 10 hit games.

What will you do:

Support the New Games' team with quantitative analyses and A/B test design
Own and drive a deep understanding of user behavior and help New Games scale
Designing, testing and improving user tracking for New Games
Share your findings with the game teams and other non technical stakeholders
Collaborate with BI Analysts, Data Scientists and Game Analysts in a variety of analytics related projects (tools, features' analyses, tracking design, data modeling …)
Design and implement reports in Tableau that will allow stakeholders to understand complex correlations between KPIs
Write complex data flows using SQL & DBT
Ensure data integrity and consistency


What we are looking for:

2+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or similar position. Strong preference for backgrounds in gaming (particularly hypercasual), ad tech, or marketing
Proficiency in Tableau
High proficiency in SQL and relational databases
Experience in any scripting language will be considered a plus (preferably Python)
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal
Strong knowledge of undergraduate statistics: distributions, uncertainty, biases, hypothesis testing, etc
Analytical thinking with the ability to break problems down easily


Why you will love Popcore:

Grow with us We want to enable you to take charge of your career and embark on opportunities that will challenge, motivate and grow you. Our learning and development budget will is one of our ways to help you achieve this
Be part of the team Join an international team of highly qualified and deeply motivated creative and technical people
Work your way Set your own work hours, schedule, and location. It's your work, your choice
Join the tech hub Learn and work with the latest tools and technology, and connect with the best talent in the industry
Relocation aid Relocate seamlessly, we take care of visas, accommodation and support you with paper work
Health and Wellbeing Your wellbeing comes first! Get secure health insurance and wellbeing package included* depending on location
Hybrid/Remote working We can embrace this working environment and can be available depending on location and role
Vacation days You deserve a well earned break! We offer up to 37 days holiday (inc public holidays)
Planning ahead We offer a company pension as standard
Office When traveling to the office we cover your BVG or bike/e-scooter rental along with free daily lunches and onsite snacks


If this sounds like it ticks all your boxes, stop reading and apply now!

Please don't worry if you don't have an up to date resume just send it along and one of our talent team will be in touch.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities in order to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment

Title: Data Analyst - Capacity Planning (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description




We are Flink - your online supermarket revolutionizing the way you do your grocery shopping. With a wide selection of over 2,400 high-quality products, we aim to deliver to your door in minutes. We put our customers first and ensure all products delivered are fresh and nutritious. Additionally, we can customize our national assortment to be able to offer you unique local products in every city. Our delivery hubs are located in densely populated inner-city locations and we strive to be sustainable by delivering on electric bikes and using packaging that can be recycled.




If you want to be part of this exciting journey… read on!




Job Description




You will be the main point of contact between Rider Operations and Data Science to ensure our forecasting & capacity planning leads to maximum productivity while maintaining good service levels
You work closely with rider growth to make sure our hiring targets are in line with the required rider capacity to cope with order growth and demand patterns intra-week/day
You will empower local operations teams with reports, dashboards, and ad-hoc analysis that supports their shift scheduling & assignments
You will conduct regular performance reviews with local & central operations teams, understand issues and concerns regarding suggested/actual scheduling, and align together on action plans




Qualifications




You have 2+ years of work experience in a quantitative field - e.g. consulting, operations (capacity planning experience is a plus)
Bachelor or Masters degree in Mathematics, Statistics, IT, Finance or similar area
1.5+ years of experience in an analytical field
Very good working knowledge of SQL
Previous experience working with R, or Python and common data libraries
Experience with Python, unstructured data, machine learning techniques will be considered as an advantage
Good knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel
You excel at building and managing relationships with cross-functional partners and stakeholders
You are proficient in English. German is a big plus




Additional Information




A €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with RYDES, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance




We pride ourselves in being an inclusive and equal opportunities employer with a diverse and multicultural team. It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

Title: Data Analyst for Energy Market
Description:
We recruit and prepare international green technicians for Germany’s energy transition. We serve German partners operating in the fields of offshore and onshore wind, solar, heat-pump installation, hydrogen and geothermal energy.

Based in Berlin, we are a member of the European Solar PV Industry Alliance, the Berlin Senate's Solarcity Masterplan, and work with companies actively supporting the German Federal Government's Renewable Energy Sources Act (EEG 2023).

Tasks

We are currently sourcing Data Analysts specialising in Renewable Energies with B1/2 German language proficiency and B2 English language proficiency. To be considered, you will need to demonstrate the following:

Requirements

Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university
Equivalent knowledge and experience with market research
Experience in analysing energy-related market data is preferred
Knowledge of European energy data is beneficial


Benefits

All positions offered through us are socially secured and based in multiple regions across Germany. This means relocation may be required. We support both technicians and companies with internal relocation services, professional recognition via the IHK/HWK (for electrical installation activities and/or where desired by the company), as well as with additional supporting documents related to work permits.

Submit your CV here on JOIN or to our e-mail address. We aim to reply to suitable candidates within three working days with a short questionnaire and/or invite to a pre-interview. German-based respondents with CEF-B1 German who meet minimum criteria will be added to our growing pool of green technicians ready for presentation to partners.

If you do not speak B1 German, we offer selected international energy and environmental professionals intensive, affordable bridging courses to help them quickly gain professional fluency in German. Note: participation in these remote courses is currently only offered to those who can meet the above requirements or similar.

Title: Growth Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat forever by offering our customers high quality food and recipes for different meal occasions. Over the past 10 years, we've seen this mission spread around the world and beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit company, active in 18 countries across 3 continents. So, how did we do it? Our weekly boxes full of exciting recipes and fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of customers looking for delicious, healthy and sustainable options. The HelloFresh Group now includes our core brand, HelloFresh, as well as: Green Chef, EveryPlate, Chefs Plate, Factor_, and Youfoodz.

The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company’s performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don’t “tick all the boxes” but think you’d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do

You will provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
You will work closely with stakeholders from Growth channels, cross-functions and translate their business questions into structured and meaningful analytics - combining business and technical understanding
Your work will span across creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
You will be utilising various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
You will discuss the results of your work to stakeholders of various seniority
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts

What You’ll Bring

3+ years of experience in Data Analytics/ Business Intelligence/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Data Science
1+ years of experience in marketing related domains (special focus on campaign and channel management)
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferred experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics (campaign analytics, channel efficiency, Lift Test, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL & Python with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in Tableau paired with understanding of data structures and warehousing
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills
Hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently

What We Offer

Healthy discount on weekly HelloFresh boxes
Annual learning and development budget to attend conferences or purchase educational resources plus access to the HelloFresh Academy
Budget for home office supplies
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 70+ different nationalities
Additional perks include: Free crash course in German, compensation for advanced external German classes, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, summer & winter parties, discount on our Convini vending machines
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

About HelloFresh

We believe that sharing a meal brings people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures together. We are committed to celebrating all dimensions of diversity in the workplace equally and ensuring that everyone feels a sense of inclusion and belonging. We also aim to extend this commitment to the partners we work with and the communities we serve. We are constantly listening, learning, and evolving to deliver on these principles. We are proud of our collaborative culture. Our diverse employee population enables us to connect with our customers and turn their feedback into meaningful action - from developing new recipes to constantly improving our process of getting dinner to our customers’ homes. Our culture attracts top talent with shared values and forms the foundation for a great place to work!

At HelloFresh, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of an individual's race, national origin, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, marital status or any other protected characteristic under applicable law, whether actual or perceived. As part of the Company’s commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable accommodations, up to the point of undue hardship, to candidates at any stage, including to individuals with disabilities.

We want to adapt our processes and create a safe space that welcomes everyone so please let us know how we can accommodate our process. In case you have any accessibility requirements you can share that with us in the application form.

To learn more about what it's like working inside HelloFresh, follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Datum: 09.02.2023

Standort:

Nürnberg, BY, DE, 90449 Düsseldorf, NW, DE, 40474 Teltow, BB, DE, 14513 München, BY, DE, 80992 Hamburg, HH, DE, 22297

Unternehmen: GER - Telefónica Germany GmbH & Co. OHG

Vertragsart: Vollzeit, unbefristet

Eintritt: ab nächstmöglichem Zeitpunkt

Working anywhere. Wir arbeiten dort, wo es am produktivsten ist. Darum hast Du, nach erfolgreichem Bewerbungsprozess, die Möglichkeit deutschlandweit zu arbeiten. Bei Telefónica setzen wir auf ein flexibles Hybridmodell, das sowohl die Vorteile von Remote- als auch Vor-Ort-Arbeiten angemessen berücksichtigt. Du wirst entsprechend Deinem Wohnort, dem nächsten Telefónica Standort zugeordnet. Weitere Details besprechen wir mit Dir im Bewerbungsprozess.

Wer wir sind

Wir sind O2 Telefónica – mit unseren Mobilfunkmarken verbinden wir Millionen von Menschen und bieten unseren Kunden mobile Freiheit in der digitalen Welt. Darüber hinaus gestalten wir als führender Telekommunikationsanbieter maßgeblich die Digitalisierung in Deutschland mit. Unsere rund 7.400 Mitarbeiter hierzulande treiben die Transformation jeden Tag ein Stück voran – auch in unserem eigenen Unternehmen. Telefónica zählt zu den Top-Arbeitgebern in Deutschland und ist Teil des globalen Telekommunikationskonzerns Telefónica S.A. mit mehr als 110.000 engagierten Mitarbeitern weltweit.

Werde auch Du Teil unseres einzigartigen Teams und lass uns gemeinsam etwas bewegen! 

Was Dich erwartet

Erstellen von ad hoc Datenauswertungen zur Steuerung der Rollout-Partner
Ableiten von Korrekturmaßnahmen und Lösungsvorschlägen sowie deren Nachverfolgung
Verfolgen der aktuellen Rolloutprozesse (Access und Transport) und Abhängigkeiten (Guidelines)
Analysieren von Projektfortschritten in den Rolloutkategorien / identifizieren von Abweichungen von der Baseline
Verknüpfen verschiedener Datenquellen zur Verifizierung von Prozessabläufen
Erstellung von ad hoc Reports und Tools bei individuellen Fragestellungen
Bereitstellung von bestehenden ad hoc Werkzeugen sowie deren Überführung in die Standardtoolwelt
Austausch mit den Anwendern um ggf. Entwicklungen / Bedarfe zu eruieren


Was Du mitbringst

Abgeschlossene Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsingenieur, IT, oder Kommunikationstechnik
Mehrjährige (mind. 5 Jahre) Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Mobilfunkrollout (Access & Transport) sowie in angrenzenden Bereichen (Projekt Steering und Delivery Management/ Reporting)
Erfahrungen im Bereich Softwareentwicklung/ IT sind von Vorteil
Erfahrung in der Erstellung von Microsoft basierten Lösungen (Excel Programmierung, PBI)
Sichere Kommunikation (Wort und Schrift) in Englisch und Deutsch


Was wir Dir bieten

Modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld: Arbeite innerhalb Deutschlands wo Du willst. Ob im Homeoffice oder einem unserer Büros. Wir bieten Dir dabei maximale Flexibilität Deinen Arbeitstag zu gestalten.

Weiterbildung & Entwicklung: Alles, was Du für Deinen individuellen Wachstumsweg brauchst. Mit einem persönlichem Entwicklungsplan, Learning Journeys und der Möglichkeit von Job Rotations, erreichst Du mit uns Deine Ziele – entsprechend unserem Leitgedanken „connect, learn and move2grow".

Finanzielle Vorteile: Ein Smartphone zur dienstlichen und privaten Nutzung sowie die Möglichkeit über ein Guthaben auch Partner, Freunde und Familie zu versorgen, ist für uns selbstverständlich. Darüber hinaus profitierst Du von einer Vielzahl an Corporate Benefits.

Gesundheit: Unser „Feel Good“ Programm sorgt dafür, dass es Dir gut geht. Unter anderem bieten wir Fitnesskurse, Ernährungsberatungen und Angebote zur Verbesserung der Ergonomie am Arbeitsplatz sowie der Work-Life-Balance an.

Soziales Engagement: Wir engagieren uns auch außerhalb der Unternehmensgrenzen. Du kannst im Rahmen von Volunteering Days / Holidays oder Spendenläufen soziale Projekte unterstützen.

Wie Du Dich bewirbst und was Du noch wissen solltest

Überzeuge uns mit Deinem aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf sowie dazugehörigen Zeugnissen. Ein Motivationsschreiben oder Anschreiben brauchst Du bei uns nicht. Bitte beachte, dass Bewerbungen nur über unser Bewerberportal möglich sind und Bewerbungen per E-Mail nicht berücksichtigt werden können.

Du hast Fragen zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess und Interesse an weiteren Informationen zu der Stelle? Dann wende dich bitte an unser Recruiting Team (de-recruiting@telefonica.com).

Bei gleicher Eignung werden Bewerber:innen mit einer Schwerbehinderung bevorzugt berücksichtigt. Alle Geschlechter sind gleichermaßen willkommen.

Title: Data Analyst*in im Mautumfeld (d/m/w)
Description:
Ihre Aufgaben




Sie erstellen und visualisieren statistische Auswertungen auf Basis mehrdimensionaler Daten
Sie pflegen & optimieren Reportingtools und Skripte inkl. Anwenderunterstützung und -beratung, welche im Bereich eingesetzt werden
Sie überwachen Datenschnittstellen und betreiben Problemanalyse und Problembehebung im Störungsfall
Sie arbeiten maßgeblich bei der Entwicklung von Fachbereichs-Kennzahlen mit und bereiten diese management-tauglich auf
Sie entwickeln ein Monitoring für den Kontrollprozess mit und arbeiten an der Konzeption der dafür notwendigen Konfigurationen und Parameter
Sie führen Applikationstests durch und setzten diese nach Releasefreigabe um
Sie arbeiten aktiv an Zukunftsthemen und Projekten mit & bringen Ihre Ideen und Kenntnisse im Bereich künstliche Intelligenz und Digitalisierung von Prozessen ein
Sie bringen Ideen zur Optimierung des Reportings für das Bundesamt für Logistik und Mobilität mit ein




Ihr Profil




Sie haben bereits erste Erfahrung als Data Scientist oder Business Intelligence Analyst gesammelt und suchen nun eine neue Herausforderung
Sie haben vorzugsweise ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung
Sie haben sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Statistik und Erfahrung mit Reporting- und DataWarehouse-Systemen
Sie bringen Routine im Umgang mit Datenbanken mit
Sie verfügen über Erfahrung in der Analyse und Modellierung und haben ein großes Interesse an der Automatisierung von Prozessen
Sie haben ein ausgeprägtes analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen sowie einen selbstständigen und strukturierten Arbeitsstil




Das bieten wir




Breites Qualifizierungsangebot zur fachlichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung
Hybrides Arbeiten
Interdisziplinäres, motiviertes und dynamisches Team, das Fortschritt gestaltet
Attraktive Vergütung sowie umfangreiche Sozialleistungen vom Job-Ticket über einen Zuschuss zum Mittagessen bis zur betrieblichen Altersversorgung




Interessiert?




Wir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit Angabe des frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins und des voraussichtlichen Studienendes. Bitte senden Sie uns Ihre Unterlagen ausschließlich als PDF-Datei mit insgesamt maximal 3 MB zu. Die Verarbeitung ihrer personenbezogenen Daten erfolgt entsprechend unserer Datenschutzerklärung für Bewerbungen.




Bewerber*innen mit einer Schwerbehinderung (d/m/w) werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt eingestellt.




Ihre Ansprechperson




Jule Heldt




030/74077-3653
karriere@toll-collect.de




Toll Collect GmbH




Personalmanagement
Linkstraße 4, 10785 Berlin

Title: Data Analyst - Digital Products
Description:
Working Hours: Monday to Friday (37.5 hours per week)




Location: Hybrid (working from our Bath/Berlin office 3 times per week)




We are expanding our Digital Product Team with an Analyst, to assist with the end-to-end execution of experiment and CRO initiatives across our portfolio of websites.




The purpose of this role is to ensure our storefront and experimentation teams are provided with proactive and regular analysis and reporting to measure performance and act where appropriate.




You will help shape and influence the design and flow through the Lovehoney websites to support the optimisation of user experiences that are intuitive, engaging and provide value to the business. You will be assisting the team in the discovery, design, and development of a wide variety of products, features and journeys, including optimising page layouts, promotional devices, campaign pages, user self-service tools, loyalty engagement journeys and more.




You’ll be responsible for undertaking exploratory analysis to uncover new opportunities for optimisation, pre-launch analysis to support the prioritisation framework and reporting on the impact new code releases have on key metrics and user journeys for each website.




You’ll be a true advocate for the customer, putting your understanding of ecommerce, evidence gathering, statistical analysis and reporting to full use to help form best-in-class website features and functions that will improve the user experience and deliver on business objectives. You’ll thrive on seeing the value added by your work and will develop and hone your technical skills to have maximum commercial impact and relevance to the business.




To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be exceptional at providing clear actionable insight. You’ll love ecommerce, statistical analysis and customer behaviour and have a drive to continuously improve our performance to exceed targets.




If you love working with data, strive to improve business performance and have hands-on experience of experimentation within an ecommerce context then we’d love to meet you.




Key Responsibilities




Regularly review and interrogate the Lovehoney analytical packages to identify emerging user struggles and to measure & report on the performance of newly deployed features and products




Gather and evaluate user feedback, transaction and clickstream data using tools such as GA, ContentSquare and Tableau in collaboration with UX, product managers and developers




Use familiar web analytics tools such as GA360, GA4, GTM and Contentsquare as well as develop bespoke analytics tools and data pipelines using SQL, Python and R




Help develop experiment plans and help shape the experiment roadmap




Deliver insights to Product Managers to inform their decisions and help them prioritise their backlog




Design effective experiments (A/B tests) with data driven hypotheses, calculating appropriate sample sizes & run times and ensure they are run in a scientifically valid way




Analyse experiment data when ready using techniques such as Bayesian inference and Null-hypothesis t-testing




Report on results and test outcomes & keep stakeholders informed, producing clearly articulated summaries of research & testing activities for relevant business stakeholders and the wider business.




Collaborate with our Digital Analytics Implementation Team and Data Teams to help define what we need to measure on our sites to quantify the successes & failures of product features & initiatives




Ad-hoc exploratory analysis of user journeys




Create dashboards in R, Tableau and Google Data Studio to present data drawn from multiple sources in a meaningful




Set up and run data pipelines alongside our BI team, connecting data sources as required for analysis and monitoring




Assist in improving our processes and tooling to enhance our testing & analytics capabilities.




Advise teams on the right metrics to use when setting up experiments and the right way to retrieve those metrics from our data sets during the evaluation phase.




Seek to challenge stakeholders to drive accountability and ownership.




Work closely with our Data/BI and Commercial Insights teams




Deliver ongoing support to product teams to assist them at every stage of the experiment lifecycle, from helping them to decide on the right type of experiment to use, all the way through to making sure they reach the right conclusions when analysing the results.




Skills, Knowledge and Expertise




A Statistics or Science degree (or similar qualification)




Curious and proactive with a strong attention to detail




1 - 2 years' experience working in a commercially driven team




Advanced in the use of Google Sheets or Excel




Experience in online retail analytics




Strong working knowledge of Google Analytics




SQL, Python, ETL Systems and R for data analysis




Experience with BigQuery and Tableau or similar visualisation tools.




Technical experience of analytical tracking, website tagging and creating intricate funnels.




Experience of A/B/n and Multivariate Testing including a solid understanding of Bayesian & Frequentist statistical approaches




Knowledge & experience with R (ideally including the Tidyverse), SQL and Excel in an experiment analysis context




Be an expert at data storytelling with the ability to distil complex quantitative and qualitative data down to key insights and present actionable recommendations in an accessible and coherent way




Work with the wider analytics teams to ensure we have the correct instrumentation in place to answer business questions. For example, working with the GTM team to support the definition and briefing of site analytics tracking improvements




Strong interest in Digital and/or Agile Product Development




Comfortable working in a fast-paced, changing environment




Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Dein Herz schlägt für die Datenanalyse?




Management komplexer Datenanalyse-Projekte in unserem Data Insight Services-Team
Crossfunktionale Zusammenarbeit mit Teams zum Eruieren von Anforderungen und Herausforderungen sowie der Entwicklung von Datenlösungen
Systematische Entwicklung und Anwendung statistischer Algorithmen zur Analyse mehrdimensionaler Massendaten
Visualisierung von Datenanalysen und Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen für die Fachbereiche
Kommunikation mit verschiedenen Ebenen des Managements und der Fachbereiche
Mitarbeit am Ausbau des Datawarehouses und der Datenanalyseplattform
Marktbeobachtung und forschung im Bereich der aktuellen Technologien




Wir Suchen Jemanden Wie Dich




Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Datenwissenschaften, Statistik, Mathematik, Informatik oder eines verwandten Studienganges
Praktische Erfahrungen im Bereich Datenanalyse und Datenmanagement
Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Anforderungsanalyse, Data Mining und visuelle Analyse von Massendaten
Erfahrungen in der Datenintegration von mehrdimensionalen und unstrukturierten Massendaten
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten sowie Problemlösungsfähigkeiten
Begeisterungsfähigkeit für das Erlernen neuer Datenanalysewerkzeuge und -technologien
Gute Kommunikations- und Dokumentationsfähigkeiten
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. C1-Niveau)




Freu Dich Drauf




Zukunftsweisendes Unternehmen mit familiärer Unternehmenskultur
Ein Arbeitsumfeld zum Wohlfühlen, in dem Spaß gepaart ist mit Professionalität und Kreativität mit hohem Qualitätsanspruch
Gestaltungsfreiraum und Eigenverantwortung bei der Entwicklung der Technik von morgen
Flexibles Arbeiten zur guten Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben
Gemeinsam vor Ort und konzentriert von Zuhause arbeiten - wir kombinieren beides
Strukturierte Einarbeitung mit bereichsübergreifenden Netzwerkveranstaltungen für einen optimalen Start
Vielfältige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten und ein Voneinander-miteinander-Lernen auf hohem technischen Niveau, z.B. im Rahmen unserer Developer Coffee Breaks
Großzügige Vergünstigung beim ÖPNV-Ticket - der Umwelt zuliebe




Interessiert?




Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung.




Online Bewerben
Show more Show less
HTML:
Dein Herz schlägt für die Datenanalyse?


  • Management komplexer Datenanalyse-Projekte in unserem Data Insight Services-Team
  • Crossfunktionale Zusammenarbeit mit Teams zum Eruieren von Anforderungen und Herausforderungen sowie der Entwicklung von Datenlösungen
  • Systematische Entwicklung und Anwendung statistischer Algorithmen zur Analyse mehrdimensionaler Massendaten
  • Visualisierung von Datenanalysen und Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen für die Fachbereiche
  • Kommunikation mit verschiedenen Ebenen des Managements und der Fachbereiche
  • Mitarbeit am Ausbau des Datawarehouses und der Datenanalyseplattform
  • Marktbeobachtung und forschung im Bereich der aktuellen Technologien


Wir Suchen Jemanden Wie Dich


  • Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Datenwissenschaften, Statistik, Mathematik, Informatik oder eines verwandten Studienganges
  • Praktische Erfahrungen im Bereich Datenanalyse und Datenmanagement
  • Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Anforderungsanalyse, Data Mining und visuelle Analyse von Massendaten
  • Erfahrungen in der Datenintegration von mehrdimensionalen und unstrukturierten Massendaten
  • Starke analytische Fähigkeiten sowie Problemlösungsfähigkeiten
  • Begeisterungsfähigkeit für das Erlernen neuer Datenanalysewerkzeuge und -technologien
  • Gute Kommunikations- und Dokumentationsfähigkeiten
  • Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. C1-Niveau)


Freu Dich Drauf


  • Zukunftsweisendes Unternehmen mit familiärer Unternehmenskultur
  • Ein Arbeitsumfeld zum Wohlfühlen, in dem Spaß gepaart ist mit Professionalität und Kreativität mit hohem Qualitätsanspruch
  • Gestaltungsfreiraum und Eigenverantwortung bei der Entwicklung der Technik von morgen
  • Flexibles Arbeiten zur guten Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben
  • Gemeinsam vor Ort und konzentriert von Zuhause arbeiten - wir kombinieren beides
  • Strukturierte Einarbeitung mit bereichsübergreifenden Netzwerkveranstaltungen für einen optimalen Start
  • Vielfältige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten und ein Voneinander-miteinander-Lernen auf hohem technischen Niveau, z.B. im Rahmen unserer Developer Coffee Breaks
  • Großzügige Vergünstigung beim ÖPNV-Ticket - der Umwelt zuliebe


Interessiert?


Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung.


Online Bewerben

Title: Business Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Timeless is a platform where you can buy limited shares of exclusive assets, such as rare sneakers, watches and luxury cars, and profit from their performance. Help us grow and develop this great product for the 21st century. Invest in #thingsyoulove

Tasks

You work closely with our Product & Design teams to bring a data-driven approach to product and app development
You dive deep into our data, analysing it and translating it into business intelligence solutions such as dashboards and reports), delivering business trends and actionable insights to stakeholders.
You conceptualise, set up and conduct experiments that deliver data insights and support us in making data-driven business decisions
You offer a deep understanding of user behaviour and support event and conversion tracking, making it possible to fine-tune user engagement and quantify the end-to-end user journey
You coordinate with data engineering, DevOps and app-development teams to build and setups tools that deliver analytical insights for analytics & insights
You champion data across our organisation and drive stakeholders to make data-driven decisions


Requirements

You completed your Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Economics, Physics, Maths, Statistics, Empirical Social Science, Natural Science, Computer Science, or Business/Data Analytics
At least 3 years of experience in a data analyst or similar quantitative role, ideally in B2C product (or even better, in fintech context)
You have excellent oral and written communication, as well as presentation skills
You have an analytical mindset and the ability to apply scientific thinking to solve business problems with data and analytics
You are able to bring data insights to life and tell a story with data and your analysis
You are proficient in SQL, R and Python and have hands-on experience with data tools.
Have worked with product analytics tools and have in-depth knowledge on their integration in digital products (mobile apps)


Benefits

30 days vacation and monthly health promotion initiatives (weekly yoga sessions etc.)
Team spirit: No divas and flat hierarchies! An engaging team, working together on a product we all love
Grow together: We are growing and you will grow with us! How? With a


challenging environment and an international team that will support you

in everything
Personal Development: A dedicated personal development budget (1800€/year) for trainings, workshops and courses
The #newnormal: flexible working hours and a hybrid (or full-time) work setup that can be adapted to your personal needs
Remote support: initiatives to support you working remotely, including


providing you with what you need to improve your home office

environment, as well as weekly team games
Startup perks: Regular virtual team events and surprise packages delivered straight to your home address!
Visa Sponsorship: If you need to relocate, we offer visa sponsorship and will support you throughout the process!
No one knows what you need in order to work at your best better than yourself. Let us know and we’ll try and make it happen!


At Timeless Investments, it goes without saying that all applicants receive equal opportunity – regardless of gender, nationality, religion, language, origin, age, appearance, culture, body, social or economic status, or sexual orientation. We embrace diversity and aspire to grow together while creating an inclusive work environment in which diversity and uniqueness are celebrated.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital Marketing (all genders)
HTML:
For 25 years, Native Instruments has been at the heart of musical innovation. We've created communities, pushed technological boundaries, and opened new creative horizons for amateurs and professionals alike. Guided by our mission to make music creation more inclusive and accessible, Native hardware, software, and digital services provide fully-integrated solutions for musicians, producers, and DJs of all genres and levels of experience. Native Instruments is part of Soundwide, whose mission is to make music and audio creation a more joyful and inspiring experience for creators everywhere by helping them to find, and stay in, their creative flow. Soundwide's collective vision is to inspire and empower creators to express themselves and reimagine the future of sound.

Our Commercial Data Insights team designs, builds and maintains data models, reports and dashboards for stakeholders throughout our organization. We manage, evaluate and mine vast volumes of web, sales, customer and usage data for information and insights to enable data-informed business choices. Our data team collaborates with all level contributors in Marketing and Product Creation on stimulating projects, transforming Soundwide into an insights driven organization where analysis, data and reasoning are embedded in all decisions - large and small.

What You'll Do
  • Evaluate user experience, engagement and purchasing data across our digital touchpoints to provide insights and actionable advice for marketing purposes;
  • Collaborating with our Digital Marketing Managers, you will develop insightful reports & dashboards to evaluate and optimize campaign performance;
  • Turn business questions into clear analysis problems and search for answers by assessing historical information, collecting new data and conducting experiments;
  • You will collaborate with data engineers, data scientists and digital marketing managers at different levels of seniority to implement a data strategy, expand our data-driven marketing campaigns and increase the data literacy throughout our organization;
  • Build relationships and connect with a range of internal stakeholders to create and refine the tools and processes needed to support the commercial growth of our e-commerce business.

What You'll Need
  • You bring previous working experience in similar roles, having operated in more technical positions (i.e data engineer, web developer or BI developer) would be considered a plus for this role;
  • A strong investigative mindset and your demonstrated ability to collaborate with stakeholders and translate requests into requirements;
  • A profound knowledge of SQL is a must, any additional knowledge of Python or R is a plus;
  • A solid understanding of descriptive statistics and exploratory data analysis;
  • Experience with modern data analytics tools and platforms, especially the Google stack: Google Analytics / Tag Manager / Ads, BigQuery, Data Studio;
  • Your demonstrated experience in leveraging analytics and systematic experimentation to improve e-commerce KPIs for customer acquisition and engagement;
  • Hands-on experience in data-driven performance optimisation in one or more of these areas: email and digital ad campaigns, attribution modeling, conversion rate optimization;
  • Your strong sense of ownership, and your ability to achieve high-quality results based on imperfect data;
  • You are fluent in English with strong verbal and visual communication skills in order to present your findings to diverse audience groups.

About Us

Native Instruments is a Soundwide company; together we embrace diversity and a respect for all people. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we believe the foundation of our dynamic and pioneering spirit starts with a fair and inclusive culture. At Soundwide we strive to embrace teamwork and passion, deliver inspiring experiences, continuously innovate and empower our communities, while also serving our planet.

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment at Native Instruments and we encourage everyone to apply – regardless of gender identity, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Help us reach our goal in making the future of music diverse, inclusive and exciting! We encourage you to submit your application without the requirement for a photograph, identifying factors or personal status information.

Title: Data Analyst - Editorial Content Experience (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM




We are looking for a strong DataAnalyst to shape analytics for a new editorial project as part of the Content Analytics team based at Zalando’s headquarters in Berlin. The project is a multi-year transformational shift in how we release, elevate, and provide context around our most exciting brands and assortment to our Zalando audience. We want to develop a deeper emotional bond with our customers and brand partners through inspirational storytelling and authentic written content, centred around new and exciting brand collaborations, cultural trends and moments, as well as hyped products and exclusives.




As a DataAnalyst you will define how the data of this editorial content on our website and app is tracked, build relevant monitoring, and run deep dives or experiments to analyse the performance and derive insights. You will assess the value of the content being produced to help shape the Content & Programming team’s short and long term editorial strategy with data. Additionally, your insights will be needed for assortment curation, to shape product development and brand partner strategy. You will directly collaborate with our team of analysts and data engineers, with your stakeholders within the Content & Programming team, and a diverse group of other teams and roles across the organisation, like product, software engineering, assortment supply,partner strategy and creative.




INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN




At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.




We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.




do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy




Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups




WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Drive the development of how we measure inspirational editorial content, which will help us with steering and have a direct impact on the long term development of the editorial content experience on Zalando
Enable data-driven decision-making across Demand, Product and Supply functions by defining relevant KPIs and interpreting the results, as well as by defining the right format to share this information with the wider project team
Work with large, complex data sets by applying advanced analytical methods and statistics to improve the customer experience related to content (SQL, Python)
Own and perform deep dive analyses on various editorial content experience related business questions
Develop and automate reports, iteratively design and build dashboards to provide content insights at scale whilst driving innovation
Driving product experimentation from analytical side (e.g. test hypothesis formulation, sample size estimation, A/B test results analysis)


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR




Academic degree in a quantitative field such as economics, business analysis, statistics, mathematics, marketing or their equivalent.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Business Analytics, Digital Analytics, Product/Data Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL-based languages and good understanding of databases and data modelling
Good marketing understanding
Basic statistical knowledge for data analysis
Experience in at least one programming language, preferably Python
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Quick thinking and proactive attitude, which also means keeping on top of things in a fast-paced & changing environment
Ability to easily adapt to change and work independently





Nice to have




Experience with A/B testing and advanced statistics knowledge
Google Analytics Certification and experience with BigQuery
Digital / E-Commerce business knowledge
Experience with Airflow, Databricks, GitHub
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Google DataStudio, Tableau etc.





If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!




OUR OFFER




Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.




Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review





Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us




Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Title: Data Analyst/Specialist Finance (w/m/d)
Description:
Über uns

ONOMOTION ist ein europäisches Technologieunternehmen mit Sitz in Berlin. Das Ziel des Unternehmens ist es, die Lebensqualität in Städten zu verbessern, indem es die urbane Logistik neu denkt. Es verbindet die Themen Mikromobilität, Containerisierung, Physisches Internet und künstliche Intelligenz, um die Citylogistik deutlich effizienter und nachhaltiger zu gestalten. Das E-Cargobike, die ONO, ist in vielen deutschen Städten bei den Kund:innen im Einsatz. ONOMOTION hat aktuell 90 Mitarbeiter:innen.

Aufgaben

Deine Aufgaben - Tu was Du liebst

Durch Deinen Beitrag werden wir effizienter und transparenter in der Umsetzung unserer Unternehmensstrategie
Du extrahierst, strukturierst und analysierst unternehmensweit Daten und unterstützt uns damit maßgeblich, die richtigen Entscheidungen zu treffen
In Zusammenarbeit mit den Gründern, dem CFO und den Fachbereichsleitungen entwickelst Du die Datenstrukturen und -systeme sowohl im Financebereich als auch in angegliederten Systemen
Du führst zentrale Erfolgsmetriken ein und verantwortest den Unternehmensplanungsprozess
Du erstellst und optimierst Reports für wertschaffende Analysen zur Unternehmenssteuerung und kannst daraus Entwicklungspotentiale ableiten
Du bist die Sparringperson, an die sich alle gern wenden


Qualifikation

Dein Profil - Sind wir ein Match?

Du hast eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene betriebswirtschaftliche Ausbildung mit Schwerpunkt Controlling, Business Intelligence, Datenverarbeitung o.ä. und/oder ein entsprechendes Studium (bspw. Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt, Data Science)
Du konntest bereits erste Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Controlling, Finanzen oder in der Beratung/Wirschaftsprüfung sammeln
Du hast eine große Affinität zu Datenstrukturen und -analysen
Neben sehr guten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in deutscher und englischer Sprache bringst Du eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe, hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein sowie unternehmerisches Denken und Handeln mit
Flexibilität, Engagement und ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit runden Dein Profil ab
Idealerweise bringst Du Begeisterung für nachhaltige Mobilität mit


Benefits

Was Dich bei ONOMOTION erwartet:

Ein innovatives Produkt, das die urbane Mobilität nachhaltig verändern wird und die Möglichkeit, eine Vision Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen
Familienfreundliche Arbeitsbedingungen: Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Möglichkeit zu Home Office
Auf Dich wartet eine verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe mit einer zielgerichteten und umfassenden Einarbeitung
Hervorragende Gestaltungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Spannende Teamevents, Weihnachtspartys und gemeinsam gefeierte Erfolge stärken unseren Teamgeist
Moderne Büroflächen an unserem neuen Standort am Humboldthain in Berlin


Du fühlst Dich angesprochen? Dann schicke uns Deine vollständigen

Bewerbungsunterlagen (Motivationsschreiben & Lebenslauf).
Show more Show less

  • Du konntest bereits erste Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Controlling, Finanzen oder in der Beratung/Wirschaftsprüfung sammeln
  • Du hast eine große Affinität zu Datenstrukturen und -analysen
  • Neben sehr guten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in deutscher und englischer Sprache bringst Du eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe, hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein sowie unternehmerisches Denken und Handeln mit
  • Flexibilität, Engagement und ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit runden Dein Profil ab
  • Idealerweise bringst Du Begeisterung für nachhaltige Mobilität mit

Benefits

Was Dich bei ONOMOTION erwartet:
  • Ein innovatives Produkt, das die urbane Mobilität nachhaltig verändern wird und die Möglichkeit, eine Vision Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen
  • Familienfreundliche Arbeitsbedingungen: Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Möglichkeit zu Home Office
  • Auf Dich wartet eine verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe mit einer zielgerichteten und umfassenden Einarbeitung
  • Hervorragende Gestaltungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
  • Spannende Teamevents, Weihnachtspartys und gemeinsam gefeierte Erfolge stärken unseren Teamgeist
  • Moderne Büroflächen an unserem neuen Standort am Humboldthain in Berlin

Du fühlst Dich angesprochen? Dann schicke uns Deine vollständigen

Bewerbungsunterlagen (Motivationsschreiben & Lebenslauf).

Title: Data Analyst, Business and Product Analytics
Description:
Smartly.io is looking for a customer success and product analytics focused Data Analyst to join our Analytics and Business Intelligence team! Our centralized analytics team works with different parts of the organization, spanning from Product Management and Design to Customer Success, Marketing and Financial Planning and Analysis.




You will work with different types of data, ranging from sales and revenue data to in-app user interactions. Our goal is to develop a unified view of crucial business and product metrics, such as engagement, revenue development, and key action monitoring. We operate in a rapidly evolving business environment, working with the world's most advanced advertisers. This means that our business is constantly changing and we need reliable ways to estimate where we are and where we are going in terms of our customer metrics.




You will work as a part of a wider analytics and business intelligence team that automates operations by creating internal BI tools, dashboards and internal data warehouses. Your primary stakeholders will be our Customer Success and Product Management organizatios.




As a Data Analyst at Smartly.io, you will:




Work closely with our Customer Success Operations, Product Management and Product Design teams to build and optimize our customer experience with data.
Build, develop and maintain reporting of key product adoption metrics
Develop an understanding of our product data and help develop our tracking of key features.
Have end-to-end ownership of data: define data requirements and dive deep into data sets to provide actionable insights.
Develop an in-depth understanding of what drives our customer and product success
Be an important part of our higher level data driven decision making process as well as day-to-day business operations





What we are looking for:




Skills in writing complex analytical SQL queries (we use Snowflake and PostgreSQL as our warehouses)
Proficiency in one or more BI and visualization tools like Looker, Periscope, Tableau or Power BI (we use Tableau and Redash at Smartly.io)
Strong communication and presentation skills, you can turn data into stories and actionable insights
Experience with business & product analytics or a strong interest in the field
Basic understanding of data warehousing
Basic knowledge of typical key business KPIs for SaaS companies
Basic understanding of financial processes, including forecasting, target setting, and budgeting





Meet Smartly.io




Smartly.io combines the power of media automation, creative agility, and advertising intelligence in a next generation digital advertising platform.




We serve marketers across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Snap, Pinterest, TikTok, and Google. We manage about $4B in ad spend and help 700+ brands worldwide, including eBay, Uber, and TechStyle. Our technology and outstanding customer service help brands to reach and engage their audiences, and scale their results.




We offer growth-minded people opportunities to make an impact in a fast-paced, collaborative and inclusive environment built on a culture of trust, transparency, and feedback. You’ll work with a team of 650+ Smartlies, representing 60+ nationalities. We operate in 13 countries across 24 locations.




At Smartly.io, you can enjoy the freedom to harmonize work and personal life. On top of flexible hours, we offer a hybrid workplace where Smartlies can choose to work at the office, from home, or a bit of both. As a global, hybrid organization, we are mindful to collaborate in ways that allow everyone, everywhere to be productive and feel included.




Join our global team to reshape the future of digital marketing!




Learn more at smartly.io/careers and smartly.io/careers/life-at-smartly.

Title: Data Analyst / Specialist Master Data Maintenance (m/f/d)
Description:
Your role




You collect, maintain and process master data related to our tax databases and continuously optimize their quality
You perform regular logic checks to verify data for completeness and accuracy
You show yourself responsible for the control of the master data process as well as the creation of reports
You contribute to tax compliance processes and projects and participate in the continuous review and improvement of our products and solutions
You support the further development and improvement of our "Tax Engines" and tax databases ("VAT Rules")
You work cross-functionally with product innovation, product development, business development, and sales




Your profile




You have successfully completed a commercial or similar vocational training
You are enthusiastic about working with complex data sets on a daily basis and bring with you a high self-image of quality awareness and attention to detail
Ideally, you already have some experience in master data maintenance and bring an interest in business and technical processes with you
You have very good knowledge in the use of market-leading data analysis tools and Excel
You are a dynamic, self-motivated character with an affinity for digital (financial) products and work "hands-on"
An accurate and careful way of working as well as excellent German and English language skills (fluent in written and spoken) complete your profile




Why us?The ideal working location is Berlin, but can be chosen flexibly (Constance/Cologne/Munich or Berlin) and we offer generous mobile working arrangements with the appropriate technical equipment.




We offer you a versatile and challenging job in a dynamically growing company with great development potential. In addition to flexible working hours, we offer a modern workplace (mobile) with the freedom to help shape your own area of responsibility. Of course, you will receive an attractive compensation package as well as 30 days of vacation.




Our work culture is characterized by transparency, respect and personal responsibility. As an employer, we stand for all kinds of diversity - including diversity of thought, experience and style. We believe that a diverse workforce drives innovation, and we foster an inclusive workplace where all colleagues are valued and have the opportunity to reach their full potential.




We consider all qualified applicant:s for employment at eClear, regardless of ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, gender or gender identity, sexual orientation, age or marital status. In case of equal suitability, applicants:inside with a severe disability will be considered preferentially.




About us eClear AG is a payment service provider regulated under banking supervision and offers EU-wide customs and VAT clearing as an embedded checkout solution for marketplaces and digital platforms in e-commerce. With our cloud-based solutions, all tax, customs and payment processes in cross-border online trade are automated and significantly simplified.

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Marketing
Description:
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 75+ million registered members in 18 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

At Vinted, marketing is one of the most impactful channels to grow our platform by making high-stake investment decisions. As a Marketing Decision Scientist, you’ll join our Marketing Data Science & Analytics team where a mix of talented people with backgrounds from academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media apply a scientific approach to solve worldwide business problems. In this team we develop statistical and business models, create new methods to measure marketing success, perform advanced data analyses, and ensure that marketing data is reliable. You will report to the Manager of Data Science & Analytics, Marketing Intelligence, and will work in the team of experienced Marketing Decision and Data Scientists. You’ll be expected to be able to accomplish projects individually but at the same time, you’ll have all the support from the team, the DSA guild, and your lead that you may need. You will be responsible for moving millions of people to the path of sustainable consumption.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:

Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


In this position, you’ll:

Contribute to the development of new ROI/ROAS and payback models to measure marketing performance
Investigate revenue streams that marketing generates – think of acquisition, reactivation, engagement on both sides of a two-sided market
Analyse how a multitude of marketing channels drive user acquisition and retention, engagement, and revenue
Drive the usage of data & analytics within the organisation by making the marketing data obvious for everyone to understand, interpret, and use in daily decision making
Pitch your findings to your team and marketing colleagues to pivot the models used to measure success
Occasionally help with ad-hoc requests (data questions and consultations, data bugs, analyses, etc.)


About you:

Strong analytical, strategic, and business skills
Highly business-results oriented and able to connect science with pragmatic problem solving
A good communicator who can present results in an informative and persuasive manner to a wide range of stakeholders
Intermediate working experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, or Data Scientist
Strong knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field
Excellent at communicating in written and spoken English
Advantage: Previous experience with Marketing Analytics, in particular, ROI/ROAS models
Advantage: Strong econometrics knowledge (statistical models, regression analyses)
Advantage: Advanced knowledge of R/Python/Scala


Work perks:

Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (10% from gross yearly salary)
30 working days of holiday
Mental and emotional health support from Mindletic
Frequent team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
A daily allowance for ordering lunch
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year and up to 21 days outside the EU
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided and a personal budget of 540 for home workplace furniture)


We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 51,400–67,500 € (gross) per annum.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 51,400–67,500 € (gross) per annum.

Title: Data Strategy Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Your tasks

InstaFreight is looking for a Data Strategy Analyst (m/f/d) to join our Team Data. As such, you will be the senior leadership's main partner to explore our data orbit for strategic insights and develop tool prototypes. As a Data Strategy Analyst (m/f/d) you will be a key agent in analyzing complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide data-driven solutions, and ensuring analytics are valid, meaningful, and provide actionable and comprehensive insights. For example, you may be asked to build a more precise model to predict our truck sourcing cost for the months ahead. Or the leadership may be interested in exploring the commercial potential of new Sales channels (e.g. automatically bidding on requests for shipping).

In this role you will:

Conduct project-driven work in close collaboration with your team lead and the senior leadership
Derive key strategic insights from our data (‘one-off analyses’) and summarize them in crisp communication materials to trigger new initiatives
Develop data-driven tool prototypes to further improve the efficiency and quality of our internal processes
Take full ownership of your projects incl. stakeholder management and communication of updates / results (e.g. jour fixes, final presentations)
Champion best practices and data literacy across the organization
Come up with new project opportunities for yourself and pitch them


Your Profile

You have gained 3+ years of working experience in strategy & business development, data analytics, or management consulting
You have strong skills in quantitative exploration and analysis
You have Python and SQL skills
You have distinct business intuition and the ability to understand complex business system requirements
You have a master's degree in a quantitative subject (e.g. engineering, finance) with strong grades
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and commitments, solving critical-to-operations issues
A passion and curiosity for data, systems, and data-driven decision making
You are located in Berlin


Good to have:

Industry expertise in road transportation/logistics


Recruiting Process:

HR call
Business case
Presentation of the case to the Data & Analytics Team Lead
Final call
Offer


The current working model of InstaFreight is hybrid and the office's location is in Berlin.

What We Offer

__Take the driver seat

Take charge - Be accountable for your own field of responsibility from day one onwards.
Have impact - Drive development projects and steer the course of the company.
Make mistakes - Take risks, learn from failures and grow personally with us.


Hit the gas pedal

Learn as you go - Be supported in a great learning environment with training, mentoring and feedback.
Accelerate - Go out of your comfort zone and climb your personal growth ladder step by step.
Outgrow yourself - Unlock your full potential and accomplish things you hardly dare to dream of.


Enjoy the ride

Be part of the team - Join a great group of individuals standing behind a common goal.
Have fun - Take part in our legendary parties, company events or just the regular office craziness.
Write history - Shape the future of an entire industry together with us.__
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst/Manager - Last Mile Planning (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description




We are Flink - your online supermarket revolutionizing the way you do your grocery shopping. With a wide selection of over 2,400 high-quality products, we aim to deliver to your door in minutes. We put our customers first and ensure all products delivered are fresh and nutritious. Additionally, we can customize our national assortment to be able to offer you unique local products in every city. Our delivery hubs are located in densely populated inner-city locations and we strive to be sustainable by delivering on electric bikes and using packaging that can be recycled.




In your role as Planning Manager, you will be responsible for our fleet shift planning and scheduling optimization initiatives, ensuring rider supply meets demand as efficiently as possible - which will be a key driver for unit economics and sustainable growth.




Job Description




You will oversee our set of workforce management solutions, including our scheduling tool as well as internally developed data products, such as our Forecasting and Scheduling Optimization models. In this effort, you will be the main point of contact between Ops and Data Science teams
You will conceptualize and coordinate the implementation of a variety of workforce management initiatives, whether they are related to Product, reporting or process changes
You will empower local operations teams with reports, dashboards and ad-hoc analysis
You will conduct regular performance reviews with local operations teams, understand issues and concerns regarding suggested/actual scheduling, and align together on action plans




Qualifications




Bachelor or Masters degree in Mathematics, Statistics, IT, Finance or similar area
You have at least 2 years of work experience in a quantitative field - e.g. consulting, operations (capacity planning experience is a plus)
Very good working knowledge of SQL
Previous experience working with R, or Python and common data libraries
Experience with Python, unstructured data, machine learning techniques are advantageous
Good knowledge of MS Office, specially Excel




Additional Information




A €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with RYDES, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance




We pride ourselves in being an inclusive and equal opportunities employer with a diverse and multicultural team. It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion
