Title: Online Data Analyst (m,f,d)
Description:
We are hiring freelance English and German speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.







This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.







Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English and German
You must be living in Germany for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Germany
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.







Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.







Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community







TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com










If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam17@telusinternational.ai

Title: Data Analytics Engineer (m/w/d) - FinTech
Description:
Cadeia provides a digital service platform for the structuring, issuance and settlement of complex financial products (e.g. asset-backed securities or syndicated loans but also simple bonds). In addition to enhanced servicing functionalities and a rule-based cash flow distribution solution, the platform also offers reporting, compliance and analytics tools for issuers and investors. At its core, a blockchain-agnostic Smart Contract Engine (SCE) allows for the automated execution of legal contracts, transactions, and payments.

After a successful seed round and recently approved public funding, we are solidly financed.

Tasks

We value passion and motivation higher than experience and training. The willingness to learn and constantly develop beats a streamlined CV in our evaluation.

Architect & Develop elegant technical solutions and strategies from complex business concepts and Data Science models utilizing the latest technologies and engineering practices
Partner with Software Engineers, business development and product teams to craft scalable, flexible and resilient architectures for Machine Learning and Data Science Models that address customer business problems and accelerate the adoption of our Advanced Analytics & Data services
Definition for Machine Learning & AI Design Patterns and Best Practices
Consult our stakeholders in the technical applicability of our data and machine learning services
Constantly striving for Automation and Optimization within the ML development and operations cycle
Verifies the stability, interoperability, portability, security, and scalability of our analytics system architecture


Requirements

We believe that innovation happens when different perspectives come together to solve difficult problems in ways that were previously impossible.

That's why we specifically look for people who bring different life experiences, different educational backgrounds, different cultures, and different work experiences, but also different personalities. We would love to hear how you can bring something unique and forward-thinking to our team.

  • Constantly striving for Automation and Optimization within the ML development and operations cycle
  • Verifies the stability, interoperability, portability, security, and scalability of our analytics system architecture

We believe that innovation happens when different perspectives come together to solve difficult problems in ways that were previously impossible.

That's why we specifically look for people who bring different life experiences, different educational backgrounds, different cultures, and different work experiences, but also different personalities. We would love to hear how you can bring something unique and forward-thinking to our team.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Intro

Du liebst das Jonglieren mit Zahlen und hast ein Auge fürs Detail? Große Summen und verschiedene Kennzahlen bringst du mit Leidenschaft in eine anschauliche Ordnung, sodass die relevanten Entscheidungsträger die wesentlichen Informationen verstehen können? Dann bist du beim Händlerbund genau richtig!

Für die Händlerbund Management AG suchen wir ab sofort einen Junior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d) als Unterstützung für unser Team, damit sich unsere Business Intelligence zusammen mit dir stetig weiterentwickeln wird!

Deine Aufgaben

Automatisierte Dashboard-Erstellung von bedeutenden Firmenkennzahlen sowie unternehmensweite Informationsaufbereitung
Überprüfung auf Richtigkeit von bereitgestellten Daten der jeweiligen Fachbereiche
Entwicklung neuer Lösungswege zur optimierten Datenabbildung & - integration

Dein Profil

Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in den Bereichen Business Intelligence, Data Management o.ä.
Erste Berufserfahrung im Datenmanagement und Programmierung
Strukturierte-, Ziel- und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise
Erfahrungen mit BI-Tools wie Qlik, Tableau, PowerBi, o.ä. wünschenswert

Warum wir?

Leben & Arbeiten: Dank unseres flexiblen Mobile Office Konzeptes gestaltest du deinen Arbeitsplatz und deine Arbeitszeit nach deinen Bedürfnissen. Da wir langfristig und nachhaltig zusammenarbeiten, sind unsere Stellen unbefristet. Du arbeitest bei uns selbstständig und genießt von Beginn an Vertrauen und Verantwortung. Während der Einarbeitung wirst du von deinem Mentor unterstützt. Je nach Bedarf erhältst du die Möglichkeit verschiedene Fortbildungen wahrzunehmen. Solltest du einen treuen Gefährten auf 4 Beinen haben, ist dein Hund bei uns im Büro als Feelgood Manager herzlich willkommen!
Unternehmen & Kultur: Als Vorreiter und Spezialist im E-Commerce erwartet dich eine innovative und moderne Arbeitskultur. Wir sind offen, kollegial, transparent, leben kurze Entscheidungswege und schätzen Engagement und Eigeninitiative. Außerdem kannst du dich auf regelmäßige Teamevents, Sommerfeste und Weihnachtsfeiern freuen.
Snacks & Wohlfühlen: Für die gute Atmosphäre sorgt neben deinem Team auch die gute Verpflegung. Kaffee, Wasser, Tee und Softdrinks, aber auch Obst und Gemüse bieten wir kostenfrei im Büro an. Unser Dresscode lautet: Sei wie du bist, fühle dich wohl.
Extras & Bonus: Die Gesundheit aller Mitarbeiter liegt uns sehr am Herzen. Dafür bieten wir ein eigenes Fitnessstudio, Massagen und Fitnesskurse an. Eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge, kostenfreie Parkplätze und ein Zuschuss zum Monatsticket der Leipziger Verkehrsbetriebe sind möglich.

Dein Weg zu uns

Nutze die Möglichkeit dich direkt online über unser Bewerbungsformular zu bewerben. Falls du Fragen zu diesem Stellenangebot hast, wende dich bitte per E-Mail an unseren HR Business Partner Maximilian Lindemann: job@haendlerbund.de.

Wichtiger Hinweis Das ist eine Anzeige des Empfehlungsbund (EBND) von Jobs-Daheim.de. Weitere wichtige Informationen zur Anzeige finden Sie unter https://jobsdaheim.de/jobs/218968/junior-business-intelligence-analyst-m-strich-w-strich-d-in-leipzig-berlin-magdeburg-erfurt-muenchen-leipzig-rostock-dresden-stuttgart-hamburg-koeln-frankfurt-am-main
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst/Developer Marketing Intelligence B2B (m/w/d)
Description:
Datum: 02.02.2023

Standort:

Nürnberg, BY, DE, 90449 München, BY, DE, 80992 Hamburg, HH, DE, 22297 Teltow, BB, DE, 14513 Düsseldorf, NW, DE, 40474

Unternehmen: GER - Telefónica Germany GmbH & Co. OHG

Vertragsart: Vollzeit, unbefristet

Eintritt: ab nächstmöglichem Zeitpunkt

Working anywhere. Wir arbeiten dort, wo es am produktivsten ist. Darum hast Du, nach erfolgreichem Bewerbungsprozess, die Möglichkeit deutschlandweit zu arbeiten. Bei Telefónica setzen wir auf ein flexibles Hybridmodell, das sowohl die Vorteile von Remote- als auch Vor-Ort-Arbeiten angemessen berücksichtigt. Du wirst entsprechend Deinem Wohnort, dem nächsten Telefónica Standort zugeordnet. Weitere Details besprechen wir mit Dir im Bewerbungsprozess.

Wer wir sind

Wir sind O2 Telefónica – mit unseren Mobilfunkmarken verbinden wir Millionen von Menschen und bieten unseren Kunden mobile Freiheit in der digitalen Welt. Darüber hinaus gestalten wir als führender Telekommunikationsanbieter maßgeblich die Digitalisierung in Deutschland mit. Unsere rund 7.400 Mitarbeiter hierzulande treiben die Transformation jeden Tag ein Stück voran – auch in unserem eigenen Unternehmen. Telefónica zählt zu den Top-Arbeitgebern in Deutschland und ist Teil des globalen Telekommunikationskonzerns Telefónica S.A. mit mehr als 110.000 engagierten Mitarbeitern weltweit.

Werde auch Du Teil unseres einzigartigen Teams und lass uns gemeinsam etwas bewegen! 

Was Dich erwartet

Erstellung von komplexen SQL Prozeduren im Umfeld relationaler Datenbanken
Anbindung und Integration neuer Datenquellen in die bestehende Analyse-Datenbank
Entwicklung von Tabellen und Data Marts für Analysezwecke sowie als Datenquelle für Dashboards
Entwicklung von Berichten und Dashboards auf Basis von Tableau
Erstellung von Datenbankselektionen im Vermarktungs-Kampagnenumfeld
Durchführung von anspruchsvollen Ad hoc Analysen
Managen der Schnittstellen zu B2B Sales, Go2Market, Produktmanagement, Customer Base Management, Controlling, Customer Service und Trading & Pricing


Was Du mitbringst

Abgeschlossenes Studium im Fachgebiet Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL oder vergleichbar
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Datenmodellierung sowie der Umsetzung von ETL Prozessen im Microsoft SQL Server Umfeld (on premise sowie in der Azure Cloud) insbesondere sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL, TSQL und in der Entwicklung von Stored Procedures
Gute Programmierkenntnisse in mindestens einer der folgenden Sprachen: Python, C#, JavaScript oder VBA
Erfahrung des CRM-Systems Salesforce sowie Kenntnisse in der Modellierung von NBO/NBA Logiken im B2B Geschäft/Telekommunikationsumfeld sind ein Plus
Erfahrung in der Nutzung einschlägiger Tools zur Visualisierung großer Datenmengen wie Tableau, Power BI ist ein Vorteil
Spaß und Leidenschaft für Transformations- und Veränderungsthemen
Eigenverantwortliche, ergebnisorientierte, strukturierte Arbeitsweise sowie gute Kommunikations- und Stakeholder Management Skills
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse


Was wir Dir bieten

Modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld: Arbeite innerhalb Deutschlands wo Du willst. Ob im Homeoffice oder einem unserer Büros. Wir bieten Dir dabei maximale Flexibilität Deinen Arbeitstag zu gestalten.

Weiterbildung & Entwicklung: Alles, was Du für Deinen individuellen Wachstumsweg brauchst. Mit einem persönlichem Entwicklungsplan, Learning Journeys und der Möglichkeit von Job Rotations, erreichst Du mit uns Deine Ziele – entsprechend unserem Leitgedanken „connect, learn and move2grow".

Finanzielle Vorteile: Ein Smartphone zur dienstlichen und privaten Nutzung sowie die Möglichkeit über ein Guthaben auch Partner, Freunde und Familie zu versorgen, ist für uns selbstverständlich. Darüber hinaus profitierst Du von einer Vielzahl an Corporate Benefits.

Gesundheit: Unser „Feel Good“ Programm sorgt dafür, dass es Dir gut geht. Unter anderem bieten wir Fitnesskurse, Ernährungsberatungen und Angebote zur Verbesserung der Ergonomie am Arbeitsplatz sowie der Work-Life-Balance an.

Soziales Engagement: Wir engagieren uns auch außerhalb der Unternehmensgrenzen. Du kannst im Rahmen von Volunteering Days / Holidays oder Spendenläufen soziale Projekte unterstützen.

Wie Du Dich bewirbst und was Du noch wissen solltest

Überzeuge uns mit Deinem aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf sowie dazugehörigen Zeugnissen. Ein Motivationsschreiben oder Anschreiben brauchst Du bei uns nicht. Bitte beachte, dass Bewerbungen nur über unser Bewerberportal möglich sind und Bewerbungen per E-Mail nicht berücksichtigt werden können.

Du hast Fragen zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess und Interesse an weiteren Informationen zu der Stelle? Dann wende dich bitte an unser Recruiting Team (de-recruiting@telefonica.com).

Bei gleicher Eignung werden Bewerber:innen mit einer Schwerbehinderung bevorzugt berücksichtigt. Alle Geschlechter sind gleichermaßen willkommen.
Show more Show less

Unsere rund 7.400 Mitarbeiter hierzulande treiben die Transformation jeden Tag ein Stück voran – auch in unserem eigenen Unternehmen. Telefónica zählt zu den Top-Arbeitgebern in Deutschland und ist Teil des globalen Telekommunikationskonzerns Telefónica S.A. mit mehr als 110.000 engagierten Mitarbeitern weltweit.

Werde auch Du Teil unseres einzigartigen Teams und lass uns gemeinsam etwas bewegen! 

Was Dich erwartet
  • Erstellung von komplexen SQL Prozeduren im Umfeld relationaler Datenbanken
  • Anbindung und Integration neuer Datenquellen in die bestehende Analyse-Datenbank
  • Entwicklung von Tabellen und Data Marts für Analysezwecke sowie als Datenquelle für Dashboards
  • Entwicklung von Berichten und Dashboards auf Basis von Tableau
  • Erstellung von Datenbankselektionen im Vermarktungs-Kampagnenumfeld
  • Durchführung von anspruchsvollen Ad hoc Analysen
  • Managen der Schnittstellen zu B2B Sales, Go2Market, Produktmanagement, Customer Base Management, Controlling, Customer Service und Trading & Pricing

Was Du mitbringst
  • Abgeschlossenes Studium im Fachgebiet Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL oder vergleichbar
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Datenmodellierung sowie der Umsetzung von ETL Prozessen im Microsoft SQL Server Umfeld (on premise sowie in der Azure Cloud) insbesondere sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL, TSQL und in der Entwicklung von Stored Procedures
  • Gute Programmierkenntnisse in mindestens einer der folgenden Sprachen: Python, C#, JavaScript oder VBA
  • Erfahrung des CRM-Systems Salesforce sowie Kenntnisse in der Modellierung von NBO/NBA Logiken im B2B Geschäft/Telekommunikationsumfeld sind ein Plus
  • Erfahrung in der Nutzung einschlägiger Tools zur Visualisierung großer Datenmengen wie Tableau, Power BI ist ein Vorteil
  • Spaß und Leidenschaft für Transformations- und Veränderungsthemen
  • Eigenverantwortliche, ergebnisorientierte, strukturierte Arbeitsweise sowie gute Kommunikations- und Stakeholder Management Skills
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Was wir Dir bieten

Modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld: Arbeite innerhalb Deutschlands wo Du willst. Ob im Homeoffice oder einem unserer Büros. Wir bieten Dir dabei maximale Flexibilität Deinen Arbeitstag zu gestalten.

Weiterbildung & Entwicklung: Alles, was Du für Deinen individuellen Wachstumsweg brauchst. Mit einem persönlichem Entwicklungsplan, Learning Journeys und der Möglichkeit von Job Rotations, erreichst Du mit uns Deine Ziele – entsprechend unserem Leitgedanken „connect, learn and move2grow".

Finanzielle Vorteile: Ein Smartphone zur dienstlichen und privaten Nutzung sowie die Möglichkeit über ein Guthaben auch Partner, Freunde und Familie zu versorgen, ist für uns selbstverständlich. Darüber hinaus profitierst Du von einer Vielzahl an Corporate Benefits.

Gesundheit: Unser „Feel Good“ Programm sorgt dafür, dass es Dir gut geht. Unter anderem bieten wir Fitnesskurse, Ernährungsberatungen und Angebote zur Verbesserung der Ergonomie am Arbeitsplatz sowie der Work-Life-Balance an.

Soziales Engagement: Wir engagieren uns auch außerhalb der Unternehmensgrenzen. Du kannst im Rahmen von Volunteering Days / Holidays oder Spendenläufen soziale Projekte unterstützen.

Wie Du Dich bewirbst und was Du noch wissen solltest

Überzeuge uns mit Deinem aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf sowie dazugehörigen Zeugnissen. Ein Motivationsschreiben oder Anschreiben brauchst Du bei uns nicht. Bitte beachte, dass Bewerbungen nur über unser Bewerberportal möglich sind und Bewerbungen per E-Mail nicht berücksichtigt werden können.

Du hast Fragen zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess und Interesse an weiteren Informationen zu der Stelle? Dann wende dich bitte an unser Recruiting Team (de-recruiting@telefonica.com).

Bei gleicher Eignung werden Bewerber:innen mit einer Schwerbehinderung bevorzugt berücksichtigt. Alle Geschlechter sind gleichermaßen willkommen.

Title: Young Professional Client Data Analyst (m/w/d) ←
Description:
Die Talentschmiede fördert als branchenübergreifende IT-Unternehmensberatung den Einsatz von Absolventen und Young Professionals. Wir bieten unseren Kunden Projektteams mit jungen, talentierten und hoch motivierten Mitarbeitern, die wir mittels unseres innovativen Ausbildungs- und Betreuungskonzeptes kontinuierlich fortbilden.




Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt am Standort Berlin einen Young Professional Client Data Analyst (m/w/d), der gerne im Bereich Datenanalyse arbeitet und sich sowohl durch tiefe als auch breite Kompetenz in diesem Wissensbereich auszeichnen möchte.




Ihre Aufgaben




Sie sind für die Analyse von Datenstrukturen zahlreicher Kundendatenbanken sowie das Design der Datenbankarchitektur verantwortlich.
Sie validieren Datenquellen, um die Daten hinsichtlich der Vollständigkeit, Qualität und Konsistenz beurteilen zu können.
Sie verantworten die Normalisierung von Daten, um eine Integration und Automatisierung von Datenflüssen zu ermöglichen.
Sie bilden Datensätze aus verschiedenen Datenquellen ab und sind für die Automatisierung von Datenerfassungen zuständig.
Sie initiieren und implementieren Veränderungen technischer und operativer Prozesse zur Reduzierung von Datenproblemen.
Sie entwickeln Lösungspläne und -prozesse für Key Data Challenges und das zugehörige Reporting.
Sie durchlaufen ein individuelles Weiterbildungsprogramm und entwickeln sich zum zertifizierten Data Analyst weiter.




Fachliche Anforderungen




Abgeschlossenes Studium in einem der folgenden Studiengänge: Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften mit IT-Schwerpunkt, Mathematik, Physik oder Ingenieurdisziplinen oder eine vergleichbare Berufserfahrung, z. B. als Fachinformatiker/-in mit hervorragendem Prüfungsabschluss
Bisherige berufliche Erfahrung im Bereich der Datenanalyse oder
Bewährte Erfahrung als Praktikant oder Werkstudent im Bereich Informationstechnologie.
Sie besitzen praktische Kenntnisse in der Datenbankentwicklung (z.B. Oracle, SQL).
Grundverständnis für IT-Architektur, Infrastrukturmanagement und Web-Technologien.




Ihr Profil




Analytisches Denkvermögen, gedankliche Flexibilität und Problemlösungsfähigkeit
Selbstständiger, methodischer Arbeitsstil und Eigeninitiative
Praxisorientierte Arbeitsweise, technische Begeisterung und Zielorientierung
Teamfähigkeit und Kundenorientierung




Als Arbeitgeber Bieten Wir




Individuelles Einarbeitungsprogramm – Persönlich auf Ihre individuellen Bedürfnisse zugeschnitten und mit Erfolgsgarantie für die Zertifizierung in dem gewählten Karrierepfad.
Fortbildungs- und Betreuungskonzept – Ein innovatives und kontinuierliches Trainingsangebot mit allem, was E-Learning-, Classroom- und Onsite-Trainings namhafter Anbieter und Hersteller zu bieten haben.
Mentoring und Coaching – Inklusive regelmäßiger Feedback- und Zielvereinbarungsgespräche mit dem Management und der Gewissheit, jederzeit ein Mensch mit Persönlichkeit zu sein und keine Personalnummer in einem Konzern.
Junges, dynamisches und internationales Team mit flachen Hierarchien – Gegenseitige Hilfsbereitschaft und echte Freundschaften.
Regelmäßige Teamevents –Gemeinsame Mittagessen, Theaterbesuche, Sommerfeiern, damit neben der Arbeit auch der gemeinsame Spaß nicht zu kurz kommt.
Teamorientiertes Arbeiten mit herausfordernden und abwechslungsreichen Aufgaben – Aufgaben, die nicht nur fördern, sondern auch fordern, um das Beste aus einem herauszuholen.
Spannende Karriereperspektiven – Von der Weiterentwicklung zum Unternehmensberater oder der Internalisierung bis hin zur weitergehenden Spezialisierung innerhalb der Organisation unserer Kunden.
Unbefristete Festanstellung – Mit marktgerechten Gehältern und allen den vorgenannten Vorteilen!




Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen und bitten Sie um Zusendung an jobs@talentschmiede.com . Bitte vergessen Sie nicht, uns Ihre Gehaltsvorstellung und den möglichen Eintrittstermin mitzuteilen.




Für telefonische Rückfragen steht Ihnen gerne Hannah Frank unter +49 69 970 979 58 zur Verfügung. Für weitere Informationen besuchen Sie uns doch auf Talentschmiede.com .

Title: People Data & Compensation Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
We are looking for a skilled People Data & Compensation Analyst to join our ride at Blacklane's People & Culture team. You will use tools, data, and analytical thinking to provide clear and constructive reward & data insights advice internally, in order to ensure Blacklane stays competitive and attractive to talents.

Your Responsibilities

Provide support and assist with a range of total rewards initiatives including salary band review benchmarking, remuneration, bonus and long-term incentive schemes incl. Employee Stock Option Program (ESOP), pay equity analysis and so on.
Support and assist with the design and the implementation of a yearly feedback cycle.
Support to train and guide People & Culture colleagues and people managers about various compensation guidelines.
Review and develop current benefit schemes at a global scale. Collaborate closely with the People Operations team to implement the enhanced benefits if any.
Work closely with the People Business Partner team, business leads, recruitment team and relevant stakeholders to build up and implement insightful reports and dashboard systems at Blacklane.
Analyze people data and provide insights per request where necessary.
Continue to review current systems/ processes/ documentations and improve it continuously.


About You

Strong analytic background. Ideally you have already solid knowledge of Compensation & benefits programs, trends and practices, preferably global exposure and people data
An advanced proficiency in G-suit, particularly Google sheets. You are capable of manipulating and presenting data accurately and efficiently.
Analytical and critical thinker. With your solution-oriented approach, you are comfortable analyzing and communicating complex concepts, understanding trends, and formulating recommendations for actions based on the analysis.
Demonstrated ability to design conceptually and implement people programs in scale-ups.
Innovative and flexible. You are the champion of staying up to date with global HR trends. You are comfortable working in ambiguity and creating solutions that achieve time-sensitive goals.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy for both numerical and written work.
Great communication and interpersonal skills. You communicate clearly with different audiences by combining narratives and data. Fluent English is required.


MORE THAN A JOB:

Blacklane is a scale-up started in 2011, founded by Jens Wohltorf and Frank Steuer who wanted to create the first global chauffeur service. We started by filling chauffeurs' 'empty leg' journeys and have grown with our partners to over €100 million in annual revenue (pre-pandemic). Backed by Daimler and other investors in Germany, Japan, Switzerland, and the UAE, we're now a trusted brand within corporate travel.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture. Responding to the pandemic, we've successfully managed the crises and retained our talented crew!

Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days (working from home is the new normal).
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane has pledged to deliver 75% of its journeys in electric vehicles by 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane

Upgrade your career with Blacklane

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Staffbase

At Staffbase we believe that Internal Communication moves people, and people move companies. Our mission is to empower leaders and communicators to drive transformation through internal comms solutions, strategies, and insights. Our most recent Series E funding led by General Atlantic, officially launched us to 🦄 UNICORN 🦄 status!

We're headquartered in Chemnitz, Germany, with offices in many locations throughout the world, including Vancouver, Kelowna, New York, Amsterdam, London, and several locations in Germany! Our international team counts more than 800 employees from 45+ nationalities and we have a growing base of 1000+ enterprise customers that want to transform their employee experience. We are rapidly scaling, post-Series E ($115 million funding), have strong-growing revenue, and our customers love us.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to help drive our growing Data team. The role can be associated with one of our German offices.

The Data team at Staffbase is the central nervous system of all things data. As a member of that team, you will further shape our Data Engineering practice and partner with a variety of teams across engineering and product to enhance the way we collect, transform and utilize data. You will be joining a team of four analysts and one data engineer, so you're not going to be just another cog in the machine. You will carry a lot of responsibility and ownership. Our data landscape is still formative which comes with a lot of freedom to create new things but also with a lot of responsibility and at times uncertainty.

In 2021-2022 we set the foundations of a GDPR-compliant Data Warehouse on Google BigQuery. In 2023 and beyond we are going to build up a mature and modern data infrastructure around GCP, dbt, Airflow and other technologies. You want to leave a deep footprint in a market-leading company's data environment, help serve some of the largest companies in the world and impact the lives of millions of employees? Then this job is for you.

What you'll be doing

Design, build and maintain reliable data pipelines that connect a variety of sources with our BigQuery data warehouse
Take ownership of large-scale architectural decisions for processing, anonymizing and storing our massive amounts of data
Facilitate batch and real-time data processing workflows to fuel data-driven functionality in our product
Leverage the capabilities of dbt and data orchestration tools to create a landscape of accurate, performant and resilient datasets
Proactively identify opportunities for scalability, observability and reliability improvements
Advise on data engineering approaches that balance outcomes, performance and GDPR compliance


What you need to be successful

Experience in working as a Data Engineer, data architect or as a data-enthusiastic Backend Engineer
You work with cloud-based data warehouse technologies, SQL, Python or another major programming language
You are familiar with dbt, Airflow, Spark and Kafka
Experience in designing, building and operating data pipelines/ETL as well as data warehouse design, preferably with expertise in preparing datasets for production environments
You can translate business questions into data engineering requirements and enjoy taking responsibility in high-impact projects
Excellent communication skills
You have worked in fast-moving agile teams
Being a mentor and able to support junior team members with continued career growth


We Love Diversity - Equal Employment Opportunity

Our platforms are for everyone, and so is our workplace. We are passionate about equity, inclusion, and diversity at Staffbase. Read more about our policies here.

Our Global Benefits

Employee Stock Option Plan (ESOP)

Staffbase offers you a benefit plan which entitles you to an ownership interest in stock options in the company. We're in business to create value for our shareholders and we want our employees to benefit from that shared success as well.

Ongoing Learning

We thrive on personal and professional growth. Every employee gets €1,800/$2,200/£1,650 per year to spend on personal and professional development.

Feel Good Fridays

Summertime means extended vacation time at Staffbase! During August we run the 4-days workweek which means that during this month Fridays are off for all employees.

Flexibility

When it comes to your personal life, it's not our place to dictate your schedule. We offer full time and flexible work-from-home options.

Parental Leave

We recognize that one of the most special events in an individual's life is the birth or adoption of a child. We offer paid parental leave options for all employees.

The Data team at Staffbase is the central nervous system of all things data. As a member of that team, you will further shape our Data Engineering practice and partner with a variety of teams across engineering and product to enhance the way we collect, transform and utilize data. You will be joining a team of four analysts and one data engineer, so you're not going to be just another cog in the machine. You will carry a lot of responsibility and ownership. Our data landscape is still formative which comes with a lot of freedom to create new things but also with a lot of responsibility and at times uncertainty.

In 2021-2022 we set the foundations of a GDPR-compliant Data Warehouse on Google BigQuery. In 2023 and beyond we are going to build up a mature and modern data infrastructure around GCP, dbt, Airflow and other technologies. You want to leave a deep footprint in a market-leading company's data environment, help serve some of the largest companies in the world and impact the lives of millions of employees? Then this job is for you.

What you'll be doing
  • Design, build and maintain reliable data pipelines that connect a variety of sources with our BigQuery data warehouse
  • Take ownership of large-scale architectural decisions for processing, anonymizing and storing our massive amounts of data
  • Facilitate batch and real-time data processing workflows to fuel data-driven functionality in our product
  • Leverage the capabilities of dbt and data orchestration tools to create a landscape of accurate, performant and resilient datasets
  • Proactively identify opportunities for scalability, observability and reliability improvements
  • Advise on data engineering approaches that balance outcomes, performance and GDPR compliance

What you need to be successful
  • Experience in working as a Data Engineer, data architect or as a data-enthusiastic Backend Engineer
  • You work with cloud-based data warehouse technologies, SQL, Python or another major programming language
  • You are familiar with dbt, Airflow, Spark and Kafka
  • Experience in designing, building and operating data pipelines/ETL as well as data warehouse design, preferably with expertise in preparing datasets for production environments
  • You can translate business questions into data engineering requirements and enjoy taking responsibility in high-impact projects
  • Excellent communication skills
  • You have worked in fast-moving agile teams
  • Being a mentor and able to support junior team members with continued career growth

We Love Diversity - Equal Employment Opportunity

Our platforms are for everyone, and so is our workplace. We are passionate about equity, inclusion, and diversity at Staffbase. Read more about our policies here.

Our Global Benefits

Employee Stock Option Plan (ESOP)

Staffbase offers you a benefit plan which entitles you to an ownership interest in stock options in the company. We're in business to create value for our shareholders and we want our employees to benefit from that shared success as well.

Ongoing Learning

We thrive on personal and professional growth. Every employee gets €1,800/$2,200/£1,650 per year to spend on personal and professional development.

Feel Good Fridays

Summertime means extended vacation time at Staffbase! During August we run the 4-days workweek which means that during this month Fridays are off for all employees.

Flexibility

When it comes to your personal life, it's not our place to dictate your schedule. We offer full time and flexible work-from-home options.

Parental Leave

We recognize that one of the most special events in an individual's life is the birth or adoption of a child. We offer paid parental leave options for all employees.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM




As a Senior Data Analyst (all genders) you work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando’s Markets organisation, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer analytics and customer segmentations we put our customers at the centre of every marketing and retail decision. As a Senior Data Analyst (all genders) in the Customer Analytics team, you will put data at the core of our decisions and processes.




INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN




At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.




We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.




do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy




Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups




WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Creating insights around all aspects of the customer’s purchasing behaviour by understanding our stakeholder’s data needs. Identifying how our insights and analytical frameworks will impact strategic & assortment decisions.
Develop, automate and maintain our self-service reporting infrastructure that will enable our team and stakeholders to work autonomously with our data and KPIs.
Collaborate with our Data Science and Data Engineering teams to develop and maintain our data pipelines. Tap into new sources of data and know-how.
Drive data mindset in the team and guide team members in terms of methodology & technology. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.


WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




5+ years of experience in using data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions incl. model driven statistical analysis. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Social Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
Proficient in data transformation and statistical computing in SQL and Python as well as strong skills in data visualisation. Basic experience in new technologies such as Google Analytics, BigQuery, MicroStrategy/Tableau, Airflow, Spark / DataBricks, and / or Github
Experience in proactively creating an understanding of data needs and how to connect data with decision making with a good sense for pragmatism and innovation
A customer mindset and good communication skills to explain how to use the data you prepared in the decision making process. You proved to be a mentor for junior to mid level team members.


OUR OFFER




Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.




Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available





Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Title: Analytics Engineer - Data Insights (m/f/d)
Description:
DESTINATION FOR GREAT TALENT

At Trade Republic, we are on a mission to democratize wealth. We set up millions of Europeans for wealth with fast, easy, and free access to capital markets. With over one million customers we are one of the largest savings platforms in Europe, with users holding over €6 billion on our platform.

We are seen as the go-to-destination for top talent from across the globe. Everyday we strive to make Trade Republic a great environment to do the best work of your life, surrounded by exceptional, caring and passionate colleagues. In addition to learning and growing with a world-class team, you will build a destination for everyone across Europe to put money to work.

About The Role

The Data Insights team is a small unit of our central data team and focuses on driving selected high-impact analytics topics which cannot be solved via our widely used self-service tools. We help the whole organisation and work on a very wide range of topics. Projects range from measuring the impact of recent product launches to supporting product experimentation and help defining company KPIs to measure our strategy in close collaboration with the management team.

As an Analytics Engineer in this team, you will work on these projects one-by-one, digging into new topics frequently and building knowledge across the whole organisation. As a team, we build on this wide-reaching overview and help the management team connect the dots on a high level when it comes to generating insights.

YOUR DAY TO DAY INVOLVES

Understand stakeholders’ needs and create a tailored analytics approach for their business problem
Create insightful reports that break down complex findings into understandable results
Improve our dashboarding infrastructure (we use Looker) and help people in the company build dashboards that tell a story to ensure data-informed decisions
Closely work with our product and platform engineering teams, setting up tracking and building pipelines for new features
Embrace experimentation and testing to ensure incremental improvements


WHO ARE YOU?

We are aware that everyone has their individual strengths and weaknesses. The one thing where we don’t compromise is joy for our work and dedication to our shared mission. If you feel you are not ticking all the boxes below, but have a good general feeling about most of them, we would be very happy to talk!

At least 3 years of analytics experience with an engineering mindset
Orientation on personal and professional growth, you never settle with what you have
Outstanding business acumen and an interest in FinTech
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, you are good in understanding what stakeholders want and translating it into an analytics solution
Proven experience with setting-up and improving data visualisation tools, preferably Looker
Capable of prioritising based on impact and estimating the effort needed for an outcome
Good understanding of statistics with respect to analysing A/B experiments and ability to communicate their results in a simple, yet correct form to stakeholders
Experience with our tech stack: AWS/Snowflake/Airflow/Python/SQL and ideally also DBT


WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY NOW

At Trade Republic you will get to do the best work of your career. We are a destination for people who are exceptional at what they do. Every day, we strive to build a world-class team and provide the space for people to do their best. We have a relentless ambition of raising the bar and expect the best from ourselves. Through our dedicated people-first management approach and transparent career paths, you will have the opportunity to develop and grow your career like never before. And because you are surrounded by a diverse team of high performers, you will be learning every day.

You will play an important role in fixing one of the largest challenges we face - closing the pension gap and democratizing wealth. Trade Republic is a place where your job, your career and your passions intersect. If this gets you fired up, just like it does for all of us at Trade Republic, then reach out!

Trade Republic embraces diversity and strives for equal opportunity for everyone. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, characteristics, perspectives and skills. We encourage applicants of diverse gender, age, sexuality, religion, ethnicity, disability status and parental status to apply to our roles, or those from other intersecting minority groups not listed. The more diverse and inclusive we are as a team, the greater our work will be.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 75+ million registered members in 18 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

We are looking for a People Data Analyst to join Vinted People Tech Team. Our team ensures People processes run efficiently and enables internal stakeholders with valuable insights.

As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to expand support to our stakeholders. Reporting into People Tech Projects Lead, your role will be to:

Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based HR decisions
Deliver regular analysis and ad-hoc reports to support business decisions
Create dashboards and visualizations for internal stakeholders
Perform data validation and work with internal stakeholders to ensure data integrity
Contribute to interdependent People / HR wide projects


The position would suit a profile with:

4+ years of experience working with people analytics, reporting and storytelling through data
Strong understanding of analytical concepts such as trending, forecasting, etc.
Hands-on knowledge of Workday HCM and its report offering is a necessity
Strong knowledge of Google Sheets and Excel
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker and/or Tableau
The ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Communication and relationships building skills to partner with internal stakeholders


Work perks:

Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (10% from net yearly salary)
30 working days of holiday
Mental and emotional health support from Mindletic
Frequent team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
A daily allowance for ordering lunch
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided and a personal budget for home workplace furniture)


We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
We at Yara are part of a global network, collaborating to profitably and responsibly solve some of the world's key challenges - resource scarcity, food insecurity and environmental change.




About The Unit




Yara aims to be the crop nutrition company of the future, leading the development of sustainable agriculture and digital tools to help solve global agricultural challenges. We have a worldwide presence in over 65 countries with around 17,000 employees. Drawing on more than a century of experience in crop nutrition, Yara established the Digital Farming division to explore how technology can be used to improve farmers' lives and productivity.




Important: The role could be offered remotely to candidates living in Germany or Bulgaria.




Responsibilities




The Data Insights & Analytics Lead Europe will built up and lead a team of product analysts, data analysts and market intelligence specialists. The team will support Yara Farming Solution Europe to leverage Yara's digital product and commercial portfolio with data and insights on soil health, regenerative farming practices and information around farmers and fields. Join us in the digital transformation of the agriculture industry to achieve Yara's goal of responsibly feeding the world and protecting the planet!




Build up and manage the Insights & Analytics Team Europe that supports commercial, growth and product teams in the digital and sustainable transformation of the agriculture industry Europe
Guide analysts in deep dive analysis on user behaviour, commercial activities and market insights, building predictive models and actionable dashboards
Collaborate with business and product teams in Europe to develop new digital solutions and translate data into insights
Determine new innovative ways to leverage our data assets to support the regenerative agriculture and commercial ambitions in Europe
Collaborate with the data engineer team to develop analytics data layers and data pipelines
Initiate and lead projects for behavioural analytics to understand the end to end customer journey and increase conversion and engagement.
Establish best practices for experimentation across products, commercial sales and marketing.
Drive adoption of data driven decision making.




Profile




At least a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics.
At least 5 years of experience working with data with at least 1 year in a leadership role.
Experience leading and managing behavioural analytics and business intelligence/product analytics projects.
Proficiency in SQL, R and Python. Hands-on experience with BI tools (e.g. PowerBI).
Excellent communication and presentation skills.




Additional Information




To directly impact on products that provide real value to farmers and industries based on an honest business model
To work on sustainable solutions that benefit humankind and the environment
Very competitive remuneration and an unlimited work contract
A flexible yet stable environment in the newly founded digital unit of a global company
Flexible working hours, working from home/remote option!
Support for personal development, training, conferences, and continuous learning
Commitment to using new approaches, technologies, and frameworks
To choose your own preferred MacOS hardware




Contact details




Padelis Kollias




Talent Acquisition Manager




padelis.kollias@yara.com




Knowledge grows through differences




Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe that creating a diverse and inclusive work environment is not only the right thing, but also the smart thing to do. To deliver on this, Yara has firmly anchored Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) in our business strategy and has more than 400 employees worldwide involved in D&I ambassadors networks.
Show more Show less
HTML:
We at Yara are part of a global network, collaborating to profitably and responsibly solve some of the world's key challenges - resource scarcity, food insecurity and environmental change.


About The Unit


Yara aims to be the crop nutrition company of the future, leading the development of sustainable agriculture and digital tools to help solve global agricultural challenges. We have a worldwide presence in over 65 countries with around 17,000 employees. Drawing on more than a century of experience in crop nutrition, Yara established the Digital Farming division to explore how technology can be used to improve farmers' lives and productivity.


Important: The role could be offered remotely to candidates living in Germany or Bulgaria.


Responsibilities


The Data Insights & Analytics Lead Europe will built up and lead a team of product analysts, data analysts and market intelligence specialists. The team will support Yara Farming Solution Europe to leverage Yara's digital product and commercial portfolio with data and insights on soil health, regenerative farming practices and information around farmers and fields. Join us in the digital transformation of the agriculture industry to achieve Yara's goal of responsibly feeding the world and protecting the planet!


  • Build up and manage the Insights & Analytics Team Europe that supports commercial, growth and product teams in the digital and sustainable transformation of the agriculture industry Europe
  • Guide analysts in deep dive analysis on user behaviour, commercial activities and market insights, building predictive models and actionable dashboards
  • Collaborate with business and product teams in Europe to develop new digital solutions and translate data into insights
  • Determine new innovative ways to leverage our data assets to support the regenerative agriculture and commercial ambitions in Europe
  • Collaborate with the data engineer team to develop analytics data layers and data pipelines
  • Initiate and lead projects for behavioural analytics to understand the end to end customer journey and increase conversion and engagement.
  • Establish best practices for experimentation across products, commercial sales and marketing.
  • Drive adoption of data driven decision making.


Profile


  • At least a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics.
  • At least 5 years of experience working with data with at least 1 year in a leadership role.
  • Experience leading and managing behavioural analytics and business intelligence/product analytics projects.
  • Proficiency in SQL, R and Python. Hands-on experience with BI tools (e.g. PowerBI).
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.


Additional Information


  • To directly impact on products that provide real value to farmers and industries based on an honest business model
  • To work on sustainable solutions that benefit humankind and the environment
  • Very competitive remuneration and an unlimited work contract
  • A flexible yet stable environment in the newly founded digital unit of a global company
  • Flexible working hours, working from home/remote option!
  • Support for personal development, training, conferences, and continuous learning
  • Commitment to using new approaches, technologies, and frameworks
  • To choose your own preferred MacOS hardware


Contact details


Padelis Kollias


Talent Acquisition Manager


padelis.kollias@yara.com


Knowledge grows through differences


Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe that creating a diverse and inclusive work environment is not only the right thing, but also the smart thing to do. To deliver on this, Yara has firmly anchored Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) in our business strategy and has more than 400 employees worldwide involved in D&I ambassadors networks.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (w/x/m)
Description:
Puls Project is at the verge of an exhilarating journey. Our mission is to create the entire financial world in one platform for German small to midsize enterprises and entrepreneurs, across all sectors and industries.We are building a platform that will enable the client to have money, where the client needs it just at the right time when they actually need it. The aim is to free up their time to make sure it can be spent on growing their business, not just managing to survive. Puls connects all your bank accounts in one place, business as well as private. The client will be able to have an overview of their financial history, as well as actually get forecasting for their cash flow with that data. You will be able to make all payments in one place, instant and easy. And what if money gets tight? The future with Puls will give the opportunity to get business loans for SME without the hassle of a complicated bank checkup. At Puls Technologies GmbH you can expect a high caliber work environment. You work directly with the founders - an energetic team that is highly motivated to create impact in the world of German SMEs.

Tasks

Review and validate customer data as it’s collected
Oversee the deployment of data to the data warehouse
Monitor analytics and metrics results
Implement new data analysis methodologies
Review customer files to ensure integrity of data collection and utilization
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies
Collaborating with team members for the purpose of collecting data and executing the company’s mission


Requirements

Data modeling
Data mining
Business analysis
Database management and reporting
Strong Microsoft Excel and VBA skills
Critical-thinking and problem-solving
nice to have, but not obligatory:


Tableau and data visualization, German

Benefits

You will work with an enthusiastic team of smart people in the heart of Berlin - City West. Come and join us on this journey!

Get in touch with us now.
Show more Show less

Title: Qlik Consultant/Data Analyst (M/W/D)
Description:
Wir sind die Positive Thinking Company. Wir suchen Ihr Talent und Ihre Leidenschaft zur Verstärkung unserer Data & Analytics Experten. Schließen Sie sich uns an, entfalten Sie Ihre Fähigkeiten und Talente und stecken Sie unsere Community mit Ihrer Begeisterung und Ihren Ideen an.

Was uns wichtig ist? Die 3 W’s: Wissensaustausch, Weiterbildungen und Weiterentwicklung. Interessiert? Dann wird’s jetzt spannend:

Aufgaben

Als Qlik Berater/ Consultant realisieren Sie umfassende, kompetente und verantwortungsvolle Beratungs- und Unterstützungsleistungen rund um den Themenkreis Qlik Analytics
Sie sind maßgeblich an der Analyse, Konzeption und Implementierung von Qlik-Projekten und Services unserer Kunden beteiligt
Sie unterstützen unsere Kunden bei der Optimierung und Standardisierung von Business Intelligence-Lösungen auf Qlik-Basis
Sie übernehmen auch klassische Organisations- und Anwendungsberatung sowie Durchführung von Kundenschulungen
Sie wirken aktiv mit bei der Gestaltung unddem Aufbau unseres Analytics Bereichs in unterschiedlichen zukunftsorientierten Themen wie Big Data, Predictive Analytics und AI


Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kunden echten Mehrwert. Sie sind das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Sie konzipieren. Sie realisieren. Sie treiben voran.

Qualifikation

Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, (Wirtschafts-) Mathematik, Statistik, Physik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung
Mehrjährige Erfahrungen mit Qlik und/oder im Business Intelligence-Umfeld
Kenntnisse in ERP- und CRM-Systemen wünschenswert
Verständnis für betriebswirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge und Prozesse
Kenntnisse in der SQL Programmierung und/ oder Datenmodellierung
Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region


Benefits

Wir sind nicht langweilig: Dazu gehören vielfältige Projekte aus unterschiedlichsten Branchen.
Wir bleiben am Puls der Zeit: Wir arbeiten mit zukunftsweisenden Technologien und lernen immer dazu.
Wir machen Karriere: Entwicklung ist bei uns individuell, auf Ihre Stärken angepasst und herausfordernd.
Wir leben Work-Life-Balance: Attraktive Vergütung, Zusatzleistungen, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertage des Bundeslandes Baden-Württemberg.
Wir denken grün: Mit unseren sozialen Projekten wollen wir die Arbeitswelt verändern und inspirieren uns gegenseitig mit neuen Ideen.
Wir haben gemeinsam Spaß: Regelmäßige lokale Afterworks, Sportevents und jährliche Weihnachtsfeiern.


Aber genug von uns, jetzt sind Sie dran. Sie haben noch Fragen? Kontaktieren Sie uns gerne. Bereit ein Positive Thinker zu werden? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!
Show more Show less

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Codete is not just a software company, it’s a place where tech-enthusiasts can grow by doing what they love and feel valued for what they are. We’re experienced, agile and versatile: we work with a wide range of technologies in projects from many different industries, and the majority of our team are senior-level specialists.

At Codete, there’s always something new to learn!

Together with our technology partner, we are looking for a mid level Data Engineer who gets excited about building data

systems and wants to solve data centric problems unique to the field of social media driven e-commerce.

Location: Remote from EU countries, Germany-Berlin

Working hours / Part-time job: 20h/week

Tech stack: Python, Snowflake, DBT, Prefect (or Airflow), SQL, GCP cloud

Salary: PLN 7 000 - 9 000 per month / 1400 - 1900 Euro/month gross B2B

Requirements

In this role you will:

Develop and maintain existing data systems and data pipelines
Develop new data pipelines or acquire data from different sources to power analytics and some internal applications
Optimize existing data processing architecture for scale
Design and implement a testing & monitoring strategy for our data pipelines
Serve as the point of contact and sparring partner for data analysts, product managers and other stakeholders
Implement solutions to constantly improve data reliability and quality


Your Profile (Required)

2-4 yrs of experience as a Data Engineer
Strong Python skills
Working experience with Snowflake (or another MPP database), DBT and Prefect (or Airflow)
Good grasp of SQL, relational databases, and data modelling concepts
Analytical mindset, high attention to detail, strange obsession with automation
Ability to research and solve technical challenges
Ability to translate business problems into effective data solutions
Ability to see the bigger picture and write software that always addresses the business question posed
Excellent English communication skills


Nice to have

○ Knowledge of HTML, JS, Google Analytics, GTM, and frontend tracking concepts

○ Practical experience with DevOps concepts - GCP cloud

Benefits

Values & Atmosphere

flexible attitude (including working hours)
international business trips
social events & awaydays
support for your ideas


Personal development

external conferences
technical & soft skills training
switching between projects/technology
English classes
internal library


Health & Relax

Employee Wellbeing Platform
private health care
multisport card
sports events
chill-out room
fresh fruits & juicer


Knowledge & Culture

open source initiatives
Codete Mentorship Program
R&D department


The data controller of your personal data is Codete Global Sp. z o.o. with its seat in Kraków (30-527), Poland, ul. Na Zjeździe 11. The data will be processed for recruitment purposes. To learn more please read an appropriate section of our Privacy Policy (Personal data provided for recruitment purposes).
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analytics Consultant Fokus Online (m/w/d)
Description:
Datum: 07.02.2023

Standort:

München, BY, DE, 80992 Düsseldorf, NW, DE, 40474 Hamburg, HH, DE, 22297 Nürnberg, BY, DE, 90449 Teltow, BB, DE, 14513

Unternehmen: GER - Telefónica Germany Retail GmbH

Vertragsart: Vollzeit, unbefristet

Eintritt: ab nächstmöglichem Zeitpunk

Working anywhere. Wir arbeiten dort, wo es am produktivsten ist. Darum hast Du, nach erfolgreichem Bewerbungsprozess, die Möglichkeit deutschlandweit zu arbeiten. Bei Telefónica setzen wir auf ein flexibles Hybridmodell, das sowohl die Vorteile von Remote- als auch Vor-Ort-Arbeiten angemessen berücksichtigt. Du wirst entsprechend Deinem Wohnort, dem nächsten Telefónica Standort zugeordnet. Weitere Details besprechen wir mit Dir im Bewerbungsprozess.

Wer wir sind

Wir sind O2 Telefónica – mit unseren Mobilfunkmarken verbinden wir Millionen von Menschen und bieten unseren Kunden mobile Freiheit in der digitalen Welt. Darüber hinaus gestalten wir als führender Telekommunikationsanbieter maßgeblich die Digitalisierung in Deutschland mit. Unsere rund 7.400 Mitarbeiter hierzulande treiben die Transformation jeden Tag ein Stück voran – auch in unserem eigenen Unternehmen.

Telefónica zählt zu den Top-Arbeitgebern in Deutschland und ist Teil des globalen Telekommunikationskonzerns Telefónica S.A. mit mehr als 110.000 engagierten Mitarbeitern weltweit.

Werde auch Du Teil unseres einzigartigen Teams und lass uns gemeinsam etwas bewegen!

Was Dich erwartet

Berechnung von online Kennzahlen und deren Interpretation sowie Ableitung von strategischen Handlungsempfehlungen für Stakeholder und Managementebene
Hypothesengetriebene Generierung von Insights mit Hilfe von Web- & App-Daten
End-2-End Analyse der Customer Journey zur Kampagnenbewertung und Optimierung
Visualisierung der erhobenen Webdaten v.a. mit der Hilfe von Looker Studio
Durchführung und Leitung von Projekten innerhalb des Web Analytics Umfelds
Enge Abstimmung und Zusammenarbeit mit den Data Science Experten zur Verbesserung der Analyse und Prognose Möglichkeiten des Onlinebereiches
Briefing und Steuerung externer Agenturen
Sicherstellung des Know-how- und Wissenstransfer innerhalb und außerhalb der Online-Abteilung


Was Du mitbringst

Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik/Statistik oder Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder vergleichbare Studiengänge
Sicherer Umgang mit den Produkten der Google Marketing Platform insb. Google Analytics & Looker Studio
Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Big Query ist wünschenswert, sowie in der Segmentierung von großen Datenmengen
Ausgeprägtes Zahlenverständnis und Leidenschaft für den gesamten Bereich des online Marketings/Vertriebs
Organisations- und Konzeptionsfähigkeiten, Innovationsbereitschaft, Lösungsorientierung


Was wir Dir bieten

Modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld: Arbeite innerhalb Deutschlands wo Du willst. Ob im Homeoffice oder einem unserer Büros. Wir bieten Dir dabei maximale Flexibilität Deinen Arbeitstag zu gestalten.

Weiterbildung & Entwicklung: Alles, was Du für Deinen individuellen Wachstumsweg brauchst. Mit einem persönlichem Entwicklungsplan, Learning Journeys und der Möglichkeit von Job Rotations, erreichst Du mit uns Deine Ziele – entsprechend unserem Leitgedanken „connect, learn and move2grow".

Finanzielle Vorteile: Ein Smartphone zur dienstlichen und privaten Nutzung sowie die Möglichkeit über ein Guthaben auch Partner, Freunde und Familie zu versorgen, ist für uns selbstverständlich. Darüber hinaus profitierst Du von einer Vielzahl an Corporate Benefits und einem Quartalsbonus.

Gesundheit: Unser „Feel Good“ Programm sorgt dafür, dass es Dir gut geht. Unter anderem bieten wir Fitnesskurse, Ernährungsberatungen und Angebote zur Verbesserung der Ergonomie am Arbeitsplatz sowie der Work-Life-Balance an.

Soziales Engagement: Wir engagieren uns auch außerhalb der Unternehmensgrenzen. Du kannst im Rahmen von Volunteering Days / Holidays oder Spendenläufen soziale Projekte unterstützen.

Wie Du Dich bewirbst und was Du noch wissen solltest

Überzeuge uns mit Deinem aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf sowie dazugehörigen Zeugnissen. Ein Motivationsschreiben oder Anschreiben brauchst Du bei uns nicht. Bitte beachte, dass Bewerbungen nur über unser Bewerberportal möglich sind und Bewerbungen per E-Mail nicht berücksichtigt werden können.

Du hast Fragen zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess und Interesse an weiteren Informationen zu der Stelle? Dann wende dich bitte an unser Recruiting Team (de-recruiting@telefonica.com).

Bei gleicher Eignung werden Bewerber:innen mit einer Schwerbehinderung bevorzugt berücksichtigt. Alle Geschlechter sind gleichermaßen willkommen.
Show more Show less

  • Organisations- und Konzeptionsfähigkeiten, Innovationsbereitschaft, Lösungsorientierung

Was wir Dir bieten

Modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld: Arbeite innerhalb Deutschlands wo Du willst. Ob im Homeoffice oder einem unserer Büros. Wir bieten Dir dabei maximale Flexibilität Deinen Arbeitstag zu gestalten.

Weiterbildung & Entwicklung: Alles, was Du für Deinen individuellen Wachstumsweg brauchst. Mit einem persönlichem Entwicklungsplan, Learning Journeys und der Möglichkeit von Job Rotations, erreichst Du mit uns Deine Ziele – entsprechend unserem Leitgedanken „connect, learn and move2grow".

Finanzielle Vorteile: Ein Smartphone zur dienstlichen und privaten Nutzung sowie die Möglichkeit über ein Guthaben auch Partner, Freunde und Familie zu versorgen, ist für uns selbstverständlich. Darüber hinaus profitierst Du von einer Vielzahl an Corporate Benefits und einem Quartalsbonus.

Gesundheit: Unser „Feel Good“ Programm sorgt dafür, dass es Dir gut geht. Unter anderem bieten wir Fitnesskurse, Ernährungsberatungen und Angebote zur Verbesserung der Ergonomie am Arbeitsplatz sowie der Work-Life-Balance an.

Soziales Engagement: Wir engagieren uns auch außerhalb der Unternehmensgrenzen. Du kannst im Rahmen von Volunteering Days / Holidays oder Spendenläufen soziale Projekte unterstützen.

Wie Du Dich bewirbst und was Du noch wissen solltest

Überzeuge uns mit Deinem aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf sowie dazugehörigen Zeugnissen. Ein Motivationsschreiben oder Anschreiben brauchst Du bei uns nicht. Bitte beachte, dass Bewerbungen nur über unser Bewerberportal möglich sind und Bewerbungen per E-Mail nicht berücksichtigt werden können.

Du hast Fragen zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess und Interesse an weiteren Informationen zu der Stelle? Dann wende dich bitte an unser Recruiting Team (de-recruiting@telefonica.com).

Bei gleicher Eignung werden Bewerber:innen mit einer Schwerbehinderung bevorzugt berücksichtigt. Alle Geschlechter sind gleichermaßen willkommen.

Title: Data Professional (f/m/d) - Analytics & AI - Expert Services
Description:
Stellenbeschreibung




Your impact




You team-up with our scientists, business and infrastructure experts to design data solutions that have global impact and scale to all E.ON countries
You evaluate new data technologies to efficiently integrate latest machine learning solutions and analytical modules into operational cloud services
You increase efficiency and time-to-market by implementing re-usable artificial intelligence models
You enhance analytics capabilities by extracting information from diverse sets of structured, unstructured, batch and streaming data
You ensure high quality and stability through agile processes and peer code reviews
You share your ideas and convince to go new ways




Your Profile




You have a degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline or other significant work experience.
You have hands-on coding experience to process huge data sets, time series analysis, perform statistical data analysis and build supervised and unsupervised models in Python.
You love mathematics and statistics.
You already have knowledge of Machine Learning frameworks like MLlib, scikit-learn, Azure ML, etc.
Ideally you have already experience with data transformations in Spark and Databricks.
Ideally you already know how to implement pipelines in Azure Data Factory, and how to efficiently deploy analytical modules.
Working with git and CI/CD flows is preferred by you. Knowledge of Azure DevOps is considered as a plus.
Excellent writing and communication skills, considering varying levels of precision and matching the audience .
Fluent in English; German language skills are seen as a plus.




What you can expect from a Career in E.ON Digital Technology




We offer the unique opportunity to combine your love for technology with your passion to work on a topic of high relevance for society. You will be able to contribute to E.ON’s ambitious digitalization strategy, to apply and broaden your expertise on a variety of assignments, to work with cutting edge technology and to have the opportunity to grow your career internationally across the wider organization.




Inklusion




Uns ist wichtig, Menschen mit Behinderung ein faires Bewerbungsverfahren zu ermöglichen, in dem sie ihr Bestes zeigen können. Daher wird unsere Schwerbehindertenvertretung frühzeitig in das Verfahren einbezogen. Bitte teile uns über das Bewerbungsformular mit, ob du technische oder organisatorische Anpassungen für das Bewerbungsverfahren benötigst. Wir stellen diese gern zur Verfügung.




Wenn es dir nicht möglich ist, dich online zu bewerben und du stattdessen mit jemandem sprechen möchtest, kontaktiere bitte deinen lokalen Recruiter.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Working Student/Intern) (m/w/d)
Description:
RECARE is one of the leading digital startups in the German healthcare industry, on a mission to transform healthcare through its platform for digital care coordination. We search, find and coordinate service capacities so that hospitals can focus on their patients rather than processes.

Within a very short time, Recare was able to onboard over 750 acute care and rehabilitation clinics as well as over 14 000 other service providers on its platform. Renowned hospitals and hospital groups such as Vivantes, Sana Kliniken AG, München Klinik, Hannover Medical School, and Essen University Hospital are among Recare's customers, as well as major health insurances such as TK, BKK and Barmer.

Example product use case - Rehabilitation

When a patient needs to be transferred to a rehabilitation clinic after a hospital stay, hospital staff currently have to:

fax (yes, fax...) forms to the patient's insurance to ask whether they are eligible for rehabilitation
find an available clinic offering the needed services (generally done by calling many and sharing patient data via fax).


With RECARE, hospital staff upload all relevant patient information in one place with the click of a button directly from the hospital’s information system, and can share it securely with all parties involved. An automated search is then started to find an available spot within our network of rehabilitation clinics.

Rehabilitation is just one of our use cases, we also cover care, transport, medical supplies and hospital transfers. Our product combines a SaaS with a marketplace to automate time-intensive tasks and free up hospital resources for patients rather than processes.

Aufgaben

How you will make an impact as a working student/intern in business intelligence:

Our teams are constantly using data products, be it for reporting to customers, managing sales and onboarding pipelines, reporting and communicating internally or simply keeping an eye on the marketplace’s performance metrics. As a BI Analyst, you will be supporting the BI team in designing, building and maintaining such products.

You improve and maintain our Looker instance.
You incorporate new data sources to our warehouse.
You collaborate with technical teams on data related projects.
You build dashboards to support our operations and product teams.
You use data to identify trends and root causes of business problems.
You participate in AGILE ceremonies and planning sessions as an active member of the BI team; you provide input in process optimisations and support addressing stakeholder feedback.


Your future tools

Database/Warehouse: Postgres/Snowflake
ETL: Stitch/DBT
Visualisation: Looker
Analytics: Jupyter


Qualifikation

Before anything else : this is not a Machine Learning position, your interest should lie in analytical and data visualisation tasks, we will of course consider applicants with a ML background if they demonstrated experience and interest in the latter.

What you will need to succeed as a working student/intern in business intelligence:

You are currently pursuing a Master's degree in university or business school with a quantitative focus (computer science, economics, engineering, mathematics, statistics or related field).
You have some prior experience working in the data analytics fields either as an intern or working student
You have a good eye for detail and you possess the ability to work and solve problems autonomously, to think critically and to be able to produce high quality analysis which create real value for stakeholders.
You have experience in using SQL and data visualisation tools (Looker, Tableau, etc.) and are motivated to develop your skill set.
You have a good understanding of data modelling and descriptive and inferential statistics.
You have solid communication and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical audiences.
You have an excellent command of English both in writing and speaking; German would be a plus.
Working Student : You can work 20 hours per week / Intern : You are available for 6 months


Benefits

This is what you can expect from us as a working student/intern in business intelligence:

Work with purpose - what you do has a concrete impact on healthcare professionals and patients.
Develop both professionally and personally while gaining insights into many parts of a start-up as part of a cross-functional team.
A motivated, international team that fosters a start-up atmosphere with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes.
Flexible remote and/or on-site work
A monthly mobility budget with Rydes to use on many transportation means (BVG, Uber, DB or FlixBus, Swapfiets)
An Urban Sports Club membership (M), to take care of your physical and mental health.
13,5 days of holidays + 1 additional day on your birthday


To apply, please provide your CV and a short motivational statement

Title: Data Engineer - Marketing
Description:
Data Engineer - Marketing Services - Berlin, Germany




Cititec are exclusively partnered with one of Berlin's most popular and heavily funded FinTech's to scale out their data & engineering functions.




The app is currently used by millions of customers around the world and it has become a pivotal product especially in the European market.




Due to their continued success & rise they are looking to further expand their data team across data engineering, analytics engineering, data science, product & growth analytics.




With your team, you will take full responsibility for the Marketing data and projects centered around Attribution, ROAS, CLV etc and aim to provide an excellent data foundation for all marketing services.




Requirements:

2 Years experience in a Data Engineering role (or similar)

SQL

Python

Previous experience within marketing, tracking would be a big plus




Benefits:

Generous Stock Options

Relocation and Visa Assistance




Hybrid Working Model
