About The Role


At voilà we will build the leading Chef-to-Customer Platform, enabling everyone to experience the best chefs & restaurants at home - literally everywhere! We are keen to unlock the food experience category in food delivery by enabling award-winning, taste-making, and trendsetting chefs to ship nationwide and leverage tech to foster an authentic culinary experience at home.


We envision a world where access to the finest, most innovative, and trendsetting culinary highlights is not limited to a certain place & city. On this way, we are backed by the best VCs in the food industry, such as FoodLabs, and well equipped with culinary know-how by the best partner chefs & restaurants.


We are looking for a Senior Analytics Manager (m/f/x) to join our office in Berlin ASAP.


  • Take end-to-end ownership of the whole data landscape: data warehouse, reporting, (marketing) analytics, tracking, KPI development, dashboarding, data analysis
  • Own the full life-cycle of gathering analytics requirements, designing solutions, implementation, and feedback
  • Be a sparring partner for marketing and business team members understanding business needs and translating them into data solutions
  • Work closely with C-level to help with data-driven decision-making on business steering and creating data insights for business success
  • Design and build dashboards to visualize the most important KPIs
  • Do deep dives into data to generate product & customer insights

What you need to succeed
  • You are a data generalist, keen to dive into different data challenges, and have a “get the stuff done” attitude
  • You ask great questions. The best analysis starts with the right questions
  • Experience in analytics or BI function and tools:
    • Strong SQL skills - you can generate insights with efficient SQL
    • Strong analytical thinking - you can conceptualize how to measure the business impact of marketing activities
    • Understanding of main marketing KPIs & cohorts
    • Strong knowledge of cloud data warehousing solutions (e.g. BigQuery)
    • Visualization tools (Looker/Data Studio/Tableau/Power BI etc)
  • You like learning and are proactive
  • You are experienced in communicating with all levels of stakeholders
  • Bachelor’s degree with a focus on engineering, computer science, or a related field is a plus

PLUS
  • Experience with
    • Transformation layer (dbt)
    • web/app tracking (Google Tag Manager, GA4, firebase, adjust)
    • GitHub
    • Python data wrangling


Why join?


  • A high-growth, ambitious food startup environment with an exponential growth curve.
  • Full ownership over exciting and challenging projects.
  • Competitive compensation package (base and equity).
  • Great networking opportunities within the FoodLabs family and Berlin startup ecosystem.
  • An amazing office in Berlin Mitte.
  • Discounts to experience food from the world's best chefs.

About us


Backed by the best food tech investors FoodLabs & EQT Ventures, voilà enables everyone to experience the best chefs & restaurants at home. From authentic tastemakers to the best top chefs: At voilà, you can discover the hottest restaurants and enjoy from Tim Raue's favorite peking duck in Hamburg to the TV chef Steffen Henssler.


Find more about us here!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you excited by working in multiple industries? 💭




I have partnered with an incredible consultancy, With opportunities in Berlin, Dusseldorf, Munich and Frankfurt. The opportunity will involve being apart of the AI and Data branch, working with industry leading businesses to assist and create state of the art solutions and products to be used by various end consumers. 🚀 This position is minimum B2 German and has the opportunity for remote working 💻




What you'll be doing 👇




✅Helping industry leading businesses develop their goals and plans using Data.

✅Design and Develop Scalable ETL and ETL Routines.

✅Ensure high levels of Data quality.

✅Advising customers and data scientists on the design of new data management systems based on the respective business goals.

✅Design, develop and test robust data & analytics infrastructures that share data with customers and other teams through various relevant interfaces.

✅Collaborate with data driven teams.




What they're looking for 👇

✅3+ Years experience in Data Engineering

✅Experience in either Python, Java or Scala

✅Good knowledge of distributed analytics platforms such as Hadoop, Spark, Kafka and cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, Google

✅ Heavy Experience in SQL and Databases

✅Experience with CI/CD environments

✅Willingness to travel nationally




Does this opportunity excite you? Lets talk! 👀🚀




📧: James.Wilkinson@parallelconsulting.com

☎️: +49 2152 99039769

Title: (Junior) Datenanalyst (m/w/d) Finanzdienstleistung
Description:
Du findest die Datenwelt spannend und hast Freude am Netzwerken? Du hast Dein Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im kaufmännischen oder Finanzdienstleistungsbereich erfolgreich abgeschlossen? Du bist kommunikativ und hast eine lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise? Dann suchen wir Dich! Als (Junior) Data Analyst (m/w/d) im Bereich Finance erstellst Du Datenauswertungen und -analysen, optimierst Smart Data Lösungen und übernimmst den Aufbau von Dashboards und Reports. Zudem agierst Du als Ansprechpartner für andere Fachbereiche.

Unser Kunde ist ein führendes Unternehmen aus dem Finanzwesen. Dich erwartet dort eine kollegiale Arbeitsatmosphäre auf einem sehr professionellen Niveau. Durch die Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Experten kannst Du Deine Fähigkeiten weiterentwickeln und in einem modernen Arbeitsumfeld Deiner Leidenschaft nachgehen. Bewirb Dich jetzt!

Das erwartet Dich bei uns

Erstellung und Durchführung von Datenauswertungen und -analysen
Ableitung von Entwicklungs- und Handlungsimpulsen sowie Lösungsideen
Übernahme des Aufbaus von Dashboards und Reports
Entwicklung eines datenbetriebenen Marktbearbeitungsmodells
Weiterentwicklung von Smart Data Lösungen
Das bieten wir Dir

Ein jährliches Gehalt zwischen 54.000 und 61.000 €
30 Tage Urlaub sowie zusätzliche freie Tage am 24. und 31. Dezember
Flexible Arbeitszeiten sowie Homeoffice im 50/50 Verhältnis möglich
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge und vermögenswirksame Leistungen
Geförderte Sabbatical-Option
Das bringst Du mit

Ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im kaufmännischen oder Finanzdienstleistungsbereich
Idealerweise erste Erfahrungen im Umgang mit ETL- und BI-Werkzeugen sowie im Datamining
Fundierte Kenntnisse in einer Programmier- oder Skriptsprache (z.B. SQL, Python, Sparks)
Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse
Ein hohes Maß an Kommunikationsstärke und analytisch-konzeptionellen Fähigkeiten

Title: (Junior) Business Intelligence Analyst*in (m/w/d)
Description:
Über uns
Mit klickrent und klickcheck haben wir erfolgreiche digitale Lösungen entwickelt, die sämtliche Prozesse rund um das Thema Vermietung von Bautechnik optimieren und vereinfachen. Unter dem Dach der klickrent GmbH arbeiten mittlerweile über 70 Mitarbeiter daran, die Online-Mietplattform sowie unsere App zur Zustandsdokumentation von Bautechnik immer weiter zu verbessern und die Anmietung für unsere Kunden noch leichter und schneller zu machen.

Dabei haben wir als 100%ige Tochter der Zeppelin Group stets einen globalen & starken Partner an der Seite.

Vom Digital Native bis zum/zur Bauexpert*in,wir begeistern uns für das Thema Bauen. Wir brennen für das, was wir tun und haben dabei immer den Anspruch, uns weiterzuentwickeln. Wir wagen Neues und reizen Grenzen aus. Immer mit dem Ziel, für unsere Kunden das Beste zu finden. Wir freuen uns über alle von Euch, die unsere Leidenschaft und unsere Ziele teilen. Bei uns könnt Ihr die Zukunft der Baubranche mit gestalten, verändern und revolutionieren!

Findet interessante Einblicke und lernt unser Team und unsere digitalen Lösungen kennen auf...
unserer Unternehmenswebseite
klickrent / klickcheck
Zeppelin Group

Wir suchen
Fürunser klickrent-Team suchen wir Dich ab sofort als (Junior)Business Intelligence Analyst*in (m/w/d) in Vollzeit.

Du bringst nicht nur eine Leidenschaft für Daten, Analysen & Reportings mit, sondern darüber hinaus auch eine Begeisterung für die Identifizierung neuer Optimierungspotenziale sowie das Ausprobieren neuer Wege. Hilf uns, klickrent in ein Data-Driven Business zu verwandeln und unsere Daten effizient zu nutzen sowie unsere Performance Schritt für Schritt zu verbessern.Du willst zudem Teil eines Teams sein, welches motiviert und fokussiert vorangeht und freust Dich über viel Eigenverantwortung und flache Hierarchien. Dann werde Teil unseres einzigartigen Teams und revolutioniere mit uns die Baubranche!

Wir brauchen dringend mehr Frauenpower und würden uns daher über weibliche Unterstützung freuen! Wir ermutigen daher ausdrücklich auch Frauen, sich bei uns zu bewerben und stehen für die Chancengleichheit aller Geschlechter (m/w/d).

Diese Aufgaben erwarten Dich
Du identifizierst durch Datenanalyse eigenständig & proaktiv Optimierungsmöglichkeiten, die unsere Performance verbessern und Business Modelle der Zukunft ermöglichen
Du führst unterschiedlichste, verteilte Daten an einer Stelle im Unternehmen zusammen
Du bist gemeinsam mit dem Business Intelligence-Team verantwortlich für die Darstellung von KPIs sowie das regelmäßige Reporting unserer Performance
Du unterstützt beim Design nachhaltiger ETL/Backend Lösungen in Cloud- & OnPremise-Architekturen
Du erstellst Datenverarbeitungsprozesse mittels Salesforce Analytics
Du bist eine wichtige Schnittstelle zwischen Management & den unterschiedlichen Fachbereichen und stellst eine wichtige Grundlage für sämtliche Prozessoptimierungen dar

Du bist ein wesentlicher & wichtiger Teil unseres weiteren Wachstums und verantwortlich für den Erfolg von klickrent!

Was Du mitbringst
Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Du kannst deine Leidenschaft für Datenbanken, Datenanalyse & -modellierung kaum verbergen :)
Du bringst bereits erste Erfahrungen bei der Erstellung von Systemen zu Sammlung und Auswertung heterogener Daten aus verschiedenen Quellsystemen mit
Du hast bereits praktische Erfahrungen im Bereich Business Intelligence sowie in der Verwendung von Tools zum Datenmanagement bzw. zur Datenauswertung & -Präsentation (z. B. Tableau, Salesforce Reporting, Talend)
Du kennst Dich mit dem Export von Daten aus ERP- & CRM-Systemen (idealerweise SAP & Salesforce) aus
Du kannst sowohl auf Management-Ebene, als auch mit verschiedensten Fachbereichen kommunizieren
Du hast gute Kenntnisse im Bereich Bash Scripting, idealerweise zusätzlich Salesforce-Analytics-Kenntnisse (ehemals Tableau CRM)
Du besitzt gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. C1) sowie gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
...neben deinen beruflichen Fähigkeiten interessiert uns aber vor allem deine Persönlichkeit und dein Interesse an einer spannenden gemeinsamen Reise!

WIR FREUEN UNS AUF DICH!

Was wir Dir bieten
ein hoch motiviertes und außergewöhnliches Team - lerne das Team und unsere Projekte auf klickrent @ YouTube kennen
flache Hierarchien und agile Start-up Kultur
offene und immer stets auf Augenhöhe geprägte Unternehmenskultur
persönliche Entwicklungs- und Wachstumschancen mit individueller Betreuung und regelmäßigen Feedbacks
eine moderne Arbeitsumgebung mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und viel Gestaltungsspielraum
die Chance, gemeinsam mit uns die Baubranche zu revolutionieren!
darüber hinaus bieten wir verschiedene Maßnahmen für die Erhaltung deiner Gesundheit (bspw. Yoga Sessions, Vortrag mentale Gesundheit, Company Bike) und Beratungsangebote von FamPlus (bspw. Kinderbetreuung, Pflege, seelische Gesundheit) an, um Job und deine individuelle Lebensphase zu vereinen

Lisa
Recruiting & Talent Acquisition Managerin

Your Office
Office Berlin, Elsenstraße 106, 12435 Berlin (Alt-Treptow)
Show more Show less
HTML:
Über uns
 Mit klickrent und klickcheck haben wir erfolgreiche digitale Lösungen entwickelt, die sämtliche Prozesse rund um das Thema Vermietung von Bautechnik optimieren und vereinfachen. Unter dem Dach der klickrent GmbH arbeiten mittlerweile über 70 Mitarbeiter daran, die Online-Mietplattform sowie unsere App zur Zustandsdokumentation von Bautechnik immer weiter zu verbessern und die Anmietung für unsere Kunden noch leichter und schneller zu machen.

Dabei haben wir als 100%ige Tochter der Zeppelin Group stets einen globalen & starken Partner an der Seite.

Vom Digital Native bis zum/zur Bauexpert*in,wir begeistern uns für das Thema Bauen. Wir brennen für das, was wir tun und haben dabei immer den Anspruch, uns weiterzuentwickeln. Wir wagen Neues und reizen Grenzen aus. Immer mit dem Ziel, für unsere Kunden das Beste zu finden. Wir freuen uns über alle von Euch, die unsere Leidenschaft und unsere Ziele teilen. Bei uns könnt Ihr die Zukunft der Baubranche mit gestalten, verändern und revolutionieren!

Findet interessante Einblicke und lernt unser Team und unsere digitalen Lösungen kennen auf...
  • unserer Unternehmenswebseite
  • klickrent / klickcheck
  • Zeppelin Group

Wir suchen
 Fürunser klickrent-Team suchen wir Dich ab sofort als (Junior)Business Intelligence Analyst*in (m/w/d) in Vollzeit.

Du bringst nicht nur eine Leidenschaft für Daten, Analysen & Reportings mit, sondern darüber hinaus auch eine Begeisterung für die Identifizierung neuer Optimierungspotenziale sowie das Ausprobieren neuer Wege. Hilf uns, klickrent in ein Data-Driven Business zu verwandeln und unsere Daten effizient zu nutzen sowie unsere Performance Schritt für Schritt zu verbessern.Du willst zudem Teil eines Teams sein, welches motiviert und fokussiert vorangeht und freust Dich über viel Eigenverantwortung und flache Hierarchien. Dann werde Teil unseres einzigartigen Teams und revolutioniere mit uns die Baubranche!
Wir brauchen dringend mehr Frauenpower und würden uns daher über weibliche Unterstützung freuen! Wir ermutigen daher ausdrücklich auch Frauen, sich bei uns zu bewerben und stehen für die Chancengleichheit aller Geschlechter (m/w/d).

Diese Aufgaben erwarten Dich
  • Du identifizierst durch Datenanalyse eigenständig & proaktiv Optimierungsmöglichkeiten, die unsere Performance verbessern und Business Modelle der Zukunft ermöglichen
  • Du führst unterschiedlichste, verteilte Daten an einer Stelle im Unternehmen zusammen
  • Du bist gemeinsam mit dem Business Intelligence-Team verantwortlich für die Darstellung von KPIs sowie das regelmäßige Reporting unserer Performance
  • Du unterstützt beim Design nachhaltiger ETL/Backend Lösungen in Cloud- & OnPremise-Architekturen
  • Du erstellst Datenverarbeitungsprozesse mittels Salesforce Analytics
  • Du bist eine wichtige Schnittstelle zwischen Management & den unterschiedlichen Fachbereichen und stellst eine wichtige Grundlage für sämtliche Prozessoptimierungen dar

Du bist ein wesentlicher & wichtiger Teil unseres weiteren Wachstums und verantwortlich für den Erfolg von klickrent!
Was Du mitbringst
  • Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
  • Du kannst deine Leidenschaft für Datenbanken, Datenanalyse & -modellierung kaum verbergen :)
  • Du bringst bereits erste Erfahrungen bei der Erstellung von Systemen zu Sammlung und Auswertung heterogener Daten aus verschiedenen Quellsystemen mit
  • Du hast bereits praktische Erfahrungen im Bereich Business Intelligence sowie in der Verwendung von Tools zum Datenmanagement bzw. zur Datenauswertung & -Präsentation (z. B. Tableau, Salesforce Reporting, Talend)
  • Du kennst Dich mit dem Export von Daten aus ERP- & CRM-Systemen (idealerweise SAP & Salesforce) aus
  • Du kannst sowohl auf Management-Ebene, als auch mit verschiedensten Fachbereichen kommunizieren
  • Du hast gute Kenntnisse im Bereich Bash Scripting, idealerweise zusätzlich Salesforce-Analytics-Kenntnisse (ehemals Tableau CRM)
  • Du besitzt gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. C1) sowie gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
  • ...neben deinen beruflichen Fähigkeiten interessiert uns aber vor allem deine Persönlichkeit und dein Interesse an einer spannenden gemeinsamen Reise!

WIR FREUEN UNS AUF DICH!
Was wir Dir bieten
  • ein hoch motiviertes und außergewöhnliches Team - lerne das Team und unsere Projekte auf klickrent @ YouTube kennen
  • flache Hierarchien und agile Start-up Kultur
  • offene und immer stets auf Augenhöhe geprägte Unternehmenskultur
  • persönliche Entwicklungs- und Wachstumschancen mit individueller Betreuung und regelmäßigen Feedbacks
  • eine moderne Arbeitsumgebung mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und viel Gestaltungsspielraum
  • die Chance, gemeinsam mit uns die Baubranche zu revolutionieren!

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Dentolo is one of the fastest-growing insurance start-ups in Europe and you will work together with us on providing the digital backbone of our insurance platform.

Your work will range from customer-focused development to workflow automation and internal tools to help our team and customers have a seamless experience.

Your Role in our team

You will take over responsibility for setting up a modern data infrastructure and migrating step by step from our current infrastructure to the new one.
This includes the setup of the environment in AWS (airbyte, airflow, dbt) with terraform as well as the configuration of the three tools named.
You will support our Analytics Engineer / Data Analyst by providing them with the data they need by writing transformation in dbt.
You work together with our Engineering team to adapt infrastructure best practices
You collaborate with our different teams (e.g. Product, Marketing, Sales, Operations) to prepare data and reports that drive decisions.
You use your knowledge and ideas to contribute to our overall data strategy, especially with focus on our future data setup.
You initiate and take over your own projects in fields of your interest.
You use your passion for data to foster our dentolo data culture.


What you need to be successful:

2+ years of experience in data engineering or business intelligence
At least one year of experience with terraform and AWS.
Advanced knowledge of SQL. Experience with writing and optimizing complex queries and handling of complex data structures, preferably with dbt.
You have experience with Python and code versioning (Git)
We would love if you already worked with Airflow and Airbyte.
You have a strong interest in business-related topics and can have proven that you can connect the data you work with to real-world operative challenges and business questions posed.
Excellent communication skills and strong analytical thinking.
You have an eye for details and can break down complex problems.
You have great spoken and written English.
Living in Germany, ideally in Berlin.


Target achievements for the next couple of months:

Familiarize with our data landscape, understand how the processes work and challenge them based on your expertise and “outside” view.
Get to know the team and the relevant stakeholders and gain an understanding for their roles and requirements towards our data.
Set up a concrete plan for setting up the infrastructure that we are eager to work with in the future, as well as a plan for the step-by-step migration.
Go the first steps by setting up the fundament of the new infrastructure in AWS
Share your knowledge with the current team members and educate them in the usage of new tools.


Why dentolo?

One of Europe’s fastest growing Insurtechs, backed long-term by one of the largest insurance powerhouses worldwide.
High level of collaboration and autonomy, working in a group of international colleagues in a small to medium sized startup with a getting-things-done attitude.
Cutting-edge technologies, agile development practices, and a product-focused environment that tackles demanding technical and scaling challenges.
6th floor office in the heart of Berlin (Mitte/ Prenzlauer Berg) with beautiful views over the city.
Quarterly team budget for various events, you decide :)
Annual learning budget for your personal development.
Flexible work arrangements according to your needs.
Vacation entitlement starting with 28 days in your first year, accumulating 1 day with every 2 years of affiliation to the max. 30 days.
Free dental or pet insurance - to experience our products yourself.
Independent booking of monthly coaching sessions with nilo.health, our mental health tool.
Transportation benefit - you can choose between a free Swapfiets bike or a BVG eco-ticket (with a dentolo allowance).
Work up to 60 days from outside of Germany!
Free choice of a Windows or Mac computer.


Sounds like the perfect job for you?

We look forward to receiving your application and getting to know you!

dentolo is an equal opportunity and diversity employer. We strive to create a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for all our team members, regardless of ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, limitations and talents of any kind, physical appearance, social background, marital status, age, or religion (or lack thereof).

When you apply, we focus solely on your experience and motivation. You decide what additional information you want to disclose (photo, marital status, religion, gender, nationality, etc.). We value and treat all applications equally.

About Dentolo

We don’t just offer insurance. We create solutions tailored to needs.

Founded in 2015, dentolo builds and operates holistic insurance solutions, radically centered around you. We believe in offering a solution for everyone’s individual needs, so that they and their loved ones can be more carefree. Our solutions are built through conversations with our customers, teams and market specialists. We call this our expert insurance approach.

Today, every fourth new online customer in Germany chooses us as their partner for dental and pet health insurance. Our first two brands, dentolo and petolo, are rated 4.5+ of 5 on Google - unlike any other provider. We are customer-obsessed experts that love working together as a team. Our culture is built on collaboration, fast execution and bold actions, always caring about the customer first.

Contact:

Valeriia Vasko

Tech Recruiter

vvasko@dentolo.de

Title: Data & Insights Lead (m/f/d)
Description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.

Job Description

People First - At Takeda we are dedicated to improving the health and well-being of all people and bringing them the hope of a brighter future. It is our passion that transforms every job into meaningful action. Our people are the heart of Takeda.

For our commercial unit (EUCAN) in Berlin we are looking for a

Data & Insights Lead (m/f/d)

in a permanent position and in full time.

Your tasks in detail

Lead the Data & Insights team; develop capabilities within the team, manages resources and priorities
Responsible for implementation of Data & Insights strategies; define how to operationalize EUCAN data strategy and data governance considering our needs and pain points
Drive data-driven patient/HCP/product insights and act as a trusted insights partner for all functions
Act as customer domain data owner and drive the execution of data strategy and standards
Represent us in the EUCAN customer domain data governance council and support the shaping of future standards
Drive thought leadership, advanced analytics and data driven customer engagement (e.g., next best action) in close collaboration with BUs, NGCE and other cross functional team members
Provides guidance and input for EUCAN on shaping patient data and RWE domain
Accelerates D&I capability including strategy, roadmap and implementation to drive transformation
Develops and executes clear and practical plans based on key priorities that will accelerate the organization towards achievement of its goals
Drives I&A mindset shift, from support function to enabling partner
Support business planning and forecasting process (MRP, MYC, LRF) with BUs
Drive deployment/adoption of agreed D&I systems, tools and processes, mainly Enterprise Data Backbone, Power BI; Partner on any additional I&A needs/tools/dashboards
Take ownership of 3rd party data e.g., IQVIA or Insight health market data
Support market research and ensures market research needs brands are fulfilled
Provide summary/results of to TLT and LOC teams.
Support ad-hoc insights Leadership TEAM

Your profile

Bachelor’s degree in Life Science, Business Administration, Digital Business, Economics or equivalent
Min. 5 years of experience leading data and insights roles and/or responsible for innovation, consumer activation or insight-led digital transformation, data science or equivalent
Experience with building and deploying D&I capabilities and competencies across an organization
Deep understanding of data privacy regulations and associated business implications
Be the leading expert on D&I and has demonstrated innovative mindset and technical expertise
Displays expertise in data architecture and insight generation based on commercial technology backbone
Deep understanding of EDB technology platform, enables us to utilise tools and data effectively
Demonstrates literacy of advanced analytical tools including programming and database languages
Develops and implements dashboards/tools that meet business expectations
Proficient in German and in English

What You Can Look Forward To With Us

Appreciative working atmosphere in an international and exciting working environment with a wide range of development opportunities
Independent work with the opportunity to play a part in shaping an innovative company
Professional and personal development opportunities
A wide range of social benefits
Flexible working hours and home office (only 40% in the office)

Empowering our people to shine

At Takeda, we earn the trust of society and our customers through our values of Takeda-ism Integrity, Fairness, Honesty, Perseverance. We incorporate these values in everything we do. They represent who we are and how we act. They help us make decisions that we can be proud of today and in the future. We enable our employees to develop their full potential. As a global top employer, we offer exciting career paths, promote innovation and strive for top performance in everything we do. Takeda fosters an inclusive, collaborative and international work environment where our teams are united by their relentless commitment to our goal of improving people's health and creating a better future for the world. Learn more at takedajobs.com.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

Takeda is committed to foster diversity, equity and inclusion. Hiring decisions are based entirely on qualifications and are made regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, age or disability.

If you are interested in this opportunity, we look forward to receiving your application via our online tool!

For further questions, please contact Jennifer Kriedemann | Talent Acquisition Partner EUCAN | E-Mail jennifer.kriedemann@takeda.com

Title: Business & Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Ihre Benefits

20% Remote Anteil

Ihre Aufgaben

Projektstart: asap

Projektdauer: 30.09.2023

Auslastung / Leistungsort: 3-4 Tage pro Woche (insgesamt ca. 150 PT) / Berlin, Leipzig (mit regelmäßigen vor Ort Terminen an den jeweiligen Standorten)

Für dieses Projekt können nur sozialversicherungspflichtig angestellte Kandidaten (m/w/d) berücksichtigt werden!

Für Unseren Kunden Aus Dem Bereich Der Wirtschaftsprüfung Sind Wir Zum Nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Auf Der Suche Nach Einem Business & Data Analysten (m/w/d) Mit Folgenden Aufgaben


Analyse von Enterprise Architecture Schwerpunktthemen und Infrastrukturprojekten
Erfassen und Aufbereiten relevanter Informationen der jeweiligen Initiativen (IST- und SOLL-Zustand)
Durchführen von Requirements-Analysen, Ableiten zu bearbeitender Fragestellungen / Analysegegenstände
Verständliches Aufbereiten von großen Datenmengen in komplexen Themengebieten
Dokumentieren und Modellieren der jeweils für den Projekterfolg relevanten Business- und IT-Architekturen gemeinsam mit Architekten
Aufbau regelmäßiger Kommunikations- und Reportingstrukturen mit den Projekten
Erstellen von Entscheidungsvorlagen für die relevanten Gremien bei KPMG ITS, insbesondere C-Level Management
Aufbereiten und Konsolidieren von Business Case relevanten Daten in der Entscheidungsvorbereitung
Abstimmen und Reporting von Umsetzungsplanung und Roadmap der jeweiligen Schwerpunktthemen
Strukturierte datenbasierte Analyse und Bewertung von IT-Service- und Systemeigenschaften innerhalb der bestehenden Systemlandschaft
Aufbereiten von Zusammenhängen zwischen Business-Funktionen und IT-Komponenten mithilfe des Produkt- und Servicekatalogs (PSK)
Erstellen eines strukturierten Backlogs an möglichen Maßnahmen bzw. Handlungsfeldern zur Wiederverwendung bestehender IT-Services und Capabilities


Ihr Profil


umfangreiche Erfahrung in der Durchführung von Marktanalysen
Erfahrung in strukturierter Anforderungsanalyse bspw. als Projektleiter
Grundverständnis von ITSM / Service- und mehrwertorientierten IT-Betriebsmodellen zur Erbringung von Professional Services (Consulting, Audit, Tax)
Nachweislich praktische Erfahrung bei Systemanalysen sowie Modellierung und Design bei vergleichbaren Betriebsstrukturen und Transformationsaufgaben
Schnelle Auffassungsgabe, sich in bestehende IT-Systemarchitektur einzuarbeiten
Gute Kenntnisse in Modellierungssprachen (Visio, BPMN, etc.)
Mehrjähriger Erfahrung im DB und SQL-Umfeld
Vertrauter Umgang mit Tools wie Power BI, Alteryx und Tableau
Hohe Eigenständigkeit und Leistungsbereitschaft
Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Englisch und Deutsch
Erfahrung in erfolgreicher Projektorganisation
Ausgereifte Fähigkeit beim Visualisieren von komplexen Analyseergebnissen und Präsentationen


Firmenbeschreibung

None
Show more Show less
HTML:
Ihre Benefits

20% Remote Anteil

Ihre Aufgaben

Projektstart: asap

Projektdauer: 30.09.2023

Auslastung / Leistungsort: 3-4 Tage pro Woche (insgesamt ca. 150 PT) / Berlin, Leipzig (mit regelmäßigen vor Ort Terminen an den jeweiligen Standorten)

Für dieses Projekt können nur sozialversicherungspflichtig angestellte Kandidaten (m/w/d) berücksichtigt werden!

Für Unseren Kunden Aus Dem Bereich Der Wirtschaftsprüfung Sind Wir Zum Nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Auf Der Suche Nach Einem Business & Data Analysten (m/w/d) Mit Folgenden Aufgaben

  • Analyse von Enterprise Architecture Schwerpunktthemen und Infrastrukturprojekten
  • Erfassen und Aufbereiten relevanter Informationen der jeweiligen Initiativen (IST- und SOLL-Zustand)
  • Durchführen von Requirements-Analysen, Ableiten zu bearbeitender Fragestellungen / Analysegegenstände
  • Verständliches Aufbereiten von großen Datenmengen in komplexen Themengebieten
  • Dokumentieren und Modellieren der jeweils für den Projekterfolg relevanten Business- und IT-Architekturen gemeinsam mit Architekten
  • Aufbau regelmäßiger Kommunikations- und Reportingstrukturen mit den Projekten
  • Erstellen von Entscheidungsvorlagen für die relevanten Gremien bei KPMG ITS, insbesondere C-Level Management
  • Aufbereiten und Konsolidieren von Business Case relevanten Daten in der Entscheidungsvorbereitung
  • Abstimmen und Reporting von Umsetzungsplanung und Roadmap der jeweiligen Schwerpunktthemen
  • Strukturierte datenbasierte Analyse und Bewertung von IT-Service- und Systemeigenschaften innerhalb der bestehenden Systemlandschaft
  • Aufbereiten von Zusammenhängen zwischen Business-Funktionen und IT-Komponenten mithilfe des Produkt- und Servicekatalogs (PSK)
  • Erstellen eines strukturierten Backlogs an möglichen Maßnahmen bzw. Handlungsfeldern zur Wiederverwendung bestehender IT-Services und Capabilities

Ihr Profil

  • umfangreiche Erfahrung in der Durchführung von Marktanalysen
  • Erfahrung in strukturierter Anforderungsanalyse bspw. als Projektleiter
  • Grundverständnis von ITSM / Service- und mehrwertorientierten IT-Betriebsmodellen zur Erbringung von Professional Services (Consulting, Audit, Tax)
  • Nachweislich praktische Erfahrung bei Systemanalysen sowie Modellierung und Design bei vergleichbaren Betriebsstrukturen und Transformationsaufgaben
  • Schnelle Auffassungsgabe, sich in bestehende IT-Systemarchitektur einzuarbeiten
  • Gute Kenntnisse in Modellierungssprachen (Visio, BPMN, etc.)
  • Mehrjähriger Erfahrung im DB und SQL-Umfeld
  • Vertrauter Umgang mit Tools wie Power BI, Alteryx und Tableau
  • Hohe Eigenständigkeit und Leistungsbereitschaft
  • Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Englisch und Deutsch
  • Erfahrung in erfolgreicher Projektorganisation
  • Ausgereifte Fähigkeit beim Visualisieren von komplexen Analyseergebnissen und Präsentationen

Firmenbeschreibung

None

Title: Senior Analyst, Analytics & Insights
Description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart’s Analytics & Insights Team sits within Business Development, at the intersection of Instacart’s unparalleled grocery industry data and our most important grocery retail partners. Our grocery partnerships are at the core of our business, and this role is focused on leveraging data and analytics to influence business decision making, understand customer behavior, and drive growth of key company goals.

This Senior Analyst will strive to understand the dynamics of the marketplace through descriptive analysis, supporting the team in tackling ambiguous problems using data, and providing the both internal and external teams with the tools to answer “how did the business perform?” and “why did it perform that way?” You will be a subject matter expert on Instacart’s data and tools in order to efficiently answer key business questions and build sustainable solutions to enable stakeholders to progressively answer more and more of these questions on their own.

About The Job

Support Instacart’s largest retail partners in helping them make data-driven decisions
Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to understand their business and develop analysis, dashboards, and reporting to address their needs
Support internal teams with data that will help them best serve their accounts and strengthen the partnership across several key areas:
Identify opportunities for optimization and growth through the analysis of performance relative to peer benchmarks
Develop data-driven business cases to help expand Instacart’s retail partnerships
Monitor operational performance to ensure consistently excellent service for Instacart’s end customers
Help prepare for weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews
Become a subject matter expert in Instacart’s data and tools:
Immerse yourself in Instacart’s vast database and extract relevant datasets using SQL
Develop low-touch, self-serve reporting for both internal and external teams
Understand the data needs of both internal and external teams and, where appropriate, get those requirements on the roadmap for the scalable solutions being developed by other people on our team

About You

3+ years work experience in a quantitative role. This is a great opportunity for those with experience in Consulting, Banking, Analytics, or similar roles. Experience with retail and e-commerce is a plus
Advanced SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools experience required
Flexible and adaptable; collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand their goals and tailor your approach accordingly
Resourceful; ability to find answers to tough questions (especially data-related) by tracking down the right data and stakeholders
Thinking sustainably and building for scale; develop long-term solutions to recurring problems
Strong analytical skills; ability to logically break down complex problems and identify potential pitfalls
Ability to effectively manage multiple key stakeholder relationships, both internal and external, and provide guidance on more efficient approaches as needed

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart’s Analytics & Insights Team sits within Business Development, at the intersection of Instacart’s rich grocery industry data and our grocery retail partners. Our grocery partnerships are at the core of Instacart’s business model, and our retail partners' success is of paramount importance to us. This role is focused on building industry leading market intelligence reporting and analytics to help Instacart and its retail partners make better strategic and tactical business decisions. This is a highly impactful role that will engage in building solutions with visibility to the Instacart Executive team as well as to leading largest North American retailers.

As this Senior Analyst you will be responsible for a wide range of tasks such as defining data requirements, running descriptive analysis, designing and building dashboards, and preparing in-depth “so-what” analysis and business recommendations. You will be able to build high-level and scalable solutions as well as have the ability to dive deeper into the data to uncover actionable insights.

About The Job

Serve as a Subject Matter Expert on the grocery e-commerce industry, developing market intelligence reports by leveraging internal and 3rd party data
Be responsible for the development, maintenance, and documentation of market intelligence metrics, including the understanding and structuring of 3rd party data, creation of new data models and analytics layers, and construction of complex yet concise dashboards
Work closely with cross-functional teams to contribute to the development of periodic market intelligence reports by providing relevant and compelling insights on market and competitive trends
Work closely with the Business Development team to understand their requirements and create compelling visual dashboards, reports, and presentations
Lead data investigations to better understand retailer performance in relation to market trends
Adhere to best practices in reporting and analysis, including data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation

About You

3+ years of experience in an analytics and business intelligence role
Strong analytical skills and ability to leverage data to identify trends and influence business decisions
Advanced proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools, particularly Tableau
Ability to quickly respond to problems independently, consider all stakeholder needs, and provide clear, concise answers to complex data
Excellent communication skills and ability to manage multiple stakeholder groups
Experience with dbt or other data transformation tools is a plus
Bachelor's degree or equivalent is required

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

Title: Cloud Platform Analytics Engineer
Description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

Cloud Platform Analytics Engineer

Job location: Ottawa-Hybrid, Other Canadian locations- Remote

Additional requirements: Candidates must meet Controlled Goods Program Requirements.

We are seeking an experienced Cloud Platform Analytics Engineer to join our dynamic team as a key player driving Kinaxis’ Cloud Analytics strategy.

As a key contributor to the Cloud Platform Analytics & Observability team, the successful candidate will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our cloud analytics infrastructure while also ensuring cost-effective usage of cloud resources. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and implement data pipelines, data warehousing solutions, and data analytics systems to support business-critical decision making.

Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain cloud-based data pipelines to process data from various sources
Implement and maintain data warehousing solutions using cloud platforms such as GCP and Azure.
Develop and maintain data analytics systems to support data-driven decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and design data analytics solutions
Monitor performance and optimize cloud infrastructure systems for efficiency and scalability
Design and deliver reports and dashboards with executive visibility
Extract data and perform reporting/ad-hoc analyses/deep dives to support business needs
Collaborate on KPIs and metrics to monitor and run the business and build reports using them
Ensure cost-effective usage of cloud resources through the implementation of best practices in FinOps
Stay up-to-date with the latest cloud technologies and trends

Requirements

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
5+ years of experience as a Cloud Analytics Engineer or related role
Strong knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure
Strong knowledge of FinOps and the ability to implement cost-saving strategies in the cloud
Experience with data warehousing solutions such as Snowflake, Redshift, or BigQuery
Experience with relational databases such as SQL Server or Postgres
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and data analytics tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker
Strong knowledge of FinOps and the ability to implement cost-saving strategies in the cloud
Experience with REST APIs as a data source
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong attention to detail
A keen eye for good design

What Will Set You Apart

An understanding of public cloud infrastructure along with performance metrics
An ability to think critically
Experience with observability tools, such as Datadog.

What we have to offer

Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.
Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.

For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at recruitmentprograms@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

Title: Staff Cloud Developer
Description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

Staff Cloud Developer, Platform Engineering

Job location: Ottawa-Hybrid, Other Canadian locations- Remote

Additional requirements: Candidates must meet Controlled Goods Program Requirements.

About The Team

Imperative Orchestration, Declarative Automation - The Platform Engineering Team is responsible for building and running a cloud platform that enables delivery teams to self-service deployments with reduced lead time and complexity. We also provide cloud services and tools that enable internal development teams to build, test and deploy their applications using modern platform tooling like Git CI/CD pipelines, Terraform and Kubernetes delivery via ArgoCD. These same tools we leverage to ensure our customer environments are automated and continuously up to date. We are passionate about code and the power of automation to simplify complex processes.

As a Staff Cloud Developer in platform engineering, you will be a part of our team that provides the infrastructure, core capabilities and expertise to enable our product teams to deliver at pace and build a platform for hosting Kinaxis SaaS offerings. We have a strong engineering culture, focused on steady, correct delivery, with a cloud-first approach. We are rapidly growing, supercharging the team that powers our developer & application platform.

What You Will Do

Apply software engineering principles to application and operations challenges with a focus on automation and self-healing.
Collaborate with teams across the enterprise to uncover pain points and formulate ways to accelerate delivery.
Adopt existing Reference Architectures and their implementations; contribute to the design of new Reference Architectures.
Deliver cloud reference architectures to be used by teams across the enterprise as they work to modernize existing technologies and build new capabilities to deliver to Customers.
Provide an exceptional experience to our development and operations teams, with a focus on self-service using modern approaches.
Investigate new system solutions to enhance application delivery experiences through innovative experiments or Proof of Concept.
Build and manage, stable & secure cloud automation using cloud orchestration capabilities, scripting languages and APIs to design, code, test, implement and support Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
Lead team members in achieving professional excellence utilizing industry best practices.
Advise and maintain a feedback loop with development and operations teams to ensure deliveries are in accordance with needs and expectations.
Function as a go-to tech lead for pinpointing challenges and finding creative solutions.
Prioritize projects/tasks according to company needs and expectations.
Lead team code reviews and design reviews.

What We Are Looking For

Bachelor’s/Master's degree in Engineering with specialization in Computer Science or related discipline or demonstrated equivalent experience.
8 years of experience with architecture and deployment of Cloud Services.
5 years of experience with Infrastructure and Platform engineering for high availability and scalable architectures in the cloud.
5 years of experience with public cloud platforms (both console and API) like GCP, Azure or AWS
Strong knowledge of system design to manage operational and reliability trade-offs.
Extensive experience developing in Go, Python and Shell/Bash.
Proven practical experience in building and managing:
Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
Configuration management tools (Ansible)
CI/CD solutions (Git, GitOps, Argo CD)
Containers and orchestrators (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
System monitoring and centralized logging platforms (Datadog, Prometheus, ELK)
Practical understanding of agile methodologies and Scrum.
Ability to share knowledge with others in the company.
In-depth and proactive communication and documentation skills.
Initiative and ability to work independently, and as part of a team.
Ability to use a wide variety of open-source technologies.

What we have to offer

Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.
Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.

HTML:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

Staff Cloud Developer, Platform Engineering

Job location: Ottawa-Hybrid, Other Canadian locations- Remote

Additional requirements: Candidates must meet Controlled Goods Program Requirements.

About The Team

Imperative Orchestration, Declarative Automation - The Platform Engineering Team is responsible for building and running a cloud platform that enables delivery teams to self-service deployments with reduced lead time and complexity. We also provide cloud services and tools that enable internal development teams to build, test and deploy their applications using modern platform tooling like Git CI/CD pipelines, Terraform and Kubernetes delivery via ArgoCD. These same tools we leverage to ensure our customer environments are automated and continuously up to date. We are passionate about code and the power of automation to simplify complex processes.

As a Staff Cloud Developer in platform engineering, you will be a part of our team that provides the infrastructure, core capabilities and expertise to enable our product teams to deliver at pace and build a platform for hosting Kinaxis SaaS offerings. We have a strong engineering culture, focused on steady, correct delivery, with a cloud-first approach. We are rapidly growing, supercharging the team that powers our developer & application platform.

What You Will Do
  • Apply software engineering principles to application and operations challenges with a focus on automation and self-healing.
  • Collaborate with teams across the enterprise to uncover pain points and formulate ways to accelerate delivery.
  • Adopt existing Reference Architectures and their implementations; contribute to the design of new Reference Architectures.
  • Deliver cloud reference architectures to be used by teams across the enterprise as they work to modernize existing technologies and build new capabilities to deliver to Customers.
  • Provide an exceptional experience to our development and operations teams, with a focus on self-service using modern approaches.
  • Investigate new system solutions to enhance application delivery experiences through innovative experiments or Proof of Concept.
  • Build and manage, stable & secure cloud automation using cloud orchestration capabilities, scripting languages and APIs to design, code, test, implement and support Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
  • Lead team members in achieving professional excellence utilizing industry best practices.
  • Advise and maintain a feedback loop with development and operations teams to ensure deliveries are in accordance with needs and expectations.
  • Function as a go-to tech lead for pinpointing challenges and finding creative solutions.
  • Prioritize projects/tasks according to company needs and expectations.
  • Lead team code reviews and design reviews.
What We Are Looking For
  • Bachelor’s/Master's degree in Engineering with specialization in Computer Science or related discipline or demonstrated equivalent experience.
  • 8 years of experience with architecture and deployment of Cloud Services.
  • 5 years of experience with Infrastructure and Platform engineering for high availability and scalable architectures in the cloud.
  • 5 years of experience with public cloud platforms (both console and API) like GCP, Azure or AWS
  • Strong knowledge of system design to manage operational and reliability trade-offs.
  • Extensive experience developing in Go, Python and Shell/Bash.
  • Proven practical experience in building and managing:
    • Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
    • Configuration management tools (Ansible)
    • CI/CD solutions (Git, GitOps, Argo CD)
    • Containers and orchestrators (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
    • System monitoring and centralized logging platforms (Datadog, Prometheus, ELK)
  • Practical understanding of agile methodologies and Scrum.
  • Ability to share knowledge with others in the company.
  • In-depth and proactive communication and documentation skills.
  • Initiative and ability to work independently, and as part of a team.
  • Ability to use a wide variety of open-source technologies.
What we have to offer
  • Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.
  • Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
  • Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
  • Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.
For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Title: Cloud Platform Integration Engineer, ServiceNow
Description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

Cloud Platform Integration Engineer

Job location: Ottawa-Hybrid, Other Canadian locations- Remote

Additional requirements: Candidates must meet Controlled Goods Program Requirements.

We are seeking a highly motivated, results-driven individual to join our dynamic team as a key player in driving Kinaxis’ Cloud Platform implementations, with an initial focus on ServiceNow.

As a key contributor to the Cloud Platform Analytics & Observability team, the successful candidate will be a strategic thinker with strong problem-solving skills and a track record of driving measurable outcomes.

This role requires a strong ability to pivot and adapt to changing business needs in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication skills, a customer-centric approach and a passion for driving continuous improvement. If you are a creative, analytically driven and collaborative team player with a proven track record of driving results and you are looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity, we encourage you to apply for this exciting role!

What You Will Do

Configure, implement and maintain the ServiceNow system. This includes the management of workflows, user roles and access, integrations, CMDB.
Identify, implement and drive automation in ServiceNow and other platforms within Cloud Services.
Plan for future customer additions to our platforms.
Integrate our current platforms with external service providers to drive operational automation, efficiency and excellence.
Work with both Kinaxis IT and external partners to manage the roadmap for introducing new system integration points and automation processes for our platforms, including ServiceNow.
Manage the introduction of new Services into ServiceNow, as part of the ITOM Service Mapping module
Create, maintain, and update documentation.
Maintain an effective and efficient CMDB using the ServiceNow ITOM module, ensuring it is current, accurate, and stable.
Configure catalog items and their associated workflows within ServiceNow.
Monitor health, usage, and overall compliance of the ServiceNow ITOM implementation
Work with IT, to test and install updates and new releases to our platforms, including ServiceNow.
Create, maintain, and enhance team dashboards, analytics, and reporting.
Ensure operational integrity of workflows and configurations.
Advise on features and functionality.
Participate in cross-functional working teams comprised of stakeholders from IT, Project Management Office (PMO), and other business practice groups.
Commit to the continuous improvement, and learning development of ServiceNow best practices, tools, and technology.
Extract data and perform reporting/ad-hoc analyses/deep dives to support the business teams across Kinaxis.
Support ServiceNow lifecycle development processes as needed, which includes, but is not limited to capturing business requirement definitions (BRD/user stories), creating functional requirement definitions (FRD), technical design documents (TDD), and running user acceptance testing (UAT)
Collaborate on the KPIs and metrics to monitor and run the business and build reports/dashboards using them
Evangelize our ServiceNow offering within Kinaxis and promote user adoption.

Qualifications

ServiceNow System Administrator certification. A specific focus on the ServiceNow ITOM module, including Service Mapping expertise is a plus. (Other ServiceNow certifications and training are also a plus)
Four or more years of related experience 
3-5 years’ experience with ServiceNow implementation and administration
Hardware and Software asset management experience
Overarching understanding of ServiceNow’s Enterprise product suite.
Hands-on experience in technical solution design, software specifications, conceptualization, and development.
Be highly organized, professional, friendly, and articulate in your communication and troubleshooting skills.

What Will Set You Apart

An understanding of public cloud infrastructure
Attention to detail with a keen eye for good design
A working knowledge of data analytics and SQL
Scripting experience with Python and/or Powershell

What we have to offer

Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.
Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.

For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at recruitmentprograms@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

Title: Principal Performance Engineer
Description:
Mimecast is looking for an experienced Principal Performance Engineer who will be responsible for working with the Architecture and Engineering teams to deliver performance improvement across our whole platform.




The ideal candidate will be someone who possesses excellent problem-solving skills, and excellent understanding of how complex systems interact, an excellent communicator with a strong continuous improvement mindset.




Objective




Work with fellow architects, engineering leads and product managers to improve the performance, scalability and resilience of Mimecast Cloud-based systems. You will be hands on helping to improve the design, testing and monitoring of our applications and infrastructure.




Requirements




10+ years of Performance Engineering/Testing/Software development; BS/MS or related/comparable
Expertise with Java or similar languages
Experience with Performance Engineering tools – JMeter, LoadRunner, JProfiler, APM etc
Experience of high volume, scalable, distributed systems
Provide vision and leadership enabling teams to own performance engineering in their areas
Ensure that non-functional requirements are well defined and understood by the responsible teams
Design and implement performance & resilience tests across Mimecast services to increase understanding of how our services perform under positive and negative conditions
Excellent verbal and written communication
Document and communicate test results and identify performance & resilience issues
Keep abreast of the latest open-source and commercial tools to provide improved monitoring and testing




Desirable




Experience of rolling out an automated performance test suite across an organization
Experience commercial or open-source chaos testing tools (e.g. Gremlin, ChaosMonkey etc)
Experience with APM/distributed tracing tools, either open-source (e.g. Jaeger) or commercial (e.g. Dynatrace/Datadog)
Working with PostgreSQL, Redis, or similar
Detailed knowledge of TLS, TCP/IP, SMTP
Experience with container/orchestration technology




Character




Hands-on problem solving with a willingness to do whatever it takes to complete an objective
The ability to identify when to escalate or look for help on an issue
The drive and confidence to own a task from start to finish
The discipline to manage their own time and priorities, without the need for micro-management
The flexibility to adapt to a constantly changing landscape
A passion for technology beyond what is required to perform their daily tasks




Why Mimecast?




We’re fast thinking. We go big to reach our cyberattack-disrupting goals. And we do what we need to protect the world of business from getting important (and potentially compromising) data stolen. We never leave anyone behind. We deliver quickly – and outstandingly. We’re big on honesty because it makes us better. We’re empowered by our mission. And if cybercriminals have a good day, we work twice as hard to make the rest of their days a nightmare. That’s The Mimecast Way.




And the Mimecast way is also a hybrid-working way. We empower our people to balance their time between home and the office in a way that works best for them, their team, and our stakeholders.




Become a Mimecaster and put corporate data under your protection. Fill our teams with respect. And bring cybercrime-obstructing energy to your work. Be passionate. Be powerful. Be alive with purpose.




DEI Statement




Cybersecurity is a community effort. That’s why we’re committed to building an inclusive, diverse community that celebrates and welcomes everyone – unless they’re a cybercriminal, of course.




We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and we’d encourage you to join us whatever your background. We particularly welcome applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups.




We consider everyone equally: your race, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ability, marital status, nationality, or any other protected characteristic won’t affect your application.




Due to certain obligations to our customers, an offer of employment will be subject to your successful completion of applicable background checks, conducted in accordance with local law.




In an effort to protect the health and resilience of our global community, Mimecast requires all individuals to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 and/or receive a negative test before entry into our offices.

Title: Staff Site Reliability Engineer
Description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

We Are Currently Looking For

Staff Site Reliability Engineer, Production Engineering

Job location: Ottawa -Hybrid, Other Canadian Locations-Remote

Additional requirements: Candidates must meet Controlled Goods Program Requirements.

About The Team

The Site Reliability Engineering team is responsible for the delivery, management, and monitoring of Kinaxis products and cloud infrastructure in our production offerings. We are responsible for ensuring service availability and performance to our customers globally, 7x24x365. We develop automation geared towards production operations using modern platform tooling like Git CI/CD pipelines, Terraform, ArgoCD and Ansible.

What You Will Do

Deliver customer excellence, making sure we meet all SLAs.
Apply software engineering principles to operational challenges with a focus on automation, self-healing and monitoring solutions.
Translate architectural, technical and feature changes into operational plans.
Advise and maintain a feedback loop with development and operations teams to ensure deliveries are in accordance with needs and expectations.
Deliver cloud reference architectures to be used by teams across the enterprise as they work to modernize existing technologies and build new capabilities to deliver to Customers.
Develop and manage cloud automation using cloud orchestration capabilities, scripting languages and APIs to design, code, test, implement and support production services.
Participate in an on-call rotation to investigate incidents and provide root causes relating to production infrastructure, services and applications.
Lead team members in achieving professional excellence utilizing industry best practices.

What We Are Looking For
Bachelor’s/Master's degree in Engineering with specialization in Computer Science or related discipline or demonstrated equivalent experience.
Prior experience in a site reliability engineering role.
8 years of experience with deployment and monitoring of distributed systems.
5 years of experience with infrastructure and deployment of Cloud Services.
5 years of experience with Infrastructure and Platform engineering for high availability and scalable architectures in the cloud.
5 years of experience with public cloud platforms (both console and API) like GCP, Azure or AWS
Strong knowledge of system design to manage operational and reliability trade-offs.
Extensive experience developing in Python, Go and Shell/Bash.
Proven practical experience in building and managing:
Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
Configuration management tools (Ansible)
CI/CD solutions (Git, GitOps, Argo CD)
Containers and orchestrators (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
System monitoring and centralized logging platforms (Datadog, Prometheus, ELK)
Practical understanding of agile methodologies and Scrum.
Ability to share knowledge with others in the company.
In-depth and proactive communication and documentation skills.
Initiative and ability to work independently, and as part of a team.
Ability to use a wide variety of open-source technologies.

What we have to offer

Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.
Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.

For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at recruitmentprograms@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.
